title: Lifetime chance for youngsters: Anand on 100-day countdown to Chess Olympiad
body: Marking the 100-day countdown for 44th Chess Olympiad, to be held in Chennai, on Monday, five-time world chess champion Viswanathan Anand said the tournament is a life-time opportunity for youngsters to catch a glimpse of their idols. "Watch them play and possibly interact with them," he added. The Olympiad will be held from July 28 to August 10.

title: We shot with 100+ dogs, it was really challenging: Arun Vijay on 'Oh My Dog'
body: While talking about 'Oh My Dog', actor Arun Vijay said it was "really challenging" to work with so many dogs at same time. "I think we shot with nearly 100+ dogs...Having said that...they seemed to have way more fun than...entire cast and crew...Hats off to Raja, the trainer...and our director Sarov to ensure that everything went on smoothly," he added.

title: Bihar govt makes arrangements to quickly ferry kids with AES for treatment
body: Bihar government has made arrangements of linking an auto-rickshaw with every panchayat to quickly ferry children suffering from acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) to the nearest health facility, officials said on Monday. The arrangements have been made across 12 districts. According to Additional Director (Health), an ambulance has also been attached to every PHC to transport patients.

title: Barrage of Western sanctions against Russia failed: Prez Putin
body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday claimed that the barrage of Western sanctions against Russia has failed. The West "expected to quickly upset the financial-economic situation, provoke panic in the markets, the collapse of the banking system and shortages in stores", he said. He also claimed that the sanctions have backfired on the West with a sharp rise in inflation.

title: It was a minor incident: Police on fresh stone-pelting in Jahangirpuri
body: The fresh stone-pelting in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where a communal violence broke out on Saturday, was a minor and one-off incident, police said on Monday. "Legal action is being taken. One person has been detained," it added. Police had earlier said that family members of an accused pelted two stones at a team when they went to question them.

title: Assam authorities alert districts to be prepared to tackle floods
body: The government of Assam has started the preparations to deal with the flood situation and alerted all the districts to be ready as well. "We have identified locations based on the last 10 years' flood data [and]...identified 11 circles that are spread over five districts that receive floods almost every year," CEO of Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.

title: Heatwave pushes Delhi's power demand to 5,735 MW, highest ever in April
body: The peak power demand in Delhi on Tuesday rose to 5,735 MW, which is the highest ever in the month of April, after unabated heatwave in the city, discom officials said. Delhi's peak power demand had touched 4,469 MW on April 1. The national capital's previous high power demand was recorded at 5,664 MW on April 30, 2019, officials added.

title: Ashwin said 'I was too busy in shoots', then bowled 3 hours in nets: Kaif
body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has praised RR spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, stating that the 35-year-old is a "genuine wicket-taker, who keeps adding new things". "Ashwin was with me at DC...and I remember...[a] game at the Wankhede [where] he leaked many runs...He felt he was too busy in shoots...[and then] bowled for almost three hours in the nets," recalled Kaif.

title: Expecting method acting in commercial films is dumb: Nawazuddin
body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui in an interview has stated if you expect to use method acting in commercial films, then you are dumb. He further said that such films are for fun and the audience comes to enjoy. "If you...dissect my performances, maybe you'll find a lot of flaws. But if you take it as pure fun, one would...enjoy," Nawazuddin added.

title: Byculla Zoo sees 50,000 visitors over long weekend, collects ₹24 lakh
body: Nearly 50,000 people visited the Byculla Zoo in Mumbai over the long weekend and it earned a revenue of over ₹24 lakh, officials said. Around 20,478 people came to the zoo on Sunday alone. The zoo, which is open from 9.30 am to 5 pm on all days, charges an entry fee of ₹50 per person.

title: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö tests positive for COVID-19
body: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö has tested positive for COVID-19, his office said in a statement on Tuesday. "Despite the infection, President Niinistö is well and continuing to work remotely," it added. Niinistö's official visit to Norway to discuss the conflict in Ukraine and European security from April 21 to 22 has been postponed.

title: FPIs turn net sellers again, withdraw ₹4,500 cr between Apr 8-15
body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) turned net sellers again after withdrawing ₹4,500 crore between April 8-15. FPIs had been net sellers for six months between October 2021 and March 2022 and had turned net buyers between April 1-8 with an investment of ₹7,707 crore. Apart from equities, FPIs withdrew net ₹415 crore from the debt markets last week.

title: Govt amends FEMA rules to allow up to 20% FDI in IPO-bound LIC
body: The government has amended the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) to allow up to 20% foreign direct investment (FDI) in state-run LIC through the automatic route. "Foreign investment in LIC shall be subject to the provisions of...Life Insurance Corporation Act, 1956," a gazette notification said. The development comes ahead of LIC's IPO, expected to be India's biggest-ever public issue.

title: When I first saw Umran bowl, he reminded me of Waqar: Irfan Pathan
body: Recalling when he first saw Umran Malik bowl, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has said that the 22-year-old reminded him of former Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis. Umran was noticed by Irfan when they were part of the Jammu and Kashmir team. Irfan was a player and mentor in the team. Later, Umran made his IPL debut in 2021 for SunRisers Hyderabad.

title: I don't own a home, I stay at friends' places: World's richest man Elon Musk
body: Elon Musk, the world's richest person with a net worth of over $250 billion, said, "I don't even own a home right now...I'm literally staying at friends' places." He added, "If I travel to the Bay Area, which is where most of Tesla engineering is, I basically rotate through friends' spare bedrooms." Musk also said, "I don't have a yacht."

title: Hyderabad's 216-year-old heritage monument to be reopened for public in May
body: The 216-year-old British Residency in Hyderabad will be reopened for the public in May, state Archaeology Minister V Srinivas Goud announced. According to the local heritage activists, since 2013, the monument was undergoing restoration work which was taken up by the World Monuments Fund. Notably, the residency served as a seat of power for the British in Hyderabad before independence.

title: Fire breaks out at powerhouse in Ghaziabad; fire tenders rushed to spot
body: A fire broke out at Niti Khand Indirapuram's powerhouse on Tuesday. Ghaziabad Police informed that local police, fire department are on the spot and efforts are on to bring the fire under control. In another incident, a fire broke out at a shop in West Delhi's Kirti Nagar furniture market on Tuesday, ANI reported, citing Delhi Fire Service officials.

title: 22-yr-old techie's laptop catches fire in Andhra, she suffers 80% burns
body: A 22-year-old software engineer from Andhra Pradesh suffered around 80% burns after the laptop she was working on triggered a fire, police said. The incident took place on Monday when sparks from Sumalatha's laptop, which was being charged, caused a fire that spread rapidly in her room. As per a preliminary probe, the fire originated from the laptop's charger adapter.

title: Will continue to respond strongly to wilful misconduct: Sequoia
body: Sequoia Capital on Sunday said it'll continue to respond strongly to wilful misconduct or fraud. "We will take tough calls where needed in the interest of doing what is right...We will continue to have zero tolerance towards proven wrongdoing," it added. Sequoia is the largest shareholder in fintech firm BharatPe and owns a stake in CoinSwitch and CredAvenue, among others.

title: Man demands change of Indian flag at Bengaluru station, tags city police
body: A Twitter user has demanded changing of the Indian flag at the KSR Bengaluru Railway Station. "The flag appears to be damaged at the top," he wrote in his tweet. The Bengaluru Police replied to his tweet saying that they have forwarded his concern to the South Western Railway for any necessary action to be taken.

title: Just 1 or 2 days in office ideal for hybrid work: Harvard Business School study
body: Just one or two days in the office is the ideal setup for hybrid work, according to a paper from Harvard Business School. "Intermediate hybrid work is plausibly the sweet spot...where workers enjoy flexibility and yet aren't as isolated compared to peers who are predominantly working from home," it said. "Hybrid work is associated with improved worker outcomes," it added.

title: World Bank cuts global growth forecast to 3.2% due to Ukraine war
body: World Bank President David Malpass on Monday said the bank has cut its global growth forecast for 2022 from 4.1% to 3.2% owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. Forecasts are being cut for advanced and many developing economies because of spikes in food, energy prices, Malpass said. World Bank is also proposing a new, 15-month crisis financing target of $170 billion.

title: These are all rumours: Jubin Nautiyal on dating Nikita Dutta
body: Singer Jubin Nautiyal has said that the reports of him dating actress Nikita Dutta are just rumours. "Nikita is a very, very dear friend of mine," he added. Jubin further said though his parents remained unfazed by the rumours, he had to spend a considerable amount of time explaining to his relatives that he hadn't gotten secretly engaged to Nikita.

title: Wanted to improve quality of sleep: Richa on physical transformation
body: Richa Chadha, speaking about her physical transformation, has said, "I wanted to become healthier, overall. I wanted the quality of my sleep, movement, exercise and mobility to improve." She further stated, "Too much exercise can damage your insides and be counter-productive to your effort." Richa added that rest is "underrated" but very important for the body.

title: Sonia meets Prashant Kishor at her residence, 3rd meeting in 1 week
body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday again met political strategist Prashant Kishor at her residence in Delhi. This is their third meeting in a week amid reports of Kishor joining Congress ahead of Assembly polls later this year and the Lok Sabha elections in 2024. Senior Congress leaders Digvijaya Singh, KC Venugopal, Ambika Soni and Randeep Surjewala attended the meeting.

title: GB Nagar reports 107 new COVID cases; 33 children among those infected
body: Gautam Buddha Nagar reported 107 new cases of COVID-19 and zero deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the health bulletin issued on Tuesday. Of the 107 cases, 33 are school students who have tested positive for the virus, PTI quoted Chief Medical Officer Sunil Kumar Sharma as saying. Now, the active COVID-19 cases in the district reached 411.

title: Delhi Police arrests 5 of a family over Jahangirpuri violence
body: Delhi Police arrested five people and apprehended one minor of the same family in connection with the Jahangirpuri violence that took place in Delhi on the occasion of Hanuman Jayanti. "My husband ran away...to save his life," the wife of an accused said. As many as 23 people have been arrested and two juveniles have been apprehended so far.

title: Security situation in J&K is far better than before: DGP
body: The Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh said that the security situation in the Union Territory is "far better than before". "The security situation is far better...and counter-insurgency operations are being carried out successfully on a daily basis," the DGP said. "There is no doubt that terror elements are doing their actions but those involved...(are) neutralised soon," he added.

title: I'll buy bulldozer someday, demolish stone-pelters' houses: Pundit Dhirendra
body: Pundit Dhirendra Krishna Shastri of Bageshwar Dham has reportedly urged Hindus to "demolish houses of stone-pelters". "Wake up, cowards! Demolish the houses of stone-pelters otherwise they'll come for you next," he said, adding, "If they pelt stones at your house, you bulldoze their houses. I'll also buy a bulldozer someday and demolish the houses of those stone-pelters."

title: CIA arrests 2 persons with pistol, live cartridges in Mohali
body: The Crime Investigation Agency (CIA) of Mohali district police arrested two persons and recovered a .315 bore pistol and two live cartridges from them. The accused allegedly came to the city to commit a crime. The police suspect that they could have links with some of the gangs operating in the state. Both the accused belong to the Hoshiarpur district.

title: Cryptocurrency Ponzi scheme busted in Bengaluru, 4 arrested
body: The Bengaluru Crime Branch arrested four people for their alleged involvement in running a Helium Crypto Token (HNT) through a mobile application. Around ₹15 crore was routed through 44 different bank accounts among other items, the police said. "₹78 lakh in cash, 44 Digital Signature Certificate tokens, five company seals, mobile phones, and laptops were seized," they added.

title: Was signed as lead in 'Kumkum Bhagya', was very adamant to play it: Mrunal
body: Actress Mrunal Thakur said she was signed to play the lead role in the television serial 'Kumkum Bhagya' and that she was very adamant to play it. "I realised it didn't matter because I still won immense popularity...What matters is what impact you leave on audience...whosoever is the lead character...at times, other characters are ones with more drama," she added.

title: UP govt allots land, houses to 63 Hindu families displaced from Bangladesh
body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Tuesday allotted houses, agricultural land and residential plots to 63 Hindu families, displaced from East Pakistan, now called Bangladesh, in the 1970s. A total of 65 families were to be given rehabilitation after the yarn mill they were working in was closed in 1984. "Your 38-year-long wait is over today," CM Yogi Adityanath said.

title: No one realised how big IPL was going to become: Brendon McCullum
body: Recalling the first-ever IPL match in 2008, Brendon McCullum said no one realised how big the tournament was going to become. McCullum played for KKR in the first-ever match and scored an unbeaten 158 runs. Talking about his knock, he said, "It took me eight balls to start." McCullum remains the only KKR batter to score a century in IPL.

title: B'luru Whitefield area to face power cuts from 10 am-5 pm till Thurs
body: Bengaluru's Whitefield area will witness power interruptions till Thursday (April 21) due to the cabling work by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited. According to BESCOM, the areas will face power cuts from 10 am to 5 pm. The affected areas include Channasandra, VSR layout, Koralur, Hosahalli, Prithvi Layout, Whitefield Main road, Upkar Layout, Prashanth Layout and Swami Vivekananda Road.

title: Dejected parties taking refuge in vote bank, divisive politics: Nadda
body: Reacting to Opposition parties' joint statement criticising Centre over incidents of communal violence, BJP President JP Nadda said, Opposition is "casting aspersions on our hardworking citizens". Unfortunately, this thrust towards development politics is being bitterly resisted by "rejected and dejected parties" which are "once again taking refuge in vote bank and divisive politics", he added.

title: Chef found part of Depp's finger in kitchen: Doctor on actor's fight with Heard
body: Amid Johnny Depp's defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard, the actor's doctor said that a chef found part of Depp's finger in the kitchen, where the two were fighting. Depp told hospital workers he cut himself with a knife, the doctor said. Earlier, Depp said Heard threw a vodka bottle at him, which led to the finger getting cut off.

title: Tried slowing him down but he went harder: Ponting on McCullum's 158*
body: Talking about ex-KKR opener Brendon McCullum's 158* in the first-ever IPL match in 2008, Ricky Ponting who batted at the number three position for KKR in that match said he tried asking McCullum to bat slower. "McCullum...[went] harder and harder and ended up playing an incredible innings," added Ponting. McCullum's 158* comprised 10 fours and 13 sixes.

title: Microsoft joins e-commerce platform Udaan's $225 million debt round
body: E-commerce platform Udaan on Monday said Microsoft Corporation has joined its $225 million fundraising through sale of convertible debt. In an email to employees, Udaan CFO Aditya Pande said the firm's plan of mandatorily convertible notes to IPO highlights Udaan's capital strategy's evolution. The notes will be converted into equity when Udaan raises funds next or during its planned IPO.

title: Noida parents protest school fee hike by polishing shoes
body: A group of parents in Greater Noida on Sunday polished shoes on the roadside as a symbolic gesture to protest against the hike in fees by private schools. The protest comes despite a UP government order that allowed the schools to hike their fees. The protestors have appealed to the CM to withdraw the order to make education more accessible.

title: Nani marks 3yrs of National Award-winning 'Jersey', shares deleted scene
body: Telugu actor Nani on Tuesday celebrated three years since the release of his National Award-winning film 'Jersey' by sharing a deleted scene from the film. The actor wrote, "This was one of (director) Gowtam Tinnanuri's favourite but couldn't make it to the cut." The scene depicts Nani's character being offered money by his wife's father and being called a loser.

title: NamasteyNFT to host Web3-based exhibition event in Bengaluru
body: NamasteyNFT, a group that claims to support artists and creators, will host a two-day event to be held at Bangalore International Exhibition Centre from May 14 to 15. "The event will witness a confluence of artists, developers and collectors from Web3," said NamasteyNFT spokesperson. The event is expected to have workshops on Web3, cyber security and wallet safety.

title: Sleeper cells trained by police: Kerala BJP Vice President on RSS worker’s killing
body: Kerala BJP Vice President KS Radhakrishnan claimed that there are "sleeper cells" in the police force receiving training from police and armed forces. His remark came after an RSS worker was killed in Palakkad. "Primary duty of the state is to protect the life and property of citizens. But a murder happened within the vicinity of the police," Radhakrishnan added.

title: RR's Prasidh Krishna and KKR's Aaron Finch involved in verbal fight, video goes viral
body: RR pacer Prasidh Krishna and KKR opener Aaron Finch were involved in a verbal exchange after the latter got out in their IPL 2022 match on Monday. Krishna was seen giving Finch a send-off after which the Australian said something to him. Finch was dismissed for 58(28) on last ball of KKR's ninth over. Krishna registered bowling figures of 4-0-43-1.

title: 5 labourers from Bengal suffocate to death at K'taka fish processing unit
body: Five labourers from West Bengal suffocated to death at a fish processing unit in Karnataka's Mangaluru. The incident took place when one of them went inside a 20-foot-deep waste water tank to clean it and got stuck. After he screamed for help, other labourers rushed to help him, but failed. Three of the labourers have been hospitalised for further treatment.

title: NASA shares picture of sunrise on Mars
body: NASA has shared a picture of the sunrise on Mars captured by its InSight lander. "On April 10, 2022, the 1198th sol (or Martian day) of its mission, our InSight lander took this photo of Martian dawn on the plains of Elysium Planitia," NASA said. InSight is NASA's first mission to study the interior of Mars in depth.

title: Karthik can be used as a finisher in the upcoming T20 WC: Gavaskar
body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said that RCB batter Dinesh Karthik can play the finisher's role for India in this year's T20 World Cup. "He's (Karthik) just changing the complexion of the game with his performance. He's doing the job that you can expect him to do at number 6 or 7 at the (T20) World Cup," Gavaskar said.

title: We need him in India colours asap, he & Bumrah will terrify the Angrez: Tharoor on Umran
body: Referring to SRH pacer Umran Malik, who clocks 150-kmph mark regularly, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "We need him in India colours asap. What a phenomenal talent." He added, "Blood him before he burns out...Take him to England for the Test match greentop. He and Bumrah bowling in tandem will terrify the Angrez!" Umran took four wickets against PBKS today.

title: The 2nd phase of war has started: Ukraine
body: As Russia launched a new offensive in the east of the country, Ukraine said that the second phase of war has started. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that a "very large part of the entire Russian army is now focused on this offensive." "No matter how many Russian troops they send there, we will fight," he added.

title: My parents love that I am wearing a uniform in 'Runway 34': Rakul
body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh has said that her parents "love" that she is wearing a uniform in her upcoming film 'Runway 34'. "I have grown up with people in uniform around me," she stated. Rakul added her father gives her critical reviews of her films. "For me, they (her parents) are the public; I get..best reviews from them," Rakul said.

title: Only when Deepika entered my life, she made me appreciate living it: Ranveer
body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that he had zero work-life balance but things changed for the better. He added, "I had zero work-life balance for the longest time. It was only when Deepika (Padukone) came into my life that she made me appreciate living it." "She sits down with me and goes through my calendar to ensure the same," he said.

title: Gurugram civic body plans to complete pre-monsoon work by June 30
body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has set June 30 as the deadline to complete all the pre-monsoon work in the city, according to an official order. Additional commissioners and joint commissioners have been appointed as nodal officers to prepare for the season. "We're on track to complete...80-85% of all allotted works for monsoon preparedness this year," an official said.

title: Bail denied to jeweller who bought jewellery stolen from Sonam's home
body: A Delhi court denied bail to a jeweller who allegedly bought jewellery stolen from Bollywood actor Sonam Kapoor's home in Delhi. While rejecting the plea, the court cited police's objection to the bail because some jewellery was yet to be recovered from him. Stolen jewellery worth over ₹1 crore, including 100 diamonds and six gold chains, was recovered from him.

title: Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara shares wedding pics
body: Actor Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara on Monday shared pictures from their wedding day on Instagram. She wrote, "With These 7 steps May you become my friend and May I deserve your friendship. May my friendship make me one with you and May your friendship make you one with me." The couple got married on April 15 in Alibaug.

title: KKR to bowl first against RR, RR make three changes to their playing XI
body: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. KKR have made one change to their playing XI, with Shivam Mavi replacing Aman Khan. RR have included Karun Nair, Obed McCoy and Trent Boult in their playing XI.

title: Jos Buttler smashes his second hundred of IPL 2022
body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) opener Jos Buttler smashed his second hundred of IPL 2022 after reaching the three-figure mark off 59 deliveries against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Monday. Overall, it was Buttler's third IPL hundred for RR. He is the third cricketer after Virat Kohli and Chris Gayle to smash at least three hundreds for one franchise.

title: Pakistan cutting power supply to houses, industry amid fuel shortage
body: Pakistan is cutting electricity supply to households and industry as it's not able to afford buying coal or natural gas from overseas. A report said Pakistan's energy costs more than doubled in nine months ending February from last year. Former finance minister Miftah Ismail also shared a post detailing how much power had been cut due to fuel shortages.

title: Integrated command-control centre in all smart cities by Aug 15: Puri
body: Housing and Urban Affairs Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Monday said 80 out of 100 Smart Cities in India have Integrated Command and Control Centres and the remaining cities will get it by August 15. "Work has started in almost all government-funded projects [under] the Smart Cities Mission (SCM) and [the] projects...will be completed by next year," Puri added.

title: If philanthropy is love of humanity, my companies are philanthropy: Musk
body: World's richest man Elon Musk said SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink and The Boring Company, the companies that he has founded, are philanthropy. "If you say philanthropy is love of humanity, they are philanthropy," Musk added. Asked about his views on billionaire philanthropy, he said, "If you care about reality of goodness instead of the perception of it, philanthropy is extremely difficult."

title: MP man uses abusive words, mimics PM Modi, Amit Shah; arrested
body: A 38-year-old man has been arrested in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur for allegedly mimicking and using abusive words against PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah, police said. This comes after a video of the accused performing a mimicry of PM Modi and Shah's walking style went viral. Following this, right-wing organisations had filed a complaint.

title: Connivance between SDPI and CPI(M): Kerala BJP Vice President
body: The Vice President of BJP's Kerala unit, KS Radhakrishnan, has alleged that there is some "sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)". "The state government acts like the policemen in old Hindi films. There is a sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)," Radhakrishnan said by referring to the alleged murder of an RSS worker on Saturday.

title: Coach Toni Nadal doesn't want me to play like nephew Rafael: Auger-Aliassime
body: World number nine Felix Auger-Aliassime said his coach Toni Nadal, Rafael Nadal's uncle and former coach, isn't trying to make him play like his nephew. "We've been together for more than a year now working...things are going good...he (Toni) adapted to the player he's working with," he added. Auger-Aliassime will face Carlos Taberner in Barcelona Open second round on Wednesday.

title: Woman returning home from work crushed by BBMP garbage truck, dies
body: A 40-year-old woman bank employee who was returning home from work on Monday was crushed by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike's garbage truck in Bengaluru. The woman was returning from work on a scooter when the garbage truck knocked her down from behind and ran her over. Police have shifted the woman's body to the Victoria Hospital on Mysuru road.

title: Sri Lankan PM offers to hold talks with anti-govt protesters
body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa on Tuesday offered to hold talks with anti-government protesters amid a severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka. Earlier, the protesters had said that they would only leave if PM Rajapaksa and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa step down. Notably, the opposition has threatened to bring a no-confidence motion against the government over its handling of the crisis.

title: No safe corridors agreed for third straight day: Ukraine Dy PM
body: Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Tuesday said that the country was for the third straight day unable to secure Russia's agreement to establish any humanitarian corridors to evacuate trapped civilians. She added that "difficult negotiations" were taking place to try to arrange humanitarian corridors in the southern region of Kherson and in the Kharkiv region of eastern Ukraine.

title: L&T Infotech, Mindtree may merge into a $22 billion firm: Report
body: Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between its publicly traded software firms, Larsen & Toubro Infotech and Mindtree, to create a $22 billion firm, Bloomberg reported. The boards of the two companies could consider share swap ratios for the merger as early as next week. L&T acquired Mindtree in 2019 and holds about a 61% stake in the company.

title: Tusshar congratulates Ranbir-Alia, says 'It was private wedding which I respect'
body: Tusshar Kapoor on Monday congratulated the newlywed Bollywood couple Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. "Very nice pictures, very natural. It was a private wedding which [I] respect," he said while talking to the media. "My best wishes from the family because Chintu Ji (Rishi Kapoor) was my father's (Jeetendra) close friend. So hearty wishes to them from...entire family," Tusshar added.

title: Kuldeep wasn't able to get many opportunities at KKR: Ponting
body: Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting has said that DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav was "unable to get" opportunities at Kolkata Knight Riders. "Kuldeep is really thriving in the environment that we...(have created) around him. Obviously at KKR...with the quality of spinners they had...he was unable to get the opportunity that he should have got," Ponting said.

title: Shanghai reports first COVID-19 deaths since start of lockdown
body:
Shanghai has reported the first COVID-19 deaths since the start of its weeks-long lockdown.
Three people died on Sunday, according to Shanghai's municipal government. They were aged between 89 and 91, had underlying diseases and were all unvaccinated, according to reports. Shanghai reported more than 22,000 COVID-19 cases on Sunday.

title: IMD predicts cloudy sky with light rain in Delhi on Wednesday and Thursday
body: Following heatwave conditions on Tuesday, the IMD has predicted a "generally cloudy sky with light rain or drizzle" in Delhi on Wednesday and Thursday. The maximum temperature is likely to decrease from 42°C on Tuesday to 41°C on Wednesday and 39°C on Thursday. The IMD has predicted thunderstorm and lightning over Western Himalayan region and adjoining plains during April 19-21.

title: CoinDCX doubles valuation to $2.15 bn, becomes India's most valuable crypto company
body: CoinDCX has raised $135.9 million in a funding round led by Pantera Capital and Steadview Capital. This led to its valuation being doubled to $2.15 billion in eight months to become the most valued cryptocurrency trading platform in India. CoinDCX plans to use its fund to increase its employees from 400 to 1000 by the end of next year.

title: Germany probing displays of support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine
body: Police across several states in Germany on Monday reportedly opened over 140 investigations into public displays of support for Russia's invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24. Most investigations are looking into the use of the symbol 'Z' which has been associated with the invasion after being seen on many of the vehicles used by Russian troops in Ukraine.

title: Turkey launches military operation against Kurdish militants in Iraq
body: Turkey on Monday announced the launch of a new ground and air cross-border military operation against Kurdish militants in northern Iraq. The jets successfully struck shelters, bunkers, caves, tunnels, ammunition depots and headquarters belonging to the militants, the Turkish Defence Minister said. At least 19 Kurdish militants were killed and about four Turkish soldiers were injured, he added.

title: Odisha hikes daily dietary expenses of prisoners from ₹64 to ₹80
body: The dietary expense of prisoners in Odisha has been increased from ₹64 to ₹80 per day, the state government said in an official statement on Monday. While the government has also approved the inclusion of Jail Hospitals under the Niramaya Scheme, the user credentials have been generated for 32 Jail Headquarter Hospitals in E-Niramaya Software.

title: WHO chief Tedros to be on 3-day Gujarat visit from Monday
body: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO), will be on a three-day visit to Gujarat starting Monday. During his visit, he would take part in a few events along with PM Narendra Modi, officials said. He'll join the PM on Tuesday in Jamnagar for the foundation stone-laying programme of the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine.

title: Actor Bob Odenkirk honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star
body: Actor Bob Odenkirk has been honoured with the Hollywood Walk of Fame star on Monday. Jonathan Banks, Patrick Fabian, Tony Dalton, Giancarlo Esposito, Patrick Fabian, and Michael Mando attended the ceremony. The actor is known for his work in 'Breaking Bad', 'Better Call Saul'. Bob's star was placed next to Bryan Cranston, who was Bob's co-star in 'Breaking Bad'.

title: Adani Green Energy overtakes SBI as India's 7th most valuable company
body: Adani Green Energy overtook the State Bank of India (SBI) on Monday to become the country's seventh most valuable company. The company's shares have surged over 120% year-to-date and its market valuation currently stands at ₹4.64 lakh crore. Adani Green is the only non-Sensex company featuring in the list of top 10 companies on BSE in terms of market capitalisation.

title: Drones being used for surveillance in Delhi's Jahangirpuri after violence
body: After a violence broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday, drones are being used for surveillance in the area. DCP (Central district) Shweta Chauhan said, "Delhi Police [is] also keeping an eye at Jama Masjid and Hauz Qazi area in Central district...with the use of drones." A total of 23 people have been arrested.

title: My male friends tell me 'your mom is quite hot': Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak
body: Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari, in an interview, was asked if her male friends have ever told her that they have a crush on her mother. "They've not said...they've a crush on her, they're like 'Your mom is quite hot'," Palak said, adding, "I was like 'you say this and...my mom is gonna belo (beat with rolling pin) like that'."

title: 6.0 magnitude earthquake strikes Philippines' Mindanao island
body: The European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) on Tuesday said a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck the Mindanao island in the Philippines. No injuries or damage have been reported so far. The EMSC said the quake was recorded at a depth of 10 km. The Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said aftershocks and damage are expected following the earthquake.

title: 7 more die of COVID-19 in Shanghai
body: A day after the first deaths in months were reported, seven more people died in Shanghai due to COVID-19. According to the Chinese government, all of the deceased were elderly aged between 60 and 101 years. "The seven people's condition worsened after being admitted to hospital and they died after the rescue failed," said the government.

title: SP leader booked for threatening to read Quran in front of temples
body: An FIR has been registered against Samajwadi Party leader Rubina Khanum for allegedly making proactive speeches. Khanum said if no action is taken against groups installing loudspeakers outside mosques to play the Hanuman Chalisa, hundreds of Muslim women would recite Quran in front of temples. Khanum alleged that attempts were being made to target Muslims by banning loudspeakers outside mosques.

title: B'luru man threatens to expose female friend's HIV +ve status, extorts money
body: Karnataka Police have filed an FIR against a man who allegedly threatened to expose the HIV positive status of his female friend and also extorted money from her. Reports said accused also extorted gold chain worth ₹2.8 lakh. He told the woman's relatives about her being HIV positive. When questioned, he beat her up and threatened to rape her daughter.

title: Akshay has magnetic personality & an amazing aura: Magician Rahul
body: Magician Rahul Kharbanda, who taught illusions to actor Akshay Kumar in 'Atrangi Re', has said, "It's been one of the unforgettable experiences of my magic career." "Akshay has a magnetic personality and an amazing aura," he added. Rahul further said that Akshay was "very quick on adapting most of the props and executed them with finesse".

title: Islamic body moves SC against bulldozing houses of riot accused
body: Islamic body Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind has moved Supreme Court seeking appropriate direction to states against demolishing houses of accused in cases of violence. This comes after Madhya Pradesh government used bulldozers to raze down houses of persons accused of rioting during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone. The petitioner said resorting to such measures is clearly against constitutional ethos.

title: Biden has no plans to visit Ukrainian capital Kyiv: White House
body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Monday reiterated that there are no plans for US President Joe Biden to visit the Ukrainian capital Kyiv. The comment comes after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy invited Biden to visit the city. Several European Union leaders have visited the city in recent weeks as a show of support for Ukraine.

title: Pak says its forces facing cross-border attacks from Afghanistan
body: Pakistan has said there has been a significant increase in cross-border attacks from Afghanistan and that its security forces are being targeted. It added that despite asking the Afghan authorities repeatedly to act against the militants, the attacks continued to take place "with impunity". Meanwhile, Pakistan reportedly conducted air strikes in Afghanistan on Friday, killing  about 40 people.

title: 19 arrested as road accident causes communal clashes in Guj; 3 hurt
body: As many as 19 people have been arrested after a minor road accident between people from two communities caused clashes in Gujarat's Vadodara, the police said on Monday. The miscreants pelted stones, damaged vehicles and also vandalised a shrine, the police added. Three people who were injured have been admitted to a hospital, the city's Police Commissioner Shamsher Singh said.

title: KTR inaugurates Skywalk at Mindspace campus in Hyderabad
body: Telangana Municipal Administration Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday inaugurated a one kilometre long Skywalk at Hyderabad's Mindspace campus. The Skywalk connects the Raidurg Metro Station to strategic locations in and around the Mindspace Madhapur campus and is expected to ease commute for around 30,000 people on a daily basis. It has been designed keeping in mind people with disabilities.

title: Spread teachings of gods in right way, don’t be 'andh bhakts': Maha CM
body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said people should spread the teachings of their gods in the right way rather than becoming "andh bhakts". "The true follower will understand the teaching of his God and spread it to all. The blind follower will only praise superficially and then sometimes change his affection," Thackeray added.

title: Central Railway organises unique light & sound show at Mumbai's CSMT
body: Central Railway organised a unique light and sound show at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) heritage building on Sunday to commemorate entering 170th year of Indian Railways. The show was titled 'Navarasangam - ek gatha CSMT ki'. It also commemorated the World Heritage Day, Railway Week and Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav, a celebration of 75 years of India's independence.

title: Man assumes wife acted in porn film he watched, kills her in front of kids in B'luru
body: A 40-year-old Bengaluru man killed his wife on Sunday after assuming that she acted in a porn movie that he watched two months ago. The accused named Pasha, an auto driver, allegedly beat up Mubeena at a family function in Kolar two months ago over the same issue. The two had been married for 15 years and have five children.

title: Man in blue kurta seen opening fire during violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri arrested
body: Delhi Police have arrested 28-year-old Imam alias Sonu, who was seen in a video purportedly firing a gun during the violence at Jahangirpuri. DCP (Northwest) Usha Rangnani said, "A video was being circulated on social media showing a man in blue kurta opening fire during the riot in Jahangirpuri area."  A sophisticated pistol was recovered from his possession, police said.

title: SBI asks FRL about steps taken to get back stores from Reliance: Report
body: State Bank of India (SBI) has written a letter to Future Retail (FRL) seeking accountability on the takeover of the company's stores by Reliance Industries, BloombergQuint reported. SBI has asked FRL what steps it has taken to safeguard lenders' interests and the efforts taken to get back its assets from Reliance. Reliance took over 947 Future Group stores last month.

title: Russian Navy chief meets crew of sunken warship Moskva
body: The head of the Russian Navy, Admiral Nikolay Yevmenov, has met with the crew members of the sunken warship Moskva, Russia's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. The crew would continue to serve in the Navy, it added. Ukraine said that its missile strike had sunk the flagship of Russia's Black Sea fleet, a claim that was not confirmed by Russia.

title: Greater Noida sectors, called after Greek alphabets, to be renamed
body: The Greater Noida Authority is reportedly planning to rename the city's sectors that are currently called after Greek alphabets like Alpha, Beta, Gamma, Delta and Omicron. GNIDA said it is being done to streamline the city's "complex and mismanaged naming system". However, some residents said it may have something to do with the association of those alphabets with COVID-19 variants.

title: Russian missile strikes kill 7 in Ukraine's Lviv: Officials
body: At least seven people were killed and 11 others were injured in Russian missile strikes on Ukraine's Lviv, local authorities said on Monday. The youngest victim among the seven killed was aged 30, the Mayor of Lviv said. Notably, Lviv has become a major centre for NATO-supplied weapons and foreign fighters joining the Ukrainian side in the conflict.

title: Sri Lanka's state-run oil firm raises petrol prices amid economic crisis
body: Sri Lanka's state-run Ceylon Petroleum Corporation has raised the price of 92 octane petrol to LKR 338 per litre amid the nation’s worst economic crisis. This comes a day after Indian Oil Company's local operation raised its prices. Notably, this was CPC’s second price hike within a month. Sri Lanka is facing its worst economic crisis since the 1940s.

title: He wanted the world to attend his wedding; we had no place to sit: Millind's sister
body: After 'Bigg Boss OTT' contestant Millind Gaba tied the knot with his long-time girlfriend, Pria Beniwal, in a grand ceremony, his sister Pallavi Gaba shared that it was his dream that the world should attend his wedding. "It was a big fat Indian wedding. We were all wondering where we should even sit, as all...sofas were occupied," she added.

title: Noida is UP's crown just as Kashmir is India's crown: UP minister
body: UP Cabinet Minister Nand Gopal Gupta on Sunday said, "The way Kashmir...is a crown for India similarly, Noida is Uttar Pradesh's crown." Gupta made the comment during a visit to Noida on the occasion of the city's 47th foundation day. He inaugurated and laid foundation stones to projects worth ₹107 crore during the visit.

title: Provide COVID-19 data daily: Centre as Kerala reports data after 5-day gap
body: Union Health Ministry has written a letter to Kerala Principal Secretary Rajan Khobragade, asking him to ensure updating COVID-19 data daily as the state reported its data after five days since April 13. ''Daily and diligent reporting of data is critical to arrive at a meaningful understanding of the pandemic in districts, state and national level," the ministry added.

title: Soni shares pic of Ranbir & Alia from their wedding; calls them her 'heartbeats'
body: Soni Razdan shared a picture of Ranbir Kapoor and her daughter, Alia Bhatt, from their wedding. In the picture, Alia is looking overwhelmed and the veteran actress, couldn't take her eyes off her daughter. Soni had captioned the picture, "My heartbeats." The couple tied the knot on April 14 in a traditional ceremony attended by their families and friends.

title: Fire breaks out at a shop in Delhi's Kirti Nagar, 15 fire tenders on spot
body: A fire broke out at one of the shops in West Delhi's Kirti Nagar furniture market on Tuesday, ANI reported citing Delhi Fire Service (DFS) officials. A call about the fire was received around 1:16 pm and firefighting operations are underway. ''We have rushed 15 fire tenders to the spot,'' said DFS Director Atul Garg.

title: IMF appreciates India's help to Sri Lanka amid its worst economic crisis
body: The chief of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has appreciated India's help to Sri Lanka in the country's fight against its worst economic crisis since independence. Kristalina Georgieva also assured Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman that the financial institution will continue to actively engage with the island nation. India has sent diesel and petrol and offered financial aid to Sri Lanka.

title: Preity thanks Hrithik for helping out with twins Jai, Gia on flight; shares pic
body: Actress Preity Zinta took to Instagram to share her picture with actor Hrithik Roshan and thanked him for helping out with her twins Jai and Gia on a long flight. "Thank you so much @hrithikroshan for going out of your way & helping out...Now I see why you are such an amazing & thoughtful father. I love you," she wrote.

title: RCB go 2nd on IPL 2022 points table with 18-run win against LSG
body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) defeated Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) by 18 runs to register their second win in a row. With this, RCB jumped to the second position on the IPL 2022 points table, while LSG have dropped to the fourth position. RCB captain Faf du Plessis top-scored in the match with 96(64), while Josh Hazlewood took four wickets.

title: 89 convicted of lynching Lankan man & burning his body in Pak, 6 sentenced to die
body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan on Monday convicted 89 people for lynching Sri Lankan man Priyantha Kumara and burning his body in December 2021. Six of the accused have been sentenced to death and seven were given life imprisonment in the case. A mob of over 800 people had attacked a garment factory and killed the 47-year-old over blasphemy allegations.

title: She's amazing: Tiger on getting defeated by 7-yr-old girl in backflip challenge
body: Tiger Shroff appeared on 'Dance India Dance L'il Masters' to promote his film 'Heropanti 2'. On the show, a seven-year-old contestant, Sanvi Negi, asked Tiger to do a backflip battle with her, however, he was defeated by Sanvi. Reacting to it, Tiger said, "I did try competing with her, but I had no choice but to accept my defeat. She's...amazing."

title: 23 people killed due to severe storms and lightning in Assam
body: At least 23 people were killed due to severe storms and lightning in separate incidents over the last few days in Assam and the state has promised compensation to the family of the deceased. "In the last three days, 22 districts reported [such] incidents in...over 1,591 villages, impacting [over] one lakh people," an official of state disaster management authority said.

title: Flight door opens mid-air in Brazil, passengers hold it shut for 20 mins
body: Pictures have surfaced online that showed the moment when the door of a plane flung open mid-air in Brazil. While the door’s handrail hit the engine’s propeller, passengers reportedly held the door closed for 20 minutes until the plane landed safely. The plane was an Embraer 110 Bandeirante, which can fly between 15 and 21 passengers.

title: Brochara 2 premieres exclusively on Voot on 18 April 2022
body: Voot's new show Brochara 2 captures the bromance between four friends, Abhimanyu, Kanan, Shivashish and Pranay as they navigate life, ambitions, and relationships together with each other's unhindered support. The 5-episodic series boasts of Ankur Rathee, Amey Wagh, Varun Tewari, and Sayandeep Sengupta in the lead roles. Viewers can now watch the show for free on Voot.

title: Enjoyed my debut game for Sussex: Pujara on 201* in county cricket
body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara, who scored a double ton in County Championship Division Two, said he enjoyed his debut game for Sussex and was glad to contribute to the team's cause. In response to Derbyshire's 505 first-innings total, Sussex got bundled out for 174 before Pujara (201*) and Tom Haines (243) scored double tons to draw the match.

title: Didn't consider casting dad in my films: Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa
body: Filmmaker Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth said that she didn't consider casting her father, actor Rajinikanth in her films. She added, "I honestly haven't given it a thought or worked towards it. I am enjoying and loving the experience of being his fanatic fan." "But if an opportunity comes up, who in their right senses would say no to that?" Aishwaryaa said.

title: Buttler has 2 tons in IPL 2022, you can expect the same from Rahul: Aakash
body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said that LSG captain KL Rahul, who slammed a century in their last game against MI, will score another hundred in the ongoing IPL season. "Rahul is in exceptional form. He will not be satisfied with one hundred. Jos Buttler has hit two tons, you can expect the same from Rahul as well," Aakash stated.

title: US to no longer conduct anti-satellite tests, first nation to do so
body: The US has announced that it will no longer conduct anti-satellite (ASAT) missile tests, becoming the first nation to make such a declaration. Vice President Kamala Harris, who chairs the National Space Council, made the announcement. "This commitment addresses one of the most pressing threats to...security...of space, as demonstrated by Russia's...ASAT missile test," the White House said.

title: Shreyas Iyer shouts angrily at Venkatesh Iyer for refusing double, video goes viral
body: A video of KKR captain Shreyas Iyer shouting angrily at Venkatesh Iyer for refusing to run a double on the last ball of their 16th over against RR has gone viral. Shreyas was also seen staring at Venkatesh. Venkatesh got stumped out on the first delivery of the 17th over bowled by Yuzvendra Chahal.

title: Inform if suspicious activities happen: Police after Jahangirpuri violence
body: After the violence that took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday, police have requested people to inform them if any suspicious activities take place in their area or if any group indulges in arguments. “We’ve arrested 14 people, seven cases were filed & weapons were recovered," Dependra Pathak, Delhi’s Special Commissioner of Police, Law & Order, said.

title: Swiggy, Zomato back startup UrbanPiper in $24 mn funding round
body: Restaurant management platform UrbanPiper has raised $24 million in a funding round led by existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Tiger Global, along with new investors Swiggy and Zomato. The Bengaluru-based startup is a B2B software platform with over 27,000 hotels and restaurants live on its platform. UrbanPiper claims to process 18% of all online food orders in India.

title: Man fired for being angry over unwanted birthday party gets ₹3.4cr in damages in US
body: An American man has won $450,000 (₹3.4 crore) in damages after suing his former employers for allegedly firing him for being "angry" that his office threw him a surprise birthday party. Kevin Berling, who suffers from an anxiety disorder that gives him panic attacks, had told his bosses he didn't want a surprise birthday party but got one anyway.

title: Who is Jammu fruit seller's son Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022?
body: SRH pacer Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022, was born on November 22, 1999 in Jammu and Kashmir. His father is a fruit seller. Umran was SRH's net bowler in IPL 2021 and he replaced T Natarajan in main squad after the latter was ruled out due to COVID-19. He was retained by SRH for ₹4 crore.

title: 1 killed & 10 injured as Sri Lankan police fire at anti-govt protesters
body: At least one person was killed and around 10 people were injured after police fired at anti-government protesters in Sri Lanka's Rambukkana, reports said on Tuesday. As per reports, police said that protesters had attempted to set fire to a fuel bowser. Sri Lanka has seen widespread protests amid the worst economic crisis the country has seen since independence.

title: Man with knife arrested after confronting police near UK PM's home
body: The UK Police on Monday said that they've arrested a 29-year-old man armed with a knife who confronted two Ministry of Defence police officers near British PM's official residence in London. The incident isn't being treated as terror-related, it added. "He was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder and...remains in custody at a central London police station," it further said.

title: Abhishek said he follows music passion in dad's basement set-up: Dasvi composer
body: One of the composers of the movie 'Dasvi', Sachin Sanghvi, said that actor Abhishek Bachchan told him and composer Jigar Saraiya that music has been a major part of his life. "He shared that Amitabh Bachchan sir has a small set-up in the basement of their residence where he still pursues music as a passion," Sachin added.

title: AAP must clarify if it supports UK MP's anti-India views: BJP leader
body: BJP leader and ex-Army chief JJ Singh said Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) must clarify if it supports the "pro-separatist and anti-India" views of British Labour Party MP Tanmanjeet Singh Dhesi. This comes after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and AAP Rajya Sabha MP Raghav Chadha met Dhesi on Friday. Singh added that Mann must disclose what transpired during their meeting.

title: Vishal Bhardwaj praises 'desi food' at Priyanka's NYC restaurant, she reacts
body: Filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj took to Twitter to share a picture from Priyanka Chopra's Indian restaurant Sona, located in New York, US. "What a lovely night with friends and the most delicious desi food with a twist in NY. #SonaNewYork," he wrote. Priyanka reacted to Vishal's post and wrote, "So glad you liked it, sir. You're welcome anytime."

title: Tactically he never had it: Boycott on Root's Test captaincy
body: Ex-England cricketer Geoffrey Boycott said Joe Root never had the tactical ability to be England's Test skipper. He added Root didn't have the instinct for changing situations in the match. "Captaincy is tactical awareness and man management of players," he further said. Root led England in 64 Tests, won 27 and lost 26, both a record for an English captain.

title: Minor girl, man found hanging from tree in Punjab's Ferozepur
body: The bodies of a minor girl and a man were found hanging from a tree in a village in Punjab's Ferozepur on Monday. The bodies were first spotted at around 7.30 am by local residents who then informed the police. A motorcycle that was parked nearby has been impounded and the bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

title: Bride slaps groom twice, storms off stage during jaimala ceremony in UP; video goes viral
body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a bride slapping the groom twice and walking off the stage during jaimala ceremony in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur district. As per reports, the bride did not like the groom. Local police intervened to bring the situation under control, reports added. The two sides later reached an agreement, reports further stated.

title: Shanghai outbreak stalls plans for 3rd aircraft carrier: Report
body: A COVID-19 lockdown in Shanghai may affect the launch of China's third aircraft carrier, according to a report. The Chinese navy was widely expected to launch the aircraft carrier around its 73rd anniversary on April 23. "But the plan faces delay as the rampant pandemic...has delayed the transport of some key components," a source quoted by the report said.

title: Sri Lanka Cricket asked to confirm on hosting Asia Cup by July 27: Report
body: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) board has been reportedly asked by the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) to decide on hosting the Asia Cup tournament by July 27. The tournament is scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka but the ongoing economic and political crisis in the country might take away the hosting rights from the SLC, a source said.

title: Millionaire asks military to bomb his mansion after Russian forces occupy it in Ukraine
body: A Ukrainian millionaire asked the country's military to bomb his mansion after he saw it had been seized and occupied by Russian forces. Andrey Stavnitser, the CEO of the Ukrainian IT company TransInvestService, said he saw Russian forces move into his property via a security camera. Stavnitser left Ukraine for Poland after Russia invaded.

title: Bengaluru Police bust cryptocurrency scam; 4 arrested
body: Four people were reportedly arrested by Bengaluru Police in connection with a cryptocurrency ponzi scam on Monday. The accused were running the operation through a mobile app called ShareHash, said Kamal Pant, Commissioner of Police. "The app promised high returns on investments and collected crores of rupees from gullible people," he added.

title: Odisha CM Patnaik sanctions ₹120 cr for Kendu leaf pluckers
body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik sanctioned ₹120 crore for bonus and other allowances for Kendu leaf pluckers and other seasonal workers. A statement from the Chief Minister's office said, "It will benefit around 8 lakh Kendu leaf pluckers, binders and other seasonal staff." The state government also decided to increase the collection price of Kendu leaf for 2022.

title: In talks with India to find solution on payments: Russian diplomat
body: Consul General of Russia in Mumbai AV Surovtsev said Russia is in talks with the Indian government and Reserve Bank of India to find a solution on the payments front. Due to its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has been cut off from the international payments system SWIFT. "Complicated situation" created by the sanctions creates room for Indian exports, Surovtsev added.

title: Delhi's law & order is under Centre: Sharad Pawar on Jahangirpuri violence
body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday reacted to the violence in Delhi’s Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession, saying that Delhi's law and order situation comes under the Central government. Pawar added, "We never heard of communal violence during Ram Navami. The reason behind this is the BJP and some of their organisation."

title: UP makes face masks compulsory in Lucknow, NCR amid COVID-19 surge
body: In view of the increase in COVID-19 cases in India, the Uttar Pradesh government on Monday made it mandatory for people to wear a face mask in public places in the capital city of Lucknow and six NCR districts. People in Gautam Buddha Nagar, Ghaziabad, Hapur, Meerut, Bulandshahr and Baghpat will also have to compulsorily wear face masks.

title: Nepal considering 2-day holiday for govt offices to reduce fuel consumption
body: Nepal is considering declaring a two-day holiday in public offices this month to reduce fuel consumption as its prices surge. The Ukraine war has caused a spike in global oil prices as Russian oil faces sanctions. Amid its foreign exchange crisis, Nepal has urged its citizens living abroad to open dollar accounts in banks in the country and make investments.

title: I know we lost but keep your chins up: Shah Rukh Khan after RR defeat KKR
body: Shah Rukh Khan motivated his IPL team Kolkata Knight Riders as it lost to Rajasthan Royals on Monday. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Well played boys. Stupendous effort by @ShreyasIyer15 @AaronFinch5 @y_umesh congrats to #SunilNarine for the 150th match...I know we lost but if we've to go down this is the only way to do it! Keep your chins up."

title: Felt wrong about being in dad's film, told him 'I cannot do this': Vivek Oberoi
body: Actor Vivek Oberoi said that it felt wrong for him to be a part of the film that his father Suresh Oberoi offered him. "My father didn't come with a sifaarish ki chitthi. He came to this incredibly difficult industry with his own merit...So, I took this critical decision and told him I cannot do this [the film]," Vivek said.

title: Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor will not go for a honeymoon: Report
body: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor will not be going for a honeymoon following their wedding which was held on Thursday, reported Midday. It stated Alia will resume shooting for Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' while Ranbir will begin the first schedule of Sandeep Reddy Vanga's 'Animal' in Manali. Earlier reports suggested they will honeymoon in South Africa.

title: Evergreen's 'Ever Forward' ship freed over a month after running aground in US
body: Evergreen Marine Corporation's giant container ship 'Ever Forward' has been freed more than a month after it ran aground in Chesapeake Bay, US. The ship's navigational status changed to "under way using engine" on Sunday from being classified as "aground" on March 13. Last year, Evergreen's 'Ever Given' ship got stuck in the Suez Canal, disrupting global shipping for months.

title: Hong Kong disposing over 2,000 tonnes of plastic waste daily amid COVID-19
body: Amid COVID-19, Hong Kong has been disposing over 2,300 tonnes of plastic waste a day, revealed government data. An entrepreneur while speaking from a quarantine hotel in the city said that all staff members wore PPE kits and items like phones, and remotes are cellophane wrapped. Meanwhile, a government spokesperson said officials were aware of the surge in disposable waste.

title: Haryana to grant same scholarship to general and SC players
body: Haryana government has decided to grant the same scholarship to general and SC category players. "To boost players across all categories, we have made scholarship in the general category at par with SC category players except for the ₹18,000 for participation to SC players and ₹1,000 extra for female medallists from the state," said Pankaj Nain, Director Sports, Haryana.

title: Alia resumes work post-wedding with Ranbir Kapoor; pics surface
body: Alia Bhatt has resumed work after tying the knot with actor Ranbir Kapoor. The actress was spotted at the Mumbai airport. Reportedly, Alia will be flying to Jaisalmer to complete the shoot for Dharma Productions' film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. Pictures have surfaced online, where Alia is seen donning a pink kurta along with a matching dupatta.

title: Proud to see Gujarat's success: PM Modi on Vidya Samiksha Kendra
body: While stressing on how children will be benefited from Gujarat’s Vidya Samiksha Kendra, PM Modi said, “The use of such a huge technology for our government primary school is a wonder for the world. It gives great pride to see the success and development of Gujarat.” He also said it can bring big changes in the field of education.

title: 61-year-old man dies while fighting off phone snatchers in Mumbai
body: A 61-year-old man died after he fell and hit his head while fighting off robbers, who allegedly snatched his phone and assaulted him, in Mumbai's Malad West. The incident took place when the victim was walking back home after grocery shopping. The man reportedly died after making a call to his wife and informing her about the incident.

title: Jahangirpuri violence a criminal conspiracy: Police in report to MHA
body: The Delhi Police on Tuesday submitted the preliminary report to Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) into the Jahangirpuri violence that took place during a Hanuman Jayanti rally on Saturday. Police said the violence was a part of criminal conspiracy. In the report, the police mentioned immediate steps taken by the forces to control the situation.

title: Hijab won't be allowed during K'taka II PUC exams: Education Minister
body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh said that hijabs won't be allowed during the II Pre-University Course Examination. "All students must follow rules on uniform, hijab cladding students won't be allowed," he said. The row over hijab began in December 2021, when six female students of Government PU College for Girls in Udupi were not allowed to attend classes wearing headscarves.

title: NCP leader demands arrest of Raj Thackeray over loudspeaker row
body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Shaikh Asif said he has written to Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse demanding the arrest of MNS Chief Raj Thackeray over the ongoing loudspeaker row in the state. Thackeray on Sunday had asked to take down loudspeakers outside the mosques saying, "Muslims should understand that religion is not above law and country."

title: Sreenivasan discharged from hospital after cardiac arrest treatment
body: Malayalam actor Sreenivasan was discharged from Apollo Adlux Hospital in Kerala's Angamaly on Tuesday following bypass surgery as treatment for cardiac arrest. The 66-year-old was admitted to the hospital on March 30 after complaining of chest pain. A medical bulletin issued by the hospital stated that Sreenivasan is stable and showed remarkable improvement in his cardiac and general condition.

title: Important for MI to keep dressing room environment in good shape: Ojha
body: Following Mumbai Indians' six consecutive defeats in the ongoing IPL 2022, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said that the franchise should keep the dressing room environment healthy. "It is important is how you navigate the dressing room atmosphere. I'm saying this because MI have always kept it good," he added. Ojha had earlier won two IPL trophies with MI.

title: Badshah to make international debut with 'Voodoo' alongside J Balvin
body: Rapper Badshah on Tuesday took to Instagram to announce his international debut with Colombian singer J Balvin and Puerto Rican producer Tainy. He shared the album cover and wrote, "Namaste India Colombia Latino Gang! We coming this Friday 22nd April 2022! #Voodoo." Balvin commented "INDIA" along with heart emojis. Canadian singer Tesher, known for his song 'Jalebi Baby', wrote, "Yes!!"

title: Zomato defers new food quality policy after criticism by restaurants: Report
body: Zomato has deferred the implementation of its new food quality policy to May 3 from April 18 after criticism by restaurants, reports said. Under the policy called 'Severe Food Quality' rules, Zomato proposed it would temporarily ban restaurants if consumers complained about their food quality. Zomato has deferred the policy and sought feedback from restaurant partners on the new policy.

title: Cyberspace threats directly impact India's national security: Doval
body: NSA Ajit Doval said cyberspace threats directly impact India's social, economic and national security. A digital revolution is taking place across India, Doval said while speaking at a cybersecurity training workshop's inauguration. Also present at the event, National Cybersecurity Coordinator Lt Gen Rajesh Pant said, "The [Centre] is taking various steps to build capacities...in cybersecurity."

title: Chhattisgarh CM warns govt doctors against prescribing branded medicines
body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday warned government doctors against prescribing branded medicines. The warning came while the CM was reviewing the 'Shri Dhanwantari Generic Medical Store Scheme' which ensures availability of generic medicines at affordable rates. According to officials, district collectors and Chief Medical and Health Officers have been asked to ensure strict compliance.

title: BJP is trying to divide society: Kamal Nath on Khargone violence
body: Following the clashes that took place in MP’s Khargone, former MP CM and Congress leader Kamal Nath on Sunday said that BJP is trying to "divide" the society. "These riots that took place in Khargone are against the culture of our country. Our culture is to unite the society but BJP is trying to divide it," Nath added.

title: Who was 'Mother of Pak' Bilquis Edhi whose death was condoled by PM Modi?
body: Bilquis Bano Edhi who recently died aged 74 in Pakistan's Karachi was one of the most active philanthropists in the country. Born in Gujarat, Edhi (also known as 'Mother of Pakistan') started a charity that saved over 16,000 unwanted babies in Pakistan. Her foundation had also adopted the specially-abled Indian girl Geeta who wandered into Pakistan when she was 10.

title: Fearing blackmail over obscene pics, Maha doctor hires people to beat nurse
body: A doctor and two other accused, who he hired to beat and steal mobile phone of a female nurse, have been arrested by the Ulhasnagar Police. The doctor had doubts about nurse having some obscene pictures of him and thought that she would blackmail him. Police said he gave other accused ₹10,000 to attack the nurse.

title: 12-yr-old student run over by bus in Punjab's Sangrur, 3 injured
body: A 12-year-old government school student was killed in Punjab's Sangrur while three others suffered serious injuries after a Pepsu Road Transport Corporation bus hit them on Monday. "It seems that the bus was at a high speed when it rammed into the schoolchildren," police said. The injured were taken to a civil hospital where they are undergoing treatment.

title: Anuj, Suyash have created positive impact on games: Maxwell
body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has praised teammates Anuj Rawat and Suyash Prabhudessai for their performances in the ongoing IPL season, stating that the youngsters have "created a positive impact" on the games despite not scoring too many runs. Rawat, who is RCB's opening batter, has scored 125 runs in six matches while Suyash has scored 40 runs in two games.

title: Hardik has absolutely thrived in captaincy role for GT in IPL: Kirsten
body: Praising Hardik Pandya for leading GT in IPL 2022, batting coach Gary Kirsten said Hardik is a class and has absolutely thrived in the new role of a captain. "He's a fantastic batter...can play in a lot of different ways...he's played with great maturity," Kirsten added. GT are currently on top of standings, winning five of six matches so far.

title: NEET aspirant in Bhopal kills sister-in-law as her son's cries disturbed his studies
body: A 22-year-old man allegedly stabbed his 25-year-old sister-in-law to death, angry that the constant cries of her two-year-old son disturbed him as he prepared for the medical entrance exam NEET in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. The accused took a knife from the kitchen and stabbed her brutally and killed her on the spot, police added. The accused was arrested.

title: Pune RTO revenue exceeds pre-pandemic level in 2021
body: The revenue of Pune's Regional Transport Office (RTO) exceeded the pre-COVID-19 pandemic level in 2021, according to government data. The revenue, mainly generated through vehicle registrations, reached ₹1,027 crore in 2021, up from ₹1,020 crore seen in 2019. "With the situation improving and curbs being relaxed, revenue generation has returned to normal," said an RTO officer.

title: Silly mistakes and not handling pressure well cost us game vs RR: McCullum
body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum said a couple of silly mistakes and not handling pressure as well as they should have, cost them the game against RR. "We were trying to hold Cummins for the seamers...Mavi's role was to...get through [Yuzvendra Chahal]. Unfortunately, we weren't able to execute [that]," he added. RR's Chahal picked four wickets in KKR's 17th over.

title: 'Pol Khol' campaign vehicle vandalised in Mumbai; BJP blames Shiv Sena
body: BJP's 'Pol Khol' campaign vehicle, one of the 40 screen-mounted vans, was found vandalised in Mumbai's Chembur on Tuesday morning, the party said. BJP leader Pravin Darekar said that Shiv Sena was behind the attack and asked the police to arrest the "hooligans" involved without delay. BJP uses the vehicle to campaign against Shiv Sena ahead of Mumbai civic elections.

title: Mariupol is still contested between Russia & Ukraine: US official
body: The besieged Ukrainian city of Mariupol is still contested between Russian and Ukrainian forces, a senior US official said. The city remains under threat from Russian missile and artillery strikes, the official added. There are roughly 76 Russian battalion tactical groups in southern and eastern Ukraine, an increase of about 11 in recent days, the official further said.

title: 2 killed as BJP MLA's Scorpio rams into motorcycle in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
body: Two men were killed when their motorcycle and a Scorpio car collided head-on in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri, police said. Police added that the Scorpio car is said to belong to Lakhimpur Kheri Sadar MLA Yogesh Verma. Reports said that the SUV is registered in the name of MLA's wife Neelam Verma. Police took the Scorpio driver into its custody.

title: Ashwin's running celebration after dismissing Russell for golden duck goes viral
body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin's running celebration after dismissing Andre Russell for a golden duck with a carrom ball has gone viral. After Russell got clean bowled, Ashwin was seen running with both his hands pointing towards him. Ashwin registered figures of 4-0-38-1 in the match, which RR won by seven runs.

title: Drew references from my mom for 'Jersey' role: Mrunal Thakur
body: Actress Mrunal Thakur has revealed that she plays a mother in Shahid Kapoor-starrer upcoming film 'Jersey', adding that it is something she hasn't really experienced in real life. "So I drew references from my mother for the part," the actress said. Mrunal further said that she has waited for the film to hit the big screen for a long time.

title: Lt Gen Manoj Pande appointed Indian Army chief, 1st engineer to hold the post
body: Lieutenant General Manoj Pande has been appointed as the new Indian Army chief. He's the first Corps of Engineers officer to hold the post. Pande, who was appointed Vice Chief of the Army Staff in February 2022, will succeed General MM Naravane as Army chief. A decision on the appointment of the Chief of Defence Staff is reportedly still pending.

title: Rise in private debt due to COVID-19 may affect growth over 3 yrs: IMF
body: A chapter of the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook said debt accumulated by the private sector during the COVID-19 pandemic could lower growth for emerging markets by 1.3% over three years. For developed nations, growth is expected to be reduced by 0.9%. IMF had earlier forecasted advanced and emerging markets to grow at 3.9% and 4.8% in 2022.

title: Siblings aged 3 & 6 drown in canal in Pune; bodies recovered
body: The bodies of two siblings, aged three and six, were recovered on Monday night after they drowned in a canal in Pune's Sortapwadi. Police believe that the children were riding a bicycle near the canal and had fallen in after losing control. The children's family had found the bicycle and footwear at the banks of the canal during a search.

title: South Korea removes most COVID-19 restrictions as virus cases drop
body: South Korea has lifted most of its COVID-19 restrictions as new coronavirus cases dropped to 47,743 on Monday, the country's lowest daily tally in over two months. A midnight curfew on restaurants and other businesses has been removed, along with a limit of 10 people allowed to gather. People are, however, still required to wear masks outdoors.

title: I've become more expressive after 'Bigg Boss 15': Karan Kundrra
body: Karan Kundrra, speaking about life after 'Bigg Boss 15', has said that he has become more expressive. Karan added, "A lot has changed...I am not scared of talking because...I have an image." "Everybody thought that I am this arrogant, strict, angry person, like Roadies...Then people realise that he is not," he stated. Karan was the second runner-up in the show.

title: Deleted, was creating chaos: MP BJP chief's wife on Hindu-Muslim unity tweet
body: Madhya Pradesh BJP chief VD Sharma's wife Stuti Mishra said that she has deleted her tweet on 'Hindu-Muslim unity' because it was creating "unnecessary chaos". "It's difficult to share thoughts on a topic of religious fight. Was not [aimed] to hurt anyone's opinion. Let karma do the rest," she said. She had earlier tweeted about a "caring" Muslim shopkeeper.

title: ₹10.5 cr wastewater treatment facility inaugurated at Byculla Zoo
body: A wastewater treatment facility was inaugurated at Mumbai's Byculla Zoo by Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday. The ₹10.5 crore facility, constructed by BMC, has the capacity to treat 5 lakh litres of water. It will be used by the zoo to reuse its wastewater for watering its garden and also for cleaning and drinking purposes.

title: Shakti Kapoor shares pic with Ranjeet and Asrani among others
body: Veteran actor Shakti Kapoor on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture with veteran actors Ranjeet, Dilip Joshi, Rakesh Bedi, Puneet Issar and Asrani. He captioned the picture, "Last eve was nice meeting old friends." A social media user commented on Shakti's post, "Peripona to all our legends," while another one wrote, "Fantastic frame of friendship."

title: David Miller smashes 94*(51) as GT hand CSK their 5th defeat in IPL 2022
body: GT batter David Miller smashed an unbeaten 94 off 51 deliveries as his team chased down the 170-run target in 19.5 overs against CSK. GT have now won five matches in IPL 2022, while CSK have now lost five out of their first six matches. CSK fast bowler Chris Jordan conceded 58 runs in 3.5 overs.

title: Ajay Devgn & Tabu-starrer 'Bholaa' to release on March 30, 2023
body: Taking to Twitter, Ajay Devgn has announced that his upcoming film 'Bholaa' will release on March 30, 2023. The action-drama film is an official Hindi remake of the 2019 Tamil film 'Kaithi'. The film will also feature Tabu and will be directed by Dharmendra Sharma. Ajay Devgn Ffilms, T-Series Films, Reliance Entertainment and Dream Warrior Pictures will produce 'Bholaa'.

title: 2 men held for opening fire at Pataudi civic panel chief's house
body: Two men were arrested on Saturday for allegedly opening fire on the house of Pataudi Municipal Committee Chairman Chander Bhan Sehgal. The police said that they had recovered an illegal pistol, two magazines and three cartridges from their possession. Notably, Sehgal had earlier claimed that he was threatened by a gangster, who sought a share in his liquor business.

title: India world's largest producer of milk; turnover more than wheat, rice output: PM
body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said India produces milk worth ₹8.5 lakh crore annually, more than the turnover of wheat and rice. "Today, India is the world's largest producer of milk...Small farmers are the biggest beneficiaries of the dairy sector," the PM added. PM Modi was inaugurating a new dairy complex at Banas Dairy in Gujarat's Banaskantha district.
