title: Ukraine-returned students protest in Delhi, seek admission in India
body: Students who returned from Ukraine, along with their parents staged a protest at Delhi's Jantar Mantar demanding admission to Indian institutions. "The government should save our children's careers the way they saved their lives and brought them back from Ukraine," said one of the parents. Over 20,000 Indian students returned to India after the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: My 2nd wife wanted me to quit DJing & be an actor: Lock Upp's Ali on divorce
body: On Sunday's episode of the reality show, 'Lock Upp', contestant Ali Mercchant revealed that he got married for the second time, in 2016 and got divorced in December 2021. Ali said his second wife did not want him to be a DJ. "She wanted me to quit DJing and be an actor...Our life philosophies did not match," he added.

title: Mahindra praises Mumbai's new bus stops with exercise bars, 'cool' green tops
body: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday took to Twitter to share a video about 105 Mumbai bus stops that are set to be revamped. The new bus stops will be cleaner, safer, sleeker, and feature plant-covered roofs and exercise bars. "Terrific to also see innovative features like the exercise bar & the 'cool' green tops," Mahindra tweeted.

title: Villagers stage protest against toll plaza in Gurugram
body: Residents of villages along the Sohna road on Monday protested at the Ghamroj toll plaza in Gurugram, demanding an exemption from paying the toll tax. The protesters also threatened to raze toll plaza if the toll is not made free for locals by Wednesday. A resident said, "(Nitin) Gadkari...said that nearby residents will get free passes but we're being charged."

title: Girl whose pic with contact details on her back went viral escapes Ukraine war
body: A girl whose picture with contact details written on her back went viral has escaped Ukraine war along with her mother. The girl's mother Makoviy wrote the details on her back in case they were separated in the war. Makoviy confirmed that she and Vira escaped Ukraine and have been living in a French village with her mother.

title: 28-yr-old man missing since communal clashes in MP's Khargone found dead
body: A 28-year-old man, who went missing following communal clashes in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone on April 10, has been found dead. The man succumbed to his injuries on April 12, but they hadn't been able to identify him for six days, police said. Police have denied the allegations of the man's family, who claimed that he was killed in police custody.

title: From the first draft, I knew I wanted Taapsee to do my film: Sudhir Mishra
body: Discussing his upcoming short film in an untitled anthology produced by filmmaker Anubhav Sinha and Bhushan Kumar, director Sudhir Mishra said, "From the first draft, I knew I wanted Taapsee Pannu to do the film." Taapsee stated that she had a "ball of a time", creating memories of a "lifetime". The anthology is based on stories around the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Have written a very strong story: Director Koratala Siva on 'NTR30'
body: Filmmaker Koratala Siva, speaking about his upcoming film with Jr NTR, has said, "Pre-production work currently going on...we're aiming to commence the shoot in June." "Have written a very strong story...which can reach a large set of audience" he added. The film is tentatively named 'NTR30'. Reportedly, Alia Bhatt was offered the female lead, however, she declined.

title: Japan's health ministry approves Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine
body: Japan's health ministry on Tuesday approved Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine as the fourth foreign-developed vaccine for use in the country. The ministry's experts panel endorsed the protein-based vaccine a day earlier. The Japanese government has agreed to purchase 150 million doses of Novavax's COVID-19 vaccine which is expected to be available for use by late May.

title: Infosys shares fall 9% in intra-day trade post Q4 results, its biggest fall in 2 yrs
body: Infosys' shares dropped 9% to ₹1592.05 on the BSE in Monday's intra-day trade owing to its weak Q4 results, making this its biggest fall in the market in two years. The plunge wiped out ₹47,907.7 crore from its market valuation. Earlier on March 23, 2020, Infosys plunged 12% in the intra-day trade on the BSE.

title: Post-Nadal stage will be difficult for Spanish tennis: Ferrer
body: Ex-world number three David Ferrer said it'll be a "difficult stage" for Spanish tennis after 35-year-old Rafael Nadal's retirement from the sport, adding the 21-time Grand Slam champion's shadow covers a lot. "There'll be no other player like him [Nadal]. But we're lucky. We've Carlos Alcaraz who is going to be a benchmark for Spanish tennis," he added.

title: Body of New York woman found in duffel bag, was stabbed 60 times
body: Police are looking for the person who stabbed a New York City woman to death and dumped her body in a duffel bag. Orsolya Gaal was killed in the basement of her home by an unidentified attacker, who then dragged her body and left it on a street corner on Saturday. The 51-year-old woman was reportedly stabbed nearly 60 times.

title: Tripura govt orders mass execution of pigs amid African Swine Fever outbreak
body: After Mizoram, Tripura government has now detected cases of African Swine Fever (ASF) at an Animal Resources Development Department-run breeding farm in the state. Over 60 pigs reportedly died due to unknown reasons, raising an alarm about the virus. Following the detection of cases, Tripura has ordered a mass execution of pigs in different phases.

title: Leonardo said 'Go ahead': Amy on joke about his girlfriends at Oscars
body: Comedian Amy Schumer has revealed actor Leonardo DiCaprio's reaction to her joke that she cracked while hosting the Oscars 2022. Amy had joked, "Leonardo's done so much to fight climate change and leave behind a cleaner, greener planet...for his girlfriends...Because he's older and they're younger." Talking about Leonardo's reaction, Amy said, "He said, 'Go ahead.' They didn't care."

title: Hardik shares pics with MS Dhoni ahead of their IPL 2022 clash, calls him 'My main man'
body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya took to Instagram to share pictures of himself with former CSK captain MS Dhoni. The duo met each other ahead of their IPL 2022 clash, which will take place tonight. "My main man," Hardik captioned the post. GT are currently on the top of the points table, while CSK are ninth.

title: Manish Malhotra shares pic of Alia in her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make
body: Fashion designer Manish Malhotra shared a picture of Alia Bhatt wearing her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make. "Alia...chose to personalise [the] ensemble with...sustainable approach...where approximately 180 textile patches come together to mark her momentous occasion," he wrote. "The custom touches reminisce about her journey and depict symbolic elements of her memories," he added.

title: UP govt allows maximum 1 month casual leave for employees infected with COVID-19
body: The Uttar Pradesh government has issued orders allowing its employees to go on a special causal leave, if infected with COVID-19. As per the order, employees infected with COVID-19 can be given the special leave for a maximum period of one month. The order mentions that this leave can be incurred by infected employees at any time.

title: Was a strong performance: Williamson on SRH's win against PBKS
body: After SRH's seven-wicket win against PBKS in IPL 2022, SRH skipper Kane Williamson praised his team for putting "strong performance" at DY Patil Stadium. "So far, we've managed to put out some strong performances...we'll continue to try...improve and put out better ones," he stated. This is fourth consecutive win for SRH, which have taken them to fourth spot in standings.

title: Johnny, Amber engaged in 'mutual abuse': Former marriage counsellor
body: In the defamation case filed by Johnny Depp against ex-wife Amber Heard, their former marriage counsellor has stated that they engaged in "mutual abuse". She added they were both domestically abused during childhood. "If Depp was [leaving] to de-escalate the fight, she'd hit him to keep him there...she'd rather be in a fight than have him leave," their counsellor said.

title: Rajasthan Royals defeat Kolkata Knight Riders in 427-run thriller
body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) defeated Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) by seven runs in their IPL 2022 match on Monday to jump to the second position on the points table. RR put up a total of 217/5 with Jos Buttler scoring 103(61). KKR were bowled out for 210 in 19.4 overs. RR's Yuzvendra Chahal recorded figures of 4-0-40-5, including a hat-trick.

title: 50 Russian artists' paintings stuck in S Korea due to sanctions
body: Paintings by around 50 Russian artists which were loaned to Sejong Museum of Art in South Korea's Seoul are stuck there due to sanctions imposed by multiple countries amid Russia-Ukraine conflict, organisers said on Monday. The situation has been caused as all flights to Moscow have been shut due to sanctions, AFP reported. The paintings were loaned for an exhibition.

title: Intense solar storm hits Earth, causes radio blackout in parts of Asia & Australia
body: An intense solar storm hit the Earth over the past weekend and caused radio blackouts in parts of Asia and Australia, US Space Weather Prediction Center said. As per the agency, the solar flare peaked late on Sunday (April 17) at 3.34 GMT (9.04 IST) and lasted around 34 minutes. It was followed by a massive Coronal Mass Ejection (CME).

title: They once had to eat samosas for breakfast: Rai on issues faced by India Women in 2017 WC
body: Talking about issues faced by India Women during 2017 World Cup, Vinod Rai revealed ahead of India's semi-final match against Australia, the players couldn't get the food they were supposed to. "They had to eat samosas for breakfast that morning!" Rai added that Harmanpreet Kaur, who scored 171* in that match, told him that she was cramping during her knock.

title: World's tallest woman now holds 3 more Guinness records, pics surface
body: Guinness World Records has announced that Rumeysa Gelgi, considered the world's tallest woman, now holds three more world records. Gelgi, who's 7 feet and 0.7 inches tall, now holds the record for the longest finger (female). Additionally, she holds the record for 'largest hands on a living person (female)'. Gelgi also has the longest back (female), measuring 59.9 cm.

title: Gambhir said 'Look at your initials': Suryakumar Yadav on how he got nickname 'SKY'
body: Talking about how he got nickname 'SKY', batter Suryakumar Yadav revealed that when he was with KKR in 2014, Gautam Gambhir started calling him 'SKY' but he didn't pay attention. "Gambhir said, 'I am calling you only. Check your initials.' Then I realised it's 'SKY'," Suryakumar said. Suryakumar played for KKR from 2014 to 2017.

title: I work best under pressure but won't worry myself into mess: Arjun Bijlani
body: Actor Arjun Bijlani said he works best under pressure, but won't have sleepless nights or fret and worry himself into a "mess" for it. "I have never been someone to get bogged down by pressure and numbers," added Arjun. "I have been in the industry [long] enough to not want to take up the same run-of-the-mill roles," stated Arjun.

title: 3 RSS workers held for murder of PFI leader in Palakkad
body: Kerala Police arrested three RSS workers for the murder of the Popular Front of India (PFI) leader, A Subair, which took place last week in Palakkad, on Tuesday. According to ADGP Vijay Sakhare, the killing of Subair was an act of revenge for an RSS worker's murder in November last year. The accused are identified as Ramesh, Arumughan and Saravanan.

title: I found it cute: Srinidhi on Shehnaaz giving away spoiler of KGF 2
body: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' actress Srinidhi Shetty, on being asked about Shehnaaz Gill giving away a major spoiler on Twitter, said she "really really found it quite cute". Srinidhi added she initially didn't believe Shehnaaz spoiled it and thought it was a fan page. Shehnaaz praised Srinidhi's performance, writing, "You deserve the compliments since you took a bullet for Rocky bhai."

title: 1 kg of hand-rolled Japanese tea leaves sells for nearly ₹12 lakh
body: One kilogram of new hand-rolled Japanese green tea leaves was sold for a record 1.96 million yen (nearly ₹12 lakh) at an auction in Japan on Monday. The hand-finished Samidori leaves are from Japan's Shizuoka prefecture, which is famous for quality green tea. Before this, the record for most expensive tea sold in Japan reportedly stood at 1.08 million yen.

title: MP man thrashes elder brother to death after being denied ₹100, arrested
body: Police have arrested a 48-year-old man for allegedly thrashing his elder brother to death after being denied ₹100 by him in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district, police said on Monday. The incident took place on Sunday evening. Reports said that the accused slammed his brother on the ground several times, which eventually led to his death.

title: Delhi records over 500 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 4.21%
body: Delhi on Sunday reported 517 fresh COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, as compared to 461 cases recorded in the national capital on Saturday. The city also saw 261 COVID-19 recoveries and zero related deaths in the last 24 hours. The city's positivity rate on Sunday was at 4.21% as compared to 5.33% on Saturday.

title: Stuff of dreams: Harbhajan on Umran's maiden over with 3 wickets vs PBKS
body: Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to praise Umran Malik after the SRH pacer delivered a maiden 20th over against PBKS in IPL 2022. He wrote, "This last over by Umran was surreal. A maiden with three wickets and a run-out. Stuff of dreams!...Blue jersey coming soon." Parthiv Patel tweeted, "This is serious stuff from Umran. Pace and accuracy."

title: Akhilesh extends support to Dalit boy who was made to lick feet in UP
body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav extended support to the Dalit boy who was assaulted and made to lick the feet of an accused as seen in a viral video and promised him admission in Kendriya Vidyalaya. Yadav also ensured safety of his entire family. SP blamed BJP for this incident and said that caste discrimination is "a gift given by BJP".

title: 21-year-old MBBS student found hanging at her residence in Chandigarh
body: A 21-year-old MBBS student of Government Medical College and Hospital was found hanging at her residence in Chandigarh's Sector 22, police said. "The incident came to light when her mother visited her...She knocked...didn't receive any response," police added. "The mother said her daughter was scheduled to go to college for taking admission in current semester...she was nervous," police stated.

title: KKR looked likely to win with more than an over to spare, loss will hurt: Ojha
body: Reacting to KKR's defeat by seven runs against RR, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said the loss will "hurt" KKR considering a win for them with more than an over to spare seemed likely at one stage. RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal recorded a five-wicket haul, including a hat-trick, to help his franchise win their fourth match in the tournament.

title: Goa CM should withdraw comments on 'religious conversion': Cong leader
body: Congress' Michael Lobo reacted to Goa CM Pramod Sawant's comments on 'religious conversion', stating that Sawant should withdraw the "unwarranted" remarks. "[Sawant's] trying to polarise one section of the society...[he] needs to take everyone along," Lobo added. Sawant had said that Goa government will never allow religious conversions in the state, adding that people should be vigilant about it.

title: Colourful seadragons wash up on Australian beaches after record rainfall
body: Dozens of colourful sea creatures have washed up on various Australian beaches following weeks of record rainfall. Pictures of the seadragons stranded on the beaches of Cronulla, Malabar and the Central Coast have been shared online. Experts say that the number of seadragons seen on beaches has been ten times the normal amount during the recent weeks.

title: No changes made: Google on claims it 'stopped hiding' Russian military facilities
body: Google has denied claims by many Google Maps users that it has 'stopped hiding' Russia's secret military facilities. Many users shared satellite pics of the facilities saying that they've been 'unblurred', giving anyone a view of the installations and command posts amid Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We haven't made any blurring changes to our satellite imagery in Russia," said Google.

title: Chahal and Buttler's performances were there for the world to see: Samson
body: Speaking at the post-match ceremony after their 7-run win against KKR, RR captain Sanju Samson said, "Yuzvendra Chahal and Jos Buttler's performances were there for the world to see." He added, "Halfway, I thought [our total] was chaseable. KKR played very well...but the wickets helped." Chahal took a hat-trick in his five-wicket haul while Buttler scored 103(61) in the game.

title: Huma Qureshi shares her look from chef Tarla Dalal's biopic
body: Actress Huma Qureshi took to Instagram on Tuesday to share her look from a film based on the life of India's first-ever home chef Tarla Dalal. The actress will play the lead role in the upcoming biopic, titled 'Tarla'. Produced by Ronnie Screwvala, Ashwiny Iyer Tiwari, and Nitesh Tiwari, 'Tarla' will be directed by Piyush Gupta.

title: High temp, low maintenance behind rise in Delhi's fire incidents: DFS Chief
body: The Delhi Fire Service (DFS) Chief Atul Garg has said that the soaring temperatures and low fire safety maintenance in public places have led to the "spike in numbers" of Delhi's fire incidents this month. Notably, 2,219 fire calls were reported from Delhi between April 1 and 17. In 2021, the number was 3,240 for the entire April month.

title: Spain seizes 3 tonnes of cocaine from fishing boat off Canary Islands
body: The Spanish Police said that they've seized nearly three tonnes of cocaine from a fishing boat off the Canary Islands. Five crew members, four Turkish citizens and one person from the ex-Soviet republic of Georgia, were arrested. The street value of the cocaine was estimated to be 72 million euros, which had been hidden in one of the fuel tanks.

title: Ranbir's brother-in-law Bharat shares new pics from Ranbir-Alia's wedding
body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor's brother-in-law and entrepreneur Bharat Sahni, who is married to Ranbir's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni, took to Instagram on Sunday to share new pictures from Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding ceremonies. "Last few days have been straight out of a fairytale," Sahni wrote. He added, "Congratulations to the beautiful couple."

title: Keerthy congratulates Madhavan's son on bagging gold at Danish Open
body: Actress Keerthy Suresh took to Twitter to congratulate Madhavan's 16-year-old son Vedaant on winning a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. "Kudos to the champion Vedaant Madhavan. Your achievement is an inspiration to all! Congratulations to the proud father," she wrote. Vedaant won the medal in the 800m swimming event.

title: Rahul Gandhi lacks stability, can't be entrusted with responsibilities: PJ Kurien
body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is a leader who has “no stability” and cannot be entrusted with responsibilities, senior party leader PJ Kurien said. "The captain cannot leave the ship when it is in trouble. After the 2019 elections, he resigned abruptly from the post (of Congress chief). But, he continues to take important decisions in the party," Kurien added.

title: Citigroup initiates 'buy' rating on Paytm, raises target price by 32%
body: Citigroup Research has initiated 'buy' rating on Paytm owner One97 Communications and raised its target price to ₹910/share, up 32% from its current levels. Paytm's stock price has dropped nearly 70% from its IPO price of ₹2,150 led by regulatory headwinds and concerns about profitability. "Paytm has several potential levers to drive scale and improve profitability substantially," Citigroup said.

title: Don't remember last time I saw damsel in distress on screen: Avantika
body: Actress Avantika Dassani has stated that she doesn't remember the last time she saw a damsel in distress on the screen. "Everyone keeps asking me this question and I ask them the last time they saw it too," she added. The actress further said that she doesn't want to limit herself to anything, adding that all experiences are welcome.

title: Which batters have smashed 6 boundaries in an over in IPL history?
body: As many as 11 batters have smashed six boundaries in an over in IPL history. Chris Gayle and Suresh Raina have hit seven boundaries in an over, while Jos Buttler has smashed six boundaries in an over twice. Pat Cummins and Dinesh Karthik are the two cricketers to have hit six boundaries in an over in IPL 2022.

title: 195-shot rally takes place during women's doubles badminton match
body: South Korea's Baek Ha Na and Lee Yu Rim won a marathon battle against China's Du Yue and Li Wen Mei to enter the final of the 2022 Gwangju YONEX Korea Masters. While there were several rallies that went over 50 shots during the women's doubles badminton game, a "record-breaking" 195-shot rally also took place during the game.

title: 2 youths die after drowning in waterfall on Nagaon-Karbi Anglong border
body: Two youths lost their lives after  they drowned in a waterfall on Assam's Nagaon-Karbi Anglong district border. Police said that the deceased have been identified as Sajadul Islam and Raj Bora. Reports said that four people including the deceased had visited the waterfall and had gone missing. Police added that they reached the spot after getting information from the locals.

title: Wanted to give him option against spin: McCullum on Venkatesh batting at no. 6
body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum said they wanted to give all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer, who opened their batting in all earlier games, an option against the spin and that's why he was moved to number six against RR on Monday. "We thought that Narine and Finch at the top was a very good opportunity," added McCullum. KKR lost by seven runs.

title: Virat Kohli goes 100 professional matches without scoring a hundred
body: India and RCB batter Virat Kohli has now gone 100 professional matches without scoring a hundred. Kohli, who got out for a golden duck against LSG today, has played 17 Tests, 21 ODIs, 25 T20Is and 37 IPL matches since scoring his previous hundred in November 2019. Kohli's previous hundred came in a Test against Bangladesh.

title: Man dies by suicide after killing his family in UP's Ghazipur
body: A 35-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after killing his wife and two children in the Sadat Bazaar area of Ghazipur in Uttar Pradesh. According to the local police sub-inspector Mahendra Yadav, the accused, identified as Shivdas Sonekar, killed his wife Reena (30) and two children, aged five and three years, by smothering them with a pillow.

title: Second Global COVID-19 Summit scheduled for May 12: US
body: The second Global COVID-19 Summit will be held on May 12 to discuss efforts to end the pandemic and prepare for future health threats, the US has announced. The virtual gathering will be co-chaired by the US, along with G7, G20, African Union and CARICOM, a Caribbean grouping. "Together, we can mitigate the impact of COVID-19," a joint statement said.

title: Boney Kapoor shares throwback pic of Arjun Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor
body: Boney Kapoor took to Instagram on Tuesday to share an old picture of Arjun Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor. "Arjun and Janhvi in a playful mood in Burlington (Vermont, USA) during the shooting of our film 'KHUSHI'," he captioned the post. 'Khushi', starring Fardeen Khan and Kareena Kapoor, was released in 2003. The film was produced by Boney.

title: Cycle theft accused dies in custody in Odisha, family alleges torture
body: A cycle theft accused from Odisha's Bhubaneswar, who died in police custody after being arrested on Sunday, was allegedly tortured, his family has claimed. The deceased's wife said she found her husband dead after being asked to come to the hospital late at night. "If...police nabbed my husband at 7.30 pm, why did they inform...at 1.30 am," his wife said.

title: Maybe we missed something in script: Prabhas on Radhe Shyam's performance
body: Prabhas, speaking about the underwhelming performance of his latest film 'Radhe Shyam' at the box office, said, "Maybe COVID or maybe we missed something in script." "Maybe people don't want to watch me in that zone, even if they want to watch - maybe they expect me to be too good," said Prabhas, who played a palmist in 'Radhe Shyam'.

title: Sounds high: Musk on Meta spending $26.8 mn on Zuckerberg's security
body: World's richest person Elon Musk in response to a story on Meta spending $26.8 million on CEO Mark Zuckerberg's security in 2021 said, "Sounds high." The figure was reportedly 6% higher than $25.3 million spent in 2020. Private travel and costs associated with security protocols due to the COVID-19 were cited as reasons for such costs in 2021.

title: Delhi HC seeks report from authorities on electric, CNG crematoriums
body: The Delhi High Court asked the local authorities to file a report in four weeks on number of electric and CNG crematoriums in the city and the steps taken to promote them instead of the wood pyres. The High Court bench gave the order while hearing petitions concerning burial and cremation of dead bodies amid the COVID-19 outbreak last year.

title: 2 captured Britons come on Russian state TV, ask to be swapped with Putin ally
body: Two British soldiers captured in Ukraine by Russian forces appeared on Russian state TV on Monday and asked to be exchanged for an ally of Vladimir Putin known as the 'Prince of darkness'. Shaun Pinner and Aiden Aslin appealed to UK PM Boris Johnson to negotiate their release in exchange for Viktor Medvedchuk, a Ukrainian politician who's close to Putin.

title: PM should directly intervene: RJD MP Manoj Jha on Delhi violence
body: RJD MP Manoj Jha has urged PM Narendra Modi to directly intervene and give a "strong message" in regards to the recent Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi. "The Jahangirpuri incident isn't isolated. If you look at the images of different places...then there is a pattern. I request PM for his direct intervention...give a strong message," Jha said.

title: Indian economy will be worse than Sri Lanka, Ukraine with riots politics: Raut
body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that India's economy will be worse than that of Sri Lanka and Ukriane with the "politics of riots". "In big cities of the country...the way situation is tense or such a situation has been created, it's highly unfortunate...Riots are happening in national capital. Delhi is a centre-administered state...it is a union territory," he added

title: President gives assent to Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill
body: President of India Ram Nath Kovind has given his assent to the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, which allows police to obtain physical and biological samples of convicts and those accused of crimes. Moreover, it also empowers a magistrate to order measurements or photographs of a person to be taken to aid the investigation of an offence.

title: Ukraine sought $50 bn in financial support from G7 nations: Official
body: Ukraine has sought $50 billion in financial support from G7 countries to help it cover a war-linked budget deficit over the next six months, a senior Ukrainian official said. The official also said that the government is considering issuing 0% coupon bonds to help it deal with the deficit. Notably, all the G7 nations have strongly opposed the Russian invasion.

title: Zoya Akhtar's 'Archies' starring Suhana, Khushi & Agastya goes on floor
body: Filmmaker Zoya Akhtar on Monday began shooting for her upcoming Netflix live-action musical film 'The Archies'. The film reportedly features Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan, Boney Kapoor's daughter Khushi Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda in the lead roles. Sharing a picture of a clapboard, producer Reema Kagti wrote, "Archie's shoot starts."

title: Only hundred by a KKR player was hit in the 1st-ever IPL match
body: Brendon McCullum smashed the only hundred by a KKR player in the first-ever IPL match against RCB at Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru on April 18, 2008. He slammed 158* off 73 balls, including 13 sixes and 10 fours. It remained the highest IPL score till Chris Gayle slammed 175*(66) against PWI in 2013.

title: Centre notifies merger of 3 municipal corporations in Delhi into 1
body: The Central government has notified the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Act, 2022, merging Delhi's East, South, and North Delhi Municipal Corporations into one. The corporation will be known as the 'Municipal Corporation of Delhi'. The government will also appoint a special officer to discharge functions of the corporation, until the date on which the corporation's first meeting is held.

title: India sees 2,183 new COVID-19 cases, 90% rise in daily cases
body: India has reported 2,183 new COVID-19 cases and 214 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Kerala reported 213 deaths including 151 deaths during the day and 62 reconciled deaths and Uttar Pradesh reported one death, according to government. It comes a day after the country saw 1,150 cases and four deaths.

title: Shiv Sena MLA Mangesh Kudalkar’s wife dies by suicide
body: Shiv Sena MLA Mangesh Kudalkar's wife died by suicide in Mumbai's Kurla on Sunday. The 42-year-old, Rajni Kudalkar, was reportedly found hanging in the kitchen of her house by a family member who called the police. The police said they are trying to find out the reason behind the incident and will record statements of the family members.

title: 4 wickets fall in an over in IPL without any runs scored for 1st time ever
body: The SRH-PBKS match in IPL 2022 marked the first instance of four wickets falling in an over in IPL without any runs scored. SRH fast bowler Umran Malik took three wickets without conceding any run in PBKS' 20th over. SRH took another wicket on the last delivery through run-out. Umran recorded bowling figures of 4-1-28-4 in the match.

title: Lay down your weapons immediately: Russia to Ukraine forces
body: Russia has called on Ukrainian forces to "immediately lay down arms". This comes as Russia launched a new offensive in east Ukraine. Meanwhile, blasts were also heard in Kharkiv in the northeast, Mykolaiv in the south and Zaporizhzhia in the southeast while air raid sirens were also going off in main centres near the front line, officials and media said.

title: I feel more content with the scripts I'm offered in South: Hansika
body: Actress Hansika Motwani said that she is more content with the scripts offered to her in South Indian films. "I enjoy doing all kinds of cinema, but I get more roles offered here," she added. However, she stated that being an entertainer, she'll entertain in any language if she gets a chance. "I have never put barricades around," she stated.

title: Non-BJP CMs likely to meet to discuss political situation: Raut
body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday said a conference of non-BJP Chief Ministers is likely to be held in Mumbai to discuss the prevailing political situation in India. West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee had earlier written to non-BJP CMs on the same matter. Issues including unemployment, inflation and attempts to create communal discord will be discussed, Raut added.

title: 3 men arrested for ATM fraud in Ludhiana, 31 cards recovered
body: Three men were arrested on Sunday, two days after a woman’s debit card was swapped with a fake one at an ATM on Sua Road, Ludhiana. As many as 31 stolen cards were recovered from them. "The accused would target ATMs without a security guard, and offer to help those facing trouble carrying out transactions," ADCP, BS Randhawa, said.

title: US official to visit Solomon Islands amid concerns over China pact
body: The White House on Monday said that US Indo-Pacific Coordinator Kurt Campbell will visit the Solomon Islands this week, amid concerns about the potential security pact between the island country and China. Earlier, Australia's Minister for the Pacific had visited the country to discuss the proposed security pact. The agreement would allow China to deploy its military in the region.

title: Easy tiger, why do you always fight: Rahul jokingly tells Krishna over fight with Finch
body: RR fast bowler Prasidh Krishna took to Instagram to share pictures from their match against KKR, which they won by seven runs. Referring to KKR opener Aaron Finch and Krishna's verbal fight in the match, KL Rahul jokingly commented, "Easy tiger. Yakk jagla adtya yavaglu? (Why do you always fight?)"

title: Instagram rolls out product tagging for public account users in US
body: Instagram has enabled tagging products in feed posts for all public account users in the US. In a blog post, Instagram explained how the feature would work and said that the idea behind this is to support small businesses and help them get traction. The platform also said they are working on ways for users to tag products in Stories.

title: Which Indian crypto exchanges recently disabled UPI and other payment options?
body: Indian crypto exchange CoinSwitch Kuber recently disabled all modes of payments for purchasing crypto on its platform. WazirX and CoinDCX announced that rupee deposits through MobiKwik have been temporarily suspended. While BuyUcoin Co-founder Atulya Bhatt said the platform has halted UPI payments, Mudrex CEO Edul Patel told Bloomberg that Indian payment gateways have started withdrawing support.

title: Cannabis worth ₹2.33 cr seized from truck in Andhra’s Anakapalle
body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized 1169.3 kg of cannabis worth about ₹2.33 crore from Andhra Pradesh’s Anakapalle district. A substantial quantity of cannabis was being transported via a truck from Anakapalle towards Hyderabad via Vijayawada, as per DRI's press release. "DRI found the truck in an accident-met and abandoned condition in a trench," the release stated.

title: We started this as small Kannada project, only Yash had vision: Director on KGF
body: KGF Director Prashanth Neel, while talking about the film's success, said that the team never thought that they would be where they are today with the film. "The only person who had this vision was Yash. We started this as a small Kannada project and today the film is really big and the expectations are very high," Prashanth added.

title: Olivia Thirlby joins Downey Jr, Cillian Murphy in Nolan's 'Oppenheimer'
body: Olivia Thirlby, known for films like 'Juno' and 'Dredd', has joined the cast of Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer'. Olivia will be seen sharing screen space with Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr, Emily Blunt and Rami Malek in the upcoming project. It's based on the life of American physicist J Robert Oppenheimer and his role in the development of the atomic bomb.

title: Wherever there is encroachment, bulldozers should be used: MoS Lekhi
body: Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi on Tuesday said that bulldozers should be used to remove encroachments. "Whenever there is an encroachment on public property, it's important to remove it," Lekhi said. Talking about Delhi's Jahangirpuri incident that took place on Hanuman Jayanti, Lekhi said, "It's a conspiracy...to promote enmity to hamper law and order."

title: Both murders were planned: Kerala ADGP on SDPI & RSS workers' killings
body: After an SDPI worker and an RSS worker were killed in Kerala's Palakkad, ADGP Law and Order, Vijay Sakhare, on Monday said that undoubtedly, both the murders were "planned". "There was a conspiracy behind both the murders. We have a fair idea about who are the accused persons," Sakhare added. "The suspects will be caught soon," Sakhare stated.

title: Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan attend Baba Siddique’s annual Iftaar party, pics surface
body: Actors Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan and Sanjay Dutt attended Indian politician Baba Siddique's annual Iftaar party at Hotel Taj Lands End in Mumbai's Bandra. Baba Siddique hosted the party after a gap of two years owing to the COVID-19 pandemic. Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Kaur Sandhu also attended the party.

title: PM Modi to inaugurate India's 1st Semicon Conference on April 29 in B'luru
body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first 'Semicon India 2022 Conference' in Bengaluru on April 29. The three-day event will be organised around the theme - Design and Manufacture in India for the World: Making India a "Semiconductor Nation". According to MoS (Electronics and IT) Rajeev Chandrasekhar, the government is looking forward to sign several MoUs during the event.

title: Nadal trains for first time in a month since Indian Wells final, shares pic
body: Twenty-one time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal took to Twitter to share a photo of himself training for the first time since losing in Indian Wells Masters last month. "Today after four weeks without stepping on a tennis court, first light training. What an illusion to step on the earth again!" he wrote. Nadal had injured his rib in semi-final.

title: Made us proud: Akshay after R Madhavan's son Vedaant wins Gold at Danish Open
body: After actor R Madhavan's son Vedaant Madhavan bagged a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022, several actors including Akshay Kumar and Priyanka Chopra took to Twitter to congratulate him. Akshay wrote, "These young boys Sajan and Vedaant have made us...proud. I'm sure it's an amazing feeling as a parent." Priyanka tweeted, "Congratulations Vedaant! That's an amazing feat!"

title: Success in industry is how long you can hold breath underwater: Sonu
body: Actor Sonu Sood has stated that success in the film industry is how long you can hold your breath underwater. He added that the wait to get your due is endless, crushing and extremely demanding. "I have been trying to hold my breath all these years. Maybe now it's time to come up and say, 'Hey, I exist'," he said.

title: Biggest challenge in 'Jersey' was learning to play cricket at 39: Shahid
body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, on being asked about the biggest challenge playing a cricketer in upcoming film 'Jersey', said that it was learning to play cricket at the age of 39. He further said that he went through a lot of injuries. "I thought it'll be easy but I went through a very tough time learning the sport," the actor added.

title: Miller played a blinder, so did Rashid: GT's Abhinav Manohar on win vs CSK
body: GT batter Abhinav Manohar, who scored 12(12) against CSK, said he didn't move from his place when David Miller and stand-in captain Rashid Khan batted while chasing the 170-run target. "Miller played a blinder, and so did Rashid. I was sitting in the same place," he stated. Miller smashed 94*(51) while Rashid scored 40(21) to help GT defeat CSK.

title: No attempt made to hoist saffron flag at mosque in Jahangirpuri: Police
body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Monday said no attempt was made to hoist saffron flag at a mosque during the Hanuman Jayanti procession in Jahangirpuri on Saturday. "Some people are trying to disturb peace through the medium of social media," he said. The police chief added, "Legal action will be taken against those who are found spreading misinformation."

title: Maha Police begin action against those with cases of communal dispute
body: The Maharashtra Police have announced a list of steps they said they would take in order to maintain communal harmony amid the ongoing azaan row and the use of loudspeakers in mosques in the state. "Maharashtra Police started taking preventive action against those having cases regarding communal disputes and IPC section 153(A) and 295(A), against them," police said.

title: I am closest to Ishan Kishan in MI team: Suryakumar Yadav
body: On being asked to name his friends in MI, Suryakumar Yadav said he's "closest" to Ishan Kishan. "You've to have him around, whether you've won or lost...he can start up a conversation out of anything," he added. "We don't talk about cricket when we bat together," he further said. Suryakumar and Ishan are bottom-placed MI's top-two run-scorers in IPL 2022.

title: Interstate drug syndicate busted in Delhi, heroin worth ₹20 cr recovered
body: An interstate drug syndicate based in Manipur, West Bengal was busted in Delhi and the police recovered heroin worth ₹20 crore. The syndicate was indulged in the supply of drugs in the Northeast, West Bengal, Bihar, UP and Delhi NCR, said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Special Cell) Rajiv Ranjan.

title: Most important 3 points in your life: Klopp on match against Man Utd
body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said his players must treat the match against Manchester United on Tuesday like "it is the most important three points in your life". Liverpool trail Manchester City by one point in the Premier League with seven games left. "We have to be angry in a good way and all these kind of things," Klopp added.

title: Ex-BJP ward member shot dead in Odisha; accused's family attacked
body: A 56-year-old former BJP ward member was shot dead following a dispute over a pond in Odisha's Dhenkanal on Sunday. In response, the victim's family, along with their supporters, attacked the accused's family and torched their house, causing serious injuries to accused's wife and three-year-old son, police said. Dhenkanal BJP leader Ramchandra Patra claimed it to be a political killing.

title: Economics graduate sets up tea stall after not getting job in Bihar
body: An Economics graduate, Priyanka Gupta, has been running a tea stall near Women's College in Bihar's Patna after not getting a job in the last two years. The 24-year-old, who is from Purnea district, said she was inspired to run a tea stall from Prafull Billore, who runs a tea shop in Ahmedabad despite having an MBA degree.

title: Mumbai to soon become India's first city to get a 100% digital bus
body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) on Tuesday released a video on its Twitter handle showing the demo of India's first fully digital bus. For boarding and de-boarding, passengers can either flash their smartcards in front of a machine fixed at the bus' rear entrance or use the 'Chalo' mobile app. The fare will automatically be deducted when de-boarding.

title: Delhi Police under pressure from 'secular, Muslim' leaders: VHP
body: The Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) on Tuesday accused the Delhi Police of coming under pressure from "secular and Muslim leaders" to book the organisation in connection with the Jahangirpuri clashes. It also said that Delhi Commissioner of Police Rakesh Asthana's statement that it had not taken permission to take out the 'shobha yatra' through the area was "baseless".

title: Dalits stage protest in Rajasthan over attack on rally on Ambedkar Jayanti
body: Several Dalits gathered on the streets at Rajasthan's Bharatpur on Tuesday to protest against an alleged attack on a rally that took place on April 14 to mark Ambedkar Jayanti. They alleged that members of Gujjar community attacked them with sticks injuring nine people. Later, a false case of theft was also filed against over two dozen Dalits, they claimed.

title: When RCB picked Karthik in mega auction, we all wondered why: Manjrekar
body: Talking about RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said, "When RCB picked Karthik [in] the IPL mega auction, we were all wondering why." "It seemed like Karthik was past his prime and...was out of Team India as well. He hadn't done anything extraordinary for...KKR," added Manjrekar. Karthik has scored 197 runs in six IPL 2022 matches so far.

title: Good governance begins in the founders' heads: Info Edge Founder
body: Info Edge Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani tweeted, "Good governance begins in the founders' heads. No amount of oversight...can ensure a company is well governed if the founders are not committed." He added, "If you are better governed, you will sleep more peacefully at night." Bikhchandani's comments come after Sequoia Capital India published a blog on the need for better corporate governance.

title: Muralitharan picked up 800th Test wicket on his career's last ball
body: Ex-Sri Lankan off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, the only player in Test cricket history to take 800 wickets, picked up his 800th wicket on the final ball of his Test career. Muralitharan, who turns 50 today, dismissed India's Pragyan Ojha as his 800th Test wicket in July 2010. Muralitharan is the fastest to pick 400, 500, 600, 700 and 800 Test wickets.

title: Pune liquor shop manager killed for refusing to give free alcohol
body: A 40-year-old liquor shop manager was allegedly murdered in Pune's Vadgaon Budruk after he refused to entertain a demand for free alcohol and money. The 27-year-old accused had reportedly strangulated the manager in a fit of rage after being refused. He was arrested by police the same day and has been booked under relevant sections of the IPC.

title: Won’t accept N Korea’s escalating tests as normal: US envoy
body: A US official has called for a joint deterrent along with South Korea against North Korea's escalating weapons tests. "It is extremely important for the United Nations Security Council to send a clear signal to the DPRK (Democratic People's Republic of Korea) that we will not accept its escalatory tests as normal," said Sung Kim, US envoy on North Korea.

title: Fainting woman falls under moving train in Argentina; pulled out alive
body: A video showing a woman fainting and falling under a moving train in Argentina's Bueno Aires has surfaced online. The video showed the woman being pulled out alive after stopping the train before an ambulance took her away. "I don't know how I'm still alive. I'm still trying to make sense of it all," the woman said.

title: Duty to shut anything causing problems in a secular state: Assam CM
body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Monday said it's a duty to shut anything irritating students or other communities in a secular state. "If there's a genuine demand around exams (to not play loudspeakers), don't play it," Sarma said. He also expressed concerns regarding several attempts made by fundamentalists to create a base in Assam with the help of sympathisers.

title: Watching Umran bowl at 150 clicks an hour is super exciting: Steyn
body: SunRisers Hyderabad pace bowling coach Dale Steyn has said that watching the 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik "bowl at 150 clicks an hour consistently is super exciting". "Very often we try and create guys to make them more aware like changing your pace...But I think Umran is out and out raw. It's great to just let him loose," Steyn said.

title: BJP govt ruined health services in UP, poor dying: Akhilesh
body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday accused the ruling BJP of "ruining" the health services in Uttar Pradesh, alleging that the poor are "dying" due to lack of treatment. "People were orphaned during the COVID-19 pandemic. Even today, there is no sign of improvement and chaos is prevailing," he alleged.

title: 2 minors among 4 arrested for 15-yr-old tribal girl's gangrape in WB's Birbhum
body: Four persons, including two minors, have been arrested in connection with the alleged gangrape of a 15-year-old tribal girl in West Bengal's Birbhum on April 14, police said. The girl was allegedly dragged to a secluded place by a group before being raped when she was returning home along with a male friend, who was also assaulted.

title: 27-year-old Iñaki Williams goes 6 years without missing a La Liga match
body: Athletic Club forward Iñaki Williams has now gone six years without missing a La Liga match. The 27-year-old Spanish footballer achieved the feat after being named in starting XI for Sunday's La Liga match against Celta Vigo. He has now played 227 La Liga matches in a row. He holds the record for most consecutive appearances in La Liga.

title: Parents thrash groom's family after daughter elopes for marriage in Chandigarh
body: The parents of a woman, who eloped with a man for marriage in Chandigarh, allegedly thrashed the groom's family on Monday. The complainant, Rahul, said the woman's parents and their aides attacked him, his sisters and his parents after his elder brother got married to their daughter against their wish. Rahul suffered fractures in both the legs and arms.

title: MP govt land worth ₹300 crore freed from encroachment in Bhopal
body: Madhya Pradesh government's land worth ₹300 crore has been freed from encroachment in Bhopal, an official said on Tuesday. A woman had been allegedly selling shops, that were constructed illegally on this land, and an FIR will be filed against her, an official statement said. The encroached land was in the Chuna Bhatti area, the statement added.

title: Car returning from marriage party hits truck in Amethi; 6 dead, 4 injured
body: A Bolero car returning from a wedding ceremony collided with a truck in Amethi, Uttar Pradesh on Sunday. According to SP Dinesh Singh, the accident, which took place around midnight in the Gauriganj area, claimed the lives of six people, including an 8-year-old boy, and injured four. Notably, the Bolero was returning from Rae Bareli's Nasirabad area, police said.

title: People have wrong impression of Harsh Varrdhan that he's introvert: Anil on son
body: Speaking about his son, actor-producer Harsh Varrdhan, Anil Kapoor said people have this wrong impression of him that he's introverted and serious. "I was happy that media, critics and everybody praised his work and loved what he did [in AKvsAK]," he added. Speaking about his second collaboration with Harsh Varrdhan, Anil hilariously revealed Harsh Varrdhan rejected some of his suggestions.

title: I still get messages about 'October', how it changed someone's life: Banita
body: Actress Banita Sandhu said that she still gets messages about her movie 'October'. " And [about] how it moved them deeply or changed someone's life. It is really gratifying as an artist to be a part of a film that is so timeless that it still speaks to audiences years later," she said, adding she looks up to Deepika Padukone.

title: Priyanka's co-star Sam shares 'It's All Coming Back to Me' still, deletes later
body: Actor Sam Heughan shared a still with actress Priyanka Chopra from their upcoming film 'It's All Coming Back to Me' on Instagram. He later deleted the post but the picture has gone viral on social media. Priyanka plays a woman dealing with her fiancé's death and sends messages to his old number which is now owned by Sam's character.

title: Adheera is a bigger character: Sanjay on comparison between Adheera & Kancha
body: Sanjay Dutt spoke about his character 'Adheera' which has been compared with his portrayal of 'Kancha Cheena' in the 2012 film 'Agneepath', also starring actors Hrithik Roshan and Priyanka Chopra. He said, "The motive is...same. 'Kancha' wanted 'Mandwa', 'Adheera' wants 'KGF'. But the character, look and feel are different." "Adheera is a bigger character in his own right," he added.

title: I smeared henna all over my face at Alia-Ranbir's mehendi: Karan
body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has revealed that he mistakenly smeared henna all over his face at Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's mehendi ceremony. He said that he had decided to get mehendi on his hands but wasn't used to it and tried wiping sweat from his face but smeared it with henna. "Alia's makeup artist...applied lotion on my face." Karan added.

title: No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody in India: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during her US visit on Monday said, "No 'COVID-19 tax' was levied on anybody (in India)." She said, "The one big step the government decided was we shall not tax people to get out of the pandemic." Calling the building of infrastructure "best multiplier for economic recovery", she added, "Capital expenditure was our route to recovery."

title: Chiranjeevi reaches for the last rites of producer Narayan Das Narang in Hyderabad
body: Chiranjeevi reached for the funeral of producer Narayan Das Narang. The actor will pay his respects at the last rites which will reportedly begin in the afternoon. Several celebrities from Tollywood will attend the funeral in Hyderabad. Chiranjeevi also paid tribute to the late producer on Twitter and said he created a niche for himself with his expertise.

title: Intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably: VD Satheesan
body: Kerala Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan has criticised the state's intelligence system in the wake of the last week's back-to-back political killings in Palakkad. "Attempts are being made in Kerala for communal polarization. The victims are ordinary people and the conspirators are laughing. The intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably," the Congress leader said.

title: Nani was outstanding in 'Jersey', I cried watching him in it: Shahid
body: Shahid Kapoor has revealed that he cried watching actor Nani's performance in the 2019 Telugu film 'Jersey'. "Nani was outstanding in the film. He is younger, so for him to have played the father was, kudos to him for pulling it off," he stated. Shahid will star in the Hindi remake of the film which will release on April 22.

title: More hepatitis cases in young UK children likely to emerge: WHO
body: The UK is likely to see a rise in cases of hepatitis in young children in the coming days, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said. Recently, UK reported 74 hepatitis cases. Out of these, some children were transferred to specialist liver units, while six underwent liver transplantation. "The cause of...current hepatitis cases is...unknown and remains under active investigation," WHO added.

title: Chahal showed how to change the game within one over vs KKR: Malinga
body: RR bowling coach Lasith Malinga said Yuzvendra Chahal showed why leg-spinners are considered as match-winners by changing the game in a single over against KKR in IPL 2022. Chahal, who posted 5/40 in the match, took four wickets in 17th over, including his maiden hat-trick in IPL. "He's the most experienced leg-spinner in...country and in this tournament," he added.

title: Umran Malik scares you the same way Jofra Archer does: Ian Bishop
body: Former West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said SRH pacer Umran Malik's bowling is as scary as that of England fast bowler Jofra Archer and New Zealand pacer Lockie Ferguson. "It is just fascinating to me what Umran can become," added Bishop. "He's bowling with hostility which means even the best of batters will be uncomfortable facing him," stated Bishop.

title: 72-yr-old devotee from Chhattisgarh dies at Puri's Jagannath Temple
body: A 72-year-old devotee from Chhattisgarh died at the Jagannath Temple in Odisha's Puri moments after he paid obeisance at the shrine on Sunday morning. He had come to the temple along with his family at around 10 am. After darshan of deities, he sat on the stairs where he suddenly collapsed.

title: Burglars enter Pune house via exhaust fan window, steal items worth ₹86,000
body: Tanmay Kulkarni from Pune has lodged an FIR in a case where burglars entered his house, which is in front of a police station, through exhaust fan window and stole valuables worth ₹86,000, including some gold ornaments, a music system, laptop, and iPod. Police, in press release, said that Kulkarni had gone out with his wife when burglars entered house.

title: 23-year-old Mumbai student arrested for selling child pornography
body: A 23-year-old student from Mumbai was arrested for collecting child pornographic materials, which he sold via the messaging application Telegram, the police said. The Maharashtra cyber-police department had registered an FIR on April 5, after a complaint from an activist who reported it to the police. The accused has been booked under the Information Technology Act, they added.

title: Turkey condemns Israeli action against Palestinians in Jerusalem
body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Sunday condemned the Israeli Police's action against the Palestinians during recent clashes inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound. "Turkey always stands with Palestine," he added. Notably, Erdoğan's comments come amid efforts by Turkey and Israel in recent weeks to normalise their long-strained ties, according to Reuters.

title: You better know how loved you are: Aditi on Siddharth's b'day
body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari, taking to Instagram, wished actor Siddharth on his birthday. She shared a picture with Siddharth and wrote, "Happy birthday my pixie boy...Always be magic, mad and full of laughter. Always be you...Thank you for the unending laughter and adventures!" The actress further wrote, "You better know how loved you are."

title: PMPML marks 'Bus Day' with low fares, high bus frequency
body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) marked 'Bus Day' on Monday with as many as 1800 buses plying on roads and discounted ticket fares for commuters. Dedicated lanes for PMPML buses plying on certain routes were also set up in an effort to avoid traffic congestion. Additionally, female commuters availed free rides within Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad limits.

title: Twitter board members' salary will be $0 if I acquire the company: Musk
body: World's richest person Elon Musk said on Monday that Twitter's board of directors will not receive any compensation if he succeeds in acquiring the company. "Board salary will be $0 if my bid succeeds, so that's ~$3 million/year saved right there," he tweeted. Twitter currently spends about $2.9 million in cash and stock awards to board members, as per filings.

title: Rajasthan makes licence mandatory for keeping cows at home in urban areas
body: A yearly licence and a 100 square yard area will now be mandatory in Rajasthan for keeping cows or buffaloes at homes that fall in urban areas, the state government said. As per the order, penalty of up to ₹10,000 will be imposed on owners if the animals are found straying. However, the rules will not apply to registered gaushalas.

title: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif's 37-member Cabinet sworn in
body: The 37-member Cabinet of newly-elected Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif took oath during a brief ceremony on Tuesday. The new Cabinet includes members of political parties allied with Sharif's PML-N. Senate Chairman Sadiq Sanjrani had administered the oath after President Arif Alvi, an ally of ex-PM Imran Khan, excused himself reportedly citing his health.

title: BJP-ruled states should remove loudspeakers from mosques: Ex-VHP chief
body: Ex-Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) chief Pravin Togadia has said that BJP should remove loudspeakers from mosques in those states where it's in power. "We had demanded...removal of loudspeakers from mosques in Maharashtra some 10 years ago," he added. Togadia's comments come as Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

title: DC-PBKS match shifted from Pune to Mumbai after 5 DC members test COVID-19 positive
body: The BCCI has announced that the DC-PBKS match will be held in Mumbai instead of Pune on April 20 to avoid any further incident due to any undetected case during a long-distance bus journey in a closed environment. This comes after five members of DC's contingent, including all-rounder Mitchell Marsh, tested positive for COVID-19.

title: Ukrainian soldier escapes death as his phone stops bullet fired by Russians
body: A purported video has surfaced on social media that showed a Ukrainian soldier pulling out a smartphone from his pocket that had a bullet lodged inside it. The soldier had a narrow escape from death as the clip showed the smartphone with a 7.2 mm bullet, that was fired by the Russian troops at him, peeking from its one end.

title: Since April 15, life has been about baby crying, no sleep: Mohena on son's birth
body: 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' actress Mohena Kumari took to Instagram to share post after the birth of her son on April 15. "These last few days have gone by so fast...Since the 15th of April...life has been all about...hospital bed, baby nurses...baby feeding, baby crying...baby pacifying, no sleep, medicines and of course recovery," she wrote.

title: 56 inches can't mask 56 lakh: Moitra on NYT COVID-19 deaths report
body: Criticising the Narendra Modi-led Central Government over COVID-19 deaths in India, TMC MP Mahua Moitra tweeted that "56 inches can't mask 56 lakhs". She added, "Lying and stalling data publication doesn't make truth go away." Her comments came after The New York Times report claimed WHO estimated India's death toll to be 40 lakh, nearly eight times the official figure.

title: Priority to curtail rumours: Delhi Police on Jahangirpuri violence
body: Special Commissioner of Police Dependra Pathak, while talking about the Jahangirpuri violence said that the police are on high alert and their priority is to "curtail rumours". "An adequate number of police officials are present at the location. So far, 20 accused have been arrested and two juveniles have been apprehended," Pathak further said.

title: Class 10 Dalit boy beaten with belt, made to lick feet in UP; 7 arrested
body: A video has surfaced which purportedly shows a Class 10 Dalit student being beaten up with belts in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli. The video shows that the boy was forced to lick the feet of an accused. SP Shlok Kumar said the main accused is a minor and has been sent to a juvenile home while six others have been arrested.

title: RCB's Harshal Patel shares pic with sister who passed away, pens note
body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with his sister who passed away during IPL 2022. He wrote, "Didi...You were one of the kindest and most joyful person in our lives. You faced incredible difficulties...with a big smile...till your last breath." He added, "I'll continue to do everything that made you proud of me."

title: Loved the violence: Shehnaaz Gill on 'KGF: Chapter 2'
body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill, taking to Twitter, praised actor Yash's 'KGF: Chapter 2' and wrote, "Congratulations, I love you all." She further wrote, "Loved the violence Yash. Peace out." Shehnaaz then congratulated Srinidhi Shetty, Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon and the film's director Prashanth Neel. Yash replied to Shehnaaz's tweet and commented, "Thank you." The film was released on April 14.

title: Siraj is a rare breed like Umran Malik, needs specialised role: Ajay Jadeja
body: Ex-India player Ajay Jadeja has said that RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj should be given a specialised role in the ongoing IPL season. "Siraj is a rare breed like Umran Malik. Their potential is up to how you use them...He could be given three overs upfront," he added. So far, Siraj has picked five wickets in six matches in the season.

title: Was surprised Sonu Sood knew about me; it was a fan moment: Karan Kundrra
body: Karan Kundrra reacted after actor Sonu Sood praised him by calling him "a tough guy". In an interview, replying to a question on Neha and Karan, Sonu said, "Karan Kundrra is more bad***...I'd say he's a tough guy." Reacting to it, Karan tweeted, "I didn't even know...Sonu paaji (brother) knew who I was...this [was] like a fan moment for me."

title: After silver, Madhavan's son Vedaant wins gold at Danish Open; actor shares video
body: Actor R Madhavan's son Vedaant has bagged a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. Vedaant won the medal in the 800 m swimming event and clocked 8:17:28. Sharing a video of the felicitation ceremony, Madhavan wrote, "GOLD….With all your blessings and God's greatest...winning streak continues." Earlier, he had won a silver medal in a different category.

title: What is 'pyramid fraud' that Amway India is accused of running?
body: The ED accused Amway India of running a 'pyramid fraud' and provisionally attached its assets worth ₹757.77 crore. It alleged Amway of running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing network and exorbitant pricing of products. "Gullible public is induced to join as members and purchase products at exorbitant prices, losing their hard-earned money," ED said.

title: Kangana is Brahmastra in reality show 'Lock Upp': Tusshar Kapoor
body: Actor Tusshar Kapoor has stated that ALT Balaji has launched a Brahmastra in the form of actress Kangana Ranaut as a host on reality show 'Lock Upp'. "She's the perfect person to host the show. Her frank attitude...courageous nature and the confidence with which she tells people their truth or judges them...is very fair and very real," the actor added.

title: LSG to bowl first against RCB in their IPL 2022 clash, both sides unchanged
body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Both the teams are fielding the same playing XIs they fielded in their previous respective matches. LSG are currently third on the points table, while RCB are fourth.

title: Mamata best suited to lead opposition, Cong busy with infighting: Ripun Bora
body: Trinamool Congress leader Ripun Bora on Tuesday said Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee is best suited to lead an opposition front in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "Congress' leaders in various states are fighting against each other rather than fighting the BJP," Bora added. Notably, Ripun Bora joined the TMC on Sunday after quitting Congress.

title: BCCI aims to start women's IPL with 6 teams next year: Report
body: BCCI is reportedly planning to start women's Indian Premier League (IPL) from next year and it is expected to feature six teams. "We have already started working on the plan as to how many teams we can have and what window is going to suit, because we have the men's IPL as well," said a BCCI source.

title: Max temperature in Hyderabad likely to touch 40°C in next 2 days: IMD
body: India Meteorological Department has predicted that the maximum temperature in Hyderabad is likely to touch 40 degrees Celsius in the next two days. However, the weather department has also predicted a partly cloudy sky with the possibility of rain or thunderstorm in the city. According to the IMD, the city reported a maximum temperature of 39 degrees Celsius on Monday.

title: Shah Rukh's film with Atlee to be made on a budget of ₹200 cr: Report
body: Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film with filmmaker Atlee will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹200 crore. "[It will be] the costliest film for Shah Rukh Khan till date after the soon-to-be-released 'Pathaan', which is made on a budget of ₹250 crore," the report stated. Shah Rukh's yet-untitled film with Atlee will reportedly also feature Nayanthara and Sanya Malhotra.

title: 'KGF 2' collects ₹600 cr globally, becomes 9th highest-grossing Indian film
body: 'KGF: Chapter 2' has collected over ₹600 crore globally within five days of its release and has become the ninth highest-grossing Indian film of all time, as per film trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan. According to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the Hindi-dubbed version of the Yash-starrer has earned over ₹200 crore domestically. The film is directed by Prashanth Neel.

title: Plan on for 'Dilli Shopping Festival' to create 2 mn jobs: Delhi govt
body: The Delhi government has begun planning the 'Dilli Shopping Festival', one of the key initiatives announced in its Budget to facilitate 2 million jobs this year, an official statement said. The Arvind Kejriwal-led government, which kept 'rozgar' as its budget theme this year, aims to create 1,20,000 jobs through organising retail and wholesale shopping festivals, as per the budget documents.

title: Need more matches to achieve desired level of tennis: Djokovic
body: Ahead of Serbia Open second round, Novak Djokovic said he needs more matches to achieve desired level of tennis after exiting early in two tournaments he has played in 2022 season thus far. The world number one added that French Open is his "biggest goal" on clay and he hopes to play more matches in Belgrade than in Monte Carlo.

title: BJP using riots as tool to win civic body polls in Delhi: Sanjay Raut
body: In an apparent reference to Jahangirpuri violence in Delhi, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said the BJP has to win elections through riots and do politics. Raut said, "Delhi is UT...The law-and-order is [being] taken care of by the Center...But since the last few days, there've been riots." "[Reason] behind this is the civic body polls," he added.

title: Shaheen Afridi is the number 1 bowler for me: Babar Azam
body: Praising pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said his fellow countryman is the number one bowler for him. "The way he [Shaheen] works and performs, he has to go further ahead [in his career]," he added. Shaheen, who made his international debut in 2018, has taken 201 wickets in 94 international matches across formats so far.

title: Actor Ram Charan visits BSF camp in Amritsar, shares pics
body: Actor Ram Charan on Tuesday visited the Border Security Force (BSF) camp in Amritsar and shared a series of pictures on Instagram. He wrote, "Inspiring afternoon spent listening to stories, sacrifices & dedication of the Border Security Force at the BSF Campus, Khasa Amritsar." In the pictures, Ram can be seen greeting and eating with the soldiers.

title: ₹2.58 lakh crore wiped off HDFC & HDFC Bank's market value in 9-day sell-off
body: As much as ₹2.58 lakh crore has been wiped out of the combined market value of HDFC Ltd and HDFC Bank in a nine-day sell-off. The development comes after the two companies announced their merger earlier this month. HDFC Ltd, which was among India's top 10 most valuable companies prior to the announcement, is no longer on the list.

title: It’s not rocket science: Man Utd boss Rangnick on transfer windows
body: Manchester United's interim boss Ralf Rangnick on Monday said the club needs a couple of transfer windows to rebuild success, adding that getting it right is "not rocket science". "If you know what you are looking for it will take two or three transfer windows," he said. "It's not that complicated, it's not rocket science," he added.

title: UN chief calls for 4-day pause to fighting in Ukraine
body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres has called for a four-day "humanitarian pause to the war in Ukraine" ahead of Orthodox Easter on Sunday. "The onslaught and terrible toll on civilians we've seen so far could pale in comparison to the horror that lies ahead. This cannot be allowed to happen," he said. The war has sparked a humanitarian crisis in Ukraine.

title: Pocket watch stolen by Nazi soldier during World War II found; pic surfaces
body: A pocket watch that was reportedly stolen by a Nazi soldier during World War II has been found in Belgium after 80 years. The watch was crafted in 1910 by Alfred Overstrijd, a Jewish man in Netherlands, for his brother Louis, who was arrested by the Nazis in 1942. The watch was returned to Alfred's grandchildren and it still works.

title: To the most amazing wife & mom: David Beckham on Victoria's b'day
body: Actor David Beckham wished his wife Victoria Beckham on her birthday. Taking to Instagram, he shared a throwback picture of them kissing and wrote, "Happy Birthday to the most amazing wife, mummy and businesswoman." He further wrote, "Have the most amazing day because you deserve to...We all love you so much."

title: Sensex crashes 1,170 points to end at 57,166 dragged by IT stocks
body: The Sensex plunged 1,172 points on Monday to close at 57,166, while the Nifty fell 302 points to end below 17,200, at 17,173. Most sectoral indices were trading lower today with the IT index declining nearly 5%, and realty and bank indices down 1% each. Infosys, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra and Apollo Hospitals were among the top Nifty losers.

title: Aaditya Thackeray to visit Ram Temple site in Ayodhya in May
body: Maharashtra Tourism Minister Aaditya Thackeray will be on a one-day visit to UP's Ayodhya in the first week of May during which he'll be going to the Ram Janambhoomi site. This comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray confirmed that he will visit Ayodhya on June 5. Notably, MNS and Shiv Sena are involved in a row over loudspeakers outside mosques.

title: Woman consumes poison outside venue of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's event
body: A woman on Monday allegedly consumed a poisonous substance outside the venue where Bihar CM Nitish Kumar holds 'Janta Darbar' programme, a police officer said. According to Patna SSP Manavjit Singh Dhillon, the woman is facing some marital problems and her husband is in jail. She was taken to a hospital and is now out of danger, police added.

title: Rajkummar to reunite with Anubhav for anthology set against pandemic: Report
body: Actor Rajkummar Rao and filmmaker Anubhav Sinha are reportedly teaming up again, after 'Bheed', for an anthology that is set against the backdrop of COVID-19 pandemic. "The director felt Rajkummar is someone who connects with the movie on a personal level," report stated. The anthology will feature short films by Sudhir Mishra, Hansal Mehta, Ketan Mehta and other filmmakers.

title: Myanmar junta frees over 1,600 prisoners in annual tradition
body: Myanmar's military government on Sunday announced the release of 1,619 prisoners, including 42 foreigners, to mark the new year in the country. The prisoners were released "to bring joy for the people and address humanitarian concerns", a senior official said. Notably, political prisoners were not included among those pardoned in the annual tradition.

title: Cheteshwar Pujara becomes 2nd Indian to hit double century in county cricket
body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara smashed 201*(387) against Derbyshire on his debut for Sussex in County Championship Division Two. With this, Pujara became only the second Indian to score a double century in the County Championship after Mohammed Azharuddin. Pujara smashed a first-class hundred after going 52 innings without a ton.

title: Delhi sees over 500 new COVID cases for 2nd straight day, positivity rate at 7.7%
body: Delhi on Monday reported 501 fresh cases of COVID-19 for the second straight day, after seeing 517 cases on Sunday. The daily positivity rate in the national capital was 7.72% on Monday as compared to 4.21% on Sunday, while no related deaths were recorded in the last 24 hours. The city now has 1,729 active COVID-19 cases.

title: Mumbai techie cheated of ₹5.06 lakh while paying electricity bill
body:
A software developer in Mumbai was allegedly cheated of ₹5.06 lakh by a cyber fraudster who posed as an e-wallet firm's customer care executive. The man was trying to pay electricity bill, but the bill on the e-wallet app was much more so he searched for a helpline number. 
The fraud took place when he called on that number.

title: Attacks on processions designed way to divide country: JP Nadda
body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Sunday said that the Congress party is behaving in the most irresponsible manner. Addressing the party workers in Karnataka's Hosapete, Nadda said, "You must have seen the attacks on Ram Navami procession or something else at some other place...I can say it's a designed way to divide the country," Nadda added.

title: Lalchand picks Jadeja and 4 other spinners for India's 2022 T20 WC squad
body: Ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput has picked all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, Washington Sundar, Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal and Ravi Bishnoi as spin bowlers who can be a part of Team India's squad for 2022 T20 World Cup in Australia. All five are currently playing for their respective teams in IPL 2022. The World Cup will begin on October 16.

title: Kerala HC refuses to interfere in interfaith marriage
body: The Kerala High Court on Tuesday refused to interfere in an interfaith marriage between a Muslim man and a Christian woman. It is the woman's will and pleasure, noted the court. The habeas corpus plea demanding the woman to be produced before the court was filed by the woman's father, who alleged that his daughter had been illegally detained.

title: 2 prime accused of Jahangirpuri violence sent to 1-day police custody
body: A Delhi court on Sunday sent two prime accused in the Jahangirpuri violence during a Hanuman Jayanti procession to police custody for one day. The key accused Ansar and Aslam will be produced before the court later, advocate Vikas Verma said. The remaining 12 accused in this case have been sent to judicial custody for 14 days, he added.

title: Ukrainian pilots launch 'buy me a jet' website to crowdfund war planes
body: Ukrainian pilots have launched a website 'buymeafighterjet.com' seeking crowdfunding to purchase new fighter jets amid the country's war with Russia. A video uploaded on the website showed destroyed Ukrainian military equipment and infrastructure while a pilot looks into the camera and said, "Buy me a fighter jet". As per the website, the average cost of a jet is $25 million.

title: Hardik has ticked all boxes with his performance in IPL so far: Jaffer
body: Wasim Jaffer said GT captain Hardik Pandya has answered all the questions regarding his form and fitness by ticking all the boxes with his performance in the ongoing IPL so far. "Among all...captains that have led for the first time, Hardik has impressed me the most," he added. Hardik has scored 228 runs and taken four wickets in five matches.

title: Hyd Police seize ganja worth ₹1 crore, arrest 2 suspected peddlers
body: Hyderabad’s Rachakonda Police on Friday arrested two suspected interstate drug traffickers and seized 700 kg ganja worth ₹1 crore from their possession. Police intercepted the lorry carrying the contraband, which was en route to Rajasthan from Andhra Pradesh, near Hyderabad. The drugs were concealed inside the lorry, which was loaded with plywood and home decor sheets, reports stated.

title: Body of unidentified man found at Vasai beach in Palghar
body: The body of an unidentified man was found in a highly decomposed state at Vasai's Bhuigaon beach in Maharashtra's Palghar district. The body was spotted by fishermen and local people on Sunday evening, police said, adding that prima facie, the body was swept ashore by sea waves. A case of accidental death has been registered and an investigation is underway.

title: SC cancels Ashish Mishra's bail in Lakhimpur case, asks him to surrender
body: The Supreme Court on Monday cancelled the bail granted to Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra, an accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. The top court has also asked Ashish to surrender within a week. Earlier, the SC had raised questions over the Allahabad High Court granting bail to Ashish on February 10.

title: I'm very different from my dad, don't expect my son to be like me: Shahid
body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that he is different from his father actor Pankaj Kapur. "I'm a different type of father...you understand what being a father means...It helps you have...better understanding of your parents...I don't expect my son to be like me...You have to choose what kind of a father you want to be," he added.

title: Masks made mandatory in 4 Haryana districts as Gurugram sees 198 COVID-19 cases
