body: The Haryana government on Monday made face masks mandatory in Gurugram, Faridabad, Sonipat and Jhajjar districts of the National Capital Region. This came amid a rise in COVID-19 cases in Gurugram which reported 198 fresh cases on Monday. Uttar Pradesh had earlier today made the wearing of face masks mandatory in Lucknow and six NCR districts.

title: 6 killed as SUV and bus collide in UP's Deoria
body: Six people were killed and 12 were injured after an SUV collided with a bus in Deoria, Uttar Pradesh. The accident took place when the occupants of the SUV were returning from a marriage function, the police said. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over the incident and directed officials to provide proper treatment to the injured.

title: Will perform 'aarti' on loudspeakers at Maha temples on May 3: MNS leader
body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers will perform 'maha aarti' at their local temples across the state, on May 3, on the occasion of Akshaya Tritiya, MNS leader Nitin Sardesai said on Tuesday. "The aarti will be performed using loudspeakers," he added. His comment comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray gave May 3 as ultimatum to remove mosque loudspeakers.

title: Ayodhya's security increased along with Ram Temple: Report
body: Ahead of the final stage of completion of the plinth at the Ram Temple, the security in Ayodhya has been reportedly increased. Entire city has been reportedly kept under the surveillance of CCTV cameras and soldiers have been deployed on watchtowers to monitor people. According to the report, the city will also get a new control room for security.

title: Man, others beat wife, force her to marry alleged lover in Tripura
body: A woman was allegedly beaten up and forced to marry her "lover" on suspicion of having an extra-marital affair in Tripura's Khowai, police said on Monday. The woman told reporters that her husband along with 15 others had thrashed her until she lost consciousness. The police haven't received a written complaint, but will investigate the matter, a police officer said.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo announces death of his newborn son, asks for privacy
body: Cristiano Ronaldo announced that one of his newborn twins has passed away. Ronaldo, who was expecting twins with girlfriend Georgina Rodriguez, revealed she has given birth to a girl, while their son died. "It's the greatest pain that any parents can feel...We're all devastated at this loss and we kindly ask for privacy at this very difficult time," he wrote.

title: 2 students fall off moving bus' footboard in TN; video surfaces
body: A video of two students falling off a moving bus while they tried to hold onto the vehicle in Tamil Nadu's Tenkasi has surfaced online. Locals reportedly rushed the students, who suffered minor injuries after falling off the bus' footboard, to the hospital following the incident. The bus conductor claimed that the students had been trying to perform stunts.

title: Jaipur woman gets buried under snow in avalanche-prone Himachal area, dies
body: A 24-year-old tourist from Jaipur, who slipped in an avalanche-prone area and got buried under snow in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul and Spiti district, died during treatment at a hospital. The woman was roaming near Koksar waterfall when the snow she was walking on suddenly caved in. The district Deputy Commissioner has urged people not to venture near avalanche-prone areas.

title: Man clicks obscene pics of wife, circulates them in B'luru; booked
body: A man has been booked for allegedly taking obscene pictures of his wife and blackmailing her in Bengaluru, police said on Monday. The man had reportedly demanded that his wife give him money and when she refused, he circulated the pictures to his friends. The complainant claimed that the accused had also tortured her to sleep with his friend.

title: 4 kids injured in Chhattisgarh as Anganwadi building's tiles fall on them
body: As many as four children were injured at an Anganwadi in Chhattisgarh’s Bhainsbod, after tiles of the building fell over them, Janmejay Mahobe, Balod DM and Collector, said. "We'll look into the cause...Repair work will be done wherever it’s required at the Anganwadis," Mahobe added. A meeting was held to review the condition of the Anganwadis, Mahobe stated.

title: Those who do 'puja' can't create disturbance: Nitish on clashes
body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, while speaking about clashes that took place in some states during Hanuman Jayanti, said, "How could a person who wants to do puja...create...communal disturbance." He added that fringe elements are the ones who are involved in creating disharmony. He further said there wasn't any incident in Bihar as he "doesn't give any space for communal disturbance".

title: 3-yr-old Shahid said he loves me as much as God loves man: Pankaj
body: Veteran actor Pankaj Kapur appeared on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' along with his son Shahid Kapoor, saying that Shahid was philosophical ever since he was young. "He was around 3-3.5 years old...he said 'Baba do you know how much I love you?...Jitna Khuda apne bando se karta hai (As much as God loves his children)'," the actor said.

title: Was surprised with Kuldeep's cricketing knowledge in first meeting: Akhtar
body: Recalling his first meeting with Kuldeep Yadav, Shoaib Akhtar said he was surprised with the Indian spinner's cricketing knowledge. "He answered...spoke about everything correctly...In fact, I asked him a lot about the legalities and nitty-gritties of cricket and he answered all of them correctly," he added. "I felt weird because he just played five-ten matches for India," he further said.

title: Kim Kardashian walks off Ellen's show following prank with spider
body: American television personality Kim Kardashian walked off comedienne Ellen DeGeneres' show after the latter pranked her with a fake spider. Ellen pretended to throw a spider out of its container while Kim ran away saying, "You're not doing this to me, I'm never going to get over it." Kim then walked out of the set waving and saying, "Bye, everyone!"

title: Big B confirms grandson Agastya Nanda's debut in 'The Archies'
body: Amitabh Bachchan on Monday confirmed his grandson Agastya Nanda's Bollywood debut with Zoya Akhtar's 'The Archies' by sharing a fan-made collage. He wrote on Twitter, "A new chapter begins in your life and there cannot be greater joy among us all. My blessings my love...Do well. AND keep the flag flying." Suhana Khan and Khushi Kapoor co-star in the film.

title: Chahal recreates his World Cup meme pose to celebrate hat-trick, pic goes viral
body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal recreated his 2019 World Cup 'relaxing' meme pose after taking a hat-trick and a five-wicket haul against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) in their IPL 2022 match. Chahal registered bowling figures of 4-0-40-5 as RR defeated KKR by seven runs. Chahal is currently the leading wicket-taker in IPL 2022 with 17 wickets in six matches.

title: Neither Cong nor NCP, Shiv Sena will dump each other: Cong Minister
body: Maharashtra Minister of State for Home Satej Patil has said that "neither the NCP nor the Shiv Sena will dump the Congress, nor will Congress" dump them. Patil has also revealed that the state Congress unit has invited senior leader Rahul Gandhi to visit Mumbai. "He (Rahul) is expected in the second week of May," the Congress leader said.

title: Russia seeks medical equipment from India amid war
body: Russia is seeking more medical equipment from India after several countries imposed sanctions on Russia after its decision to invade Ukraine, according to Bloomberg. Indian and Russian firms will discuss ways to increase supplies during a meeting on April 22, Rajiv Nath, the Association of Indian Medical Device Industry's coordinator said.

title: Bhumi wins awards for COVID Warrior, 'Badhaai Do' at Asia One Awards
body: Actress Bhumi Pednekar has been honoured with the COVID-19 commitment Award and the Black Swan Path-Breaking actor award for 'Badhaai Do' at the Asia One Awards. The actress shared a picture of holding the awards on Instagram, writing, "Thank you for the honour #AsiaOneAwards and the distinguished jury that acknowledged our work...This one is dedicated to every covid warrior."

title: Delhi Capitals under quarantine after two more COVID-19 cases in their camp: Reports
body: DC have cancelled their scheduled travel to Pune ahead of their next IPL 2022 match amid COVID-19 scare, Cricbuzz reported. Their players and support staff will be quarantined in their rooms, the report added. DC physio Patrick Farhart earlier tested COVID-19 positive. As per reports, two more COVID-19 cases have emerged in their camp, including that of an overseas player.

title: Stones pelted at ladies coach in Bandra, railway police file case
body: The railway police have suo motu registered a case following a tip-off about an alleged stone-pelting incident. According to police, a female commuter informed on a helpline that an unknown person pelted stones on a ladies' coach of a local train when it halted at Bandra station's platform seven. The train had, however, left when police reached the platform.

title: Real estate prices may increase by 10-15% across India: CREDAI
body: Real estate industry body CREDAI on Tuesday said real estate prices have increased 5-8% due to a rise in construction costs and are expected to rise further by 5-7%. There's been a steady increase in raw material costs in last two years, CREDAI National President HV Patodia said. The Ukraine war has caused a further rise in costs, he added.

title: RR debutant McCoy celebrates his first-ever IPL wicket with 'Pushpa' move, video viral
body: RR debutant Obed McCoy celebrated his first-ever wicket in IPL by doing the 'Pushpa' move. McCoy dismissed KKR wicketkeeper-batter Sheldon Jackson in the last over to bag his maiden wicket in IPL. McCoy went on to pick another wicket in the same over as RR defeated KKR by seven runs. The 25-year-old West Indian registered figures of 3.4-0-41-2.

title: PM Modi-led govt’s ‘Swachh Bharat’ campaign changed lives of people: BJP
body: The Centre has built toilets in over 11.5 crore households under the 'Swachh Bharat' mission, the BJP said on Monday. PM Narendra Modi has worked to fulfil Mahatma Gandhi’s dreams about cleanliness and has effected change in the lives of people, the BJP stated. PM Modi launched the campaign on October 2, 2014.

title: Former AAP HP chief 'characterless', was about to be terminated: Sisodia
body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Saturday called Aam Aadmi Party's Himachal Pradesh unit president Anup Kesari "characterless" and said that he was about to be terminated. He also criticised the BJP for inducting Kesari, who allegedly has complaints against him and talks ill of women. "That is his rightful place," Sisodia further said.

title: 2 cattle smugglers killed, 4 cops injured in 'militant ambush' in Assam
body: Two alleged cattle smugglers were killed and four police personnel were injured during a "militant ambush" in Assam's Kokrajhar district on Tuesday, police said. The pair were being taken to Jomduar area for smuggling routes' identification when their vehicle "came under firing from militants", an officer said. Police retaliated and the gunfire exchanges continued for 10-12 minutes, he added.

title: Reliance Brands acquires 51% majority stake in Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla
body: Reliance Brands Limited (RBL) has acquired a majority stake in luxury fashion label Abu Jani Sandeep Khosla. RBL has signed a definitive agreement to invest in the prominent couture brand for a 51% stake. The company has recently set up a ready-to-wear fashion venture with Delhi-based designer Rahul Mishra and also acquired a 40% stake in Manish Malhotra.

title: Curfew in 2 Amravati cities after stone-pelting incidents; 23 arrested
body: Curfew was imposed in Achalpur and Paratwada in Maharashtra's Amravati Rural after two groups pelted stones at each other allegedly over removal of religious flags on Sunday. Police have arrested 23 people for rioting. Three companies of the State Reserve Police Force (SRPF), 300 police personnel from Amravati Police and other security personnel have been deployed to keep vigil.

title: Over 2,500 differently-abled cricketers register to play for India
body: The Differently-Abled Cricket Council of India (DCCI) has registered over 2,500 differently-abled cricketers in its registration process drive that started nearly a week ago. The drive is initiated to streamline the process and "bring a system in place" in differently-abled cricket. "All the data collected will be shared with the BCCI which will further be...sent to state associations," DCCI said.

title: Centre writes to 4 states & Delhi amid rise in COVID-19 cases, positivity rate
body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Maharashtra and Mizoram on the increasing coronavirus positivity rate and cases in these places. India recorded 1,247 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday. Delhi has been recording over 500 COVID-19 cases for the past three days with a positivity rate of over 4%.

title: RCB can make it to the top-four in IPL 2022: Jaffer
body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said RCB have the team to make it to the top four in IPL 2022. "Form of Dinesh Karthik has been excellent, Glenn Maxwell has come back to form...Shahbaz Ahamad has been playing sensible cricket," he added. Jaffer further said that RCB's bowling looks settled with the presence of Josh Hazlewood and Harshal Patel.

title: Whenever I, Ashwin are in nets we discuss last and next games: RR's Chahal
body: Speaking about the planning he does with his teammate Ravichandran Ashwin for the matches in ongoing IPL, RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said when they are practising in nets they both talk about previous and next matches. He added that they watch videos together and discuss which delivery to bowl to which batter. Chahal is leading wicket-taker in the tournament currently.

title: 'Social Media Lab' activated in Maha, 3,000 posts inciting communal tensions deleted
body: Mumbai Police on Monday said that a 'Social Media Lab' has been activated to keep a vigil on posts that could incite communal tensions in Maharashtra. Mumbai Police added that around 3,000 such posts have been deleted till now. Notably, Maharashtra government has decided to allow the use of loudspeakers at religious sites only with due permission, ANI reported.

title: Man Utd’s Bruno Fernandes uninjured after being involved in car crash
body: Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes on Monday escaped uninjured after being involved in a car crash. All parties involved in the crash escaped without any serious injuries. The Portuguese midfielder was able to train ahead of Manchester United's match with Liverpool in the Premier League on Tuesday. "He was okay and he'll be okay for tomorrow," interim manager Ralf Rangnick said.

title: Blue is the only jersey missing: Harbhajan on SRH pacer Umran Malik
body: Harbhajan Singh has termed SRH's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik as the "most deserving one" among the uncapped players to be selected for India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Blue is the only jersey missing and he should get it early...He could be your match-winner [in Australia]," stated Harbhajan. Umran has picked nine wickets in six games this season.

title: 2 men try to drive into Mauritius PM's convoy in Mumbai; arrested
body: Two men, who were allegedly drunk, tried to drive into the convoy of Mauritius PM Pravind Kumar Jugnauth in Mumbai's Mahim Causeway in the early hours of Monday. Police said the men appeared drunk but their medical report is yet to come. The convoy was moving from the Western Expressway Highway towards Bandra Worli sea link.

title: 18-year-old table tennis player D Vishwa dies as 12-wheel trailer hits car
body: Deenadayalan Vishwa, one of the top Tamil Nadu table tennis players, passed away in a road accident on Sunday, while travelling by road from Guwahati to Shillong for the 83rd Senior National and Inter-State Table Tennis Championship. The accident reportedly occurred when the Swift Desire car in which the 18-year-old player was travelling was hit by a 12-wheel trailer.

title: 2 ex-business partners get into a fight, injured in shootout in WB
body: Two former business partners were injured in a shootout in West Bengal's Kolkata at Brahmapur area. Locals claimed it was the fallout of a TMC syndicate fight. However, the local councillor said, "There was personal enmity between the two and the firing took place due to personal problems."

title: I'm happy South films are breaking into new territories: Anil Kapoor
body: Anil Kapoor said that the South has always been making "exceptional" films and added he is "happy" that South films are breaking into new territories. "I started my career with films down south and it gives me immense pleasure to see them doing so good," he stated. This comes after 'RRR', and 'Pushpa: The Rise' were commercial successes across India.

title: Ram Charan gets mobbed by fans in Amritsar, video surfaces
body: Ram Charan, who was most recently seen in 'RRR', was mobbed by fans in Amritsar, where he's shooting for Shankar's project. In a video, the actor can be seen surrounded by fans, who're chanting his name loudly. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Man of...masses," while another fan wrote, "Can't wait to see similar visuals in London, New York."

title: COVID-19 positivity rate rises to 15% in Noida
body: With COVID-19 cases rising in the NCR, the positivity rate in Noida has reportedly increased to 15%. The authorities said that precautionary measures are being taken. "There is no need to panic yet. The active cases have increased but it is important to note that there is not a single person who has been hospitalised," said Gautam Buddha Nagar DM.

title: It has consistently been the dysfunction of the company: Dorsey on Twitter board
body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey said Twitter's board has "consistently been the dysfunction of the company". He was replying to a tweet that said the company's board has been "mired in plots and coups...particularly amongst Twitter's founding members". On being further asked if he is allowed to say this, Dorsey replied, "No."

title: Viral pic shows man sleeping on luggage rack of Mumbai local train
body: A picture of a man sleeping on a luggage rack of a Mumbai local train is going viral on social media. The man in a pair of jeans and t-shirt could be seen sleeping with his eyes covered with a cloth. The picture initially surfaced on Reddit with a caption, "A little jealous ngl."

title: Man rams car into parked milk tanker in Punjab, wife killed
body: A 40-year-old woman was killed, while her husband and son suffered injuries, after their car crashed into a milk tanker parked outside a Verka plant in Punjab. The family was returning after visiting Baba Balak Nath Temple in Himachal Pradesh, the police said. Sukhpal who was driving the car fell asleep behind the wheel and lost control of the car.

title: Punjab officer to give part of salary to daughters of farmers dying by suicide
body: Senior Superintendent of Police, Mandeep Singh Sidhu has decided to contribute part of his salary for education of daughters of farmers who die by suicide. Sidhu has been posted in Sangrur for the third time and decided to contribute Rs 51,000 from his first pay followed by Rs 21,000 every month till the time he is posted in the area.

title: Moving in small Mumbai flat was challenge, mother couldn't 'breathe': Poonam
body: Actress Poonam Dhillon said that moving into a small flat in Mumbai was a challenge after living in Chandigarh. "Initially, my mother said she couldn't 'breathe' in Mumbai...In Chandigarh...I biked to school, to the swimming club and elsewhere. I hadn't seen local trains or buses. The infrastructure of the city and the population was a kind of shock," she added.

title: Oil drops below the $110 mark after IMF cuts global growth forecast
body: Oil price dipped below the $110 mark on Tuesday after the International Monetary Fund (IMF) reduced its global growth forecast and warned of higher inflation. Brent crude fell $3.94 to $109.22/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell $3.8 to $104.41/barrel. IMF had said growth in emerging markets and developed economies could reduce by 1.3% and 0.9% over three years.

title: Tried to kill myself: Poonam after Munawar says mom died of suicide
body: Actress Poonam Pandey, who is a contestant on reality show 'Lock Upp', has revealed that she tried to kill herself many times. Poonam further said she saw herself in Munawar's mother as he had revealed that she suffered domestic abuse for years and that she wasn't happy. Munawar had revealed that his mother died of suicide.

title: Pics show final moments of Russian warship after being hit by Ukrainian missiles
body: Pictures and footage purportedly showing the final moments of the Russian warship Moskva that sank after being hit by two Ukrainian missiles, have been widely shared online. The ship went down in the Black Sea last week after Ukraine said it launched two Neptune missiles. Russia had, however, cited stormy seas as the reason, which the pictures seem to contradict.

title: Wasim Jaffer names his underrated XI of all time, includes Shikhar Dhawan
body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has named his underrated XI of all time. He named ex-Australia captain Mark Taylor as the skipper of the side, which features Tillakaratne Dilshan as wicketkeeper. Jaffer also included Shikhar Dhawan in the side. Remaining players are Younis Khan, Shivnarine Chanderpaul, Michael Hussey, Paul Collingwood, Abdul Razzaq, Rangana Herath, Chaminda Vaas and Ryan Harris.

title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar becomes first Indian fast bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL
body: SRH fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar has become the first Indian fast bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL. The 32-year-old achieved the feat after registering figures of 4-0-22-3 against PBKS on Sunday. Jasprit Bumrah is the second highest wicket-taker in IPL among Indian fast bowler with 134 scalps. Bhuvneshwar and Bumrah are followed by Umesh Yadav with 129 wickets.

title: Dhoni's mindset was to look at team, never dwelled on his own performance: Gary Kirsten
body: Ex-India coach Gary Kirsten has called ex-India captain MS Dhoni the "ultimate team player". Kirsten added, "As a captain, Dhoni's mindset was always to look at the team first and see the way the team could be thriving. He never dwelled on his own performances." It was during Gary's stint with Dhoni that India won the 2011 World Cup.

title: 62-yr-old man cheated of ₹16 lakh under pretext of marriage in Pune
body: A 62-year-old man was allegedly cheated of over ₹16 lakh by a person he met on an online platform under the pretext of getting married. The man had approached the police a few months ago and a case was filed in the matter on Sunday. "[Complainant's] son is betrothed and he was afraid of sharing details," a police sub-inspector said.

title: Warner-Shaw complement each other well, their combination helps DC: Rajput
body: After the Delhi Capitals' opening batting pair of David Warner and Prithvi Shaw posted a 50-run partnership against the RCB, former India cricketer Lalchand Rajput has said that the pair "really complement each other well". "The right-left hand combination helps (DC)...Shaw is an explosive player...it’s very difficult to stop him...Warner takes his time and is much more mature," Rajput said.

title: LSG skipper KL Rahul has improved his leadership qualities: Jaffer
body: Talking about KL Rahul, who previously led PBKS in IPL, Wasim Jaffer said the LSG captain's leadership is getting better with time. "I had been involved with Punjab team in the last two years and think he's a phenomenal player and has scored runs against all teams," he added. LSG are currently third on points table in IPL 2022.

title: Crime Branch of Delhi Police joins probe into Jahangirpuri violence
body: The violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti procession is being jointly probed by the Delhi Police Crime Branch and the district police, Special Commissioner of Police (Crime Branch) Ravindra Yadav said. A total of 20 people have been arrested in connection with the incident. Fourteen of them were produced before the Rohini court on Sunday.

title: Gurugram civic body to start repairing Sector 28 roads next month
body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) plans to launch the repair of roads in Sector 28 next month, officials said on Sunday. The MCG has floated a tender worth ₹90 lakh for the work. Notably, a resident claimed that they have pursued the matter since 2013 and even pooled some money to repair a few stretches of the road.

title: There's no ideal body type in entertainment industry: Palak Tiwari
body: Palak Tiwari said there's no ideal body type in the entertainment industry. "We live in India, an ideal body type is a size medium but people fat shame...size medium. When you are too skinny, they have an issue," she stated. "It's..same toxic circle of people never being happy...don't think it makes any sense paying heed to that," Palak added.

title: HC grants interim relief to Khadse's wife in Pune land scam case
body: The Bombay High Court has granted interim relief to senior Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Eknath Khadse's wife Mandakini Eknath Khadse in the Pune land scam case. The next hearing will take place on April 25, Mandakini's advocate Mohan Tekavde said. The case is related to the alleged money laundering pertaining to a land at Bhosari in Pune.

title: Fan blocks Shilpa's car door taking selfie, she says 'What are you doing?'
body: A video shared by a journalist account is going viral on social media showing a fan blocking actress Shilpa Shetty's car door while trying to take a selfie. Shilpa was getting into her car with her daughter Samisha in Mumbai's Juhu when the incident occurred. She can be heard saying, "Arrey bhai, kya kar rahe ho (What are you doing)?"

title: Sri Lankan Prez admits mistakes led to severe economic crisis
body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said he made mistakes that led to the severe economic crisis in the country and pledged to correct them. "Today, people are under immense pressure due to this economic crisis. I deeply regret this situation," he added. Rajapaksa made the remarks while speaking to the new Cabinet ministers appointed by him.

title: Gujarat groom receives lemons as wedding gift amid rising prices
body: A groom in Gujarat's Rajkot was given lemons as a gift during a wedding ceremony by his friends and relatives amid rising prices of the commodity. Explaining the reason behind the gift, a relative said, "At this time, the prices of lemons in the state and...country have gone up a lot. There's a lot of need for lemons this season."

title: 2 men sentenced to 14 yrs in jail for trafficking minors in Jaipur
body: A special court in Jaipur on Tuesday sentenced two men to 14 years in jail for trafficking minors and forcing them into child labour. The accused had trafficked at least 33 children from Bihar, who were rescued during a police raid in the city in 2018. A fine of ₹5.64 lakh has also been imposed on each of the accused.

title: Court cannot act as expert in field of education: SC
body: A court cannot act as an expert in the field of education and it should be left to the institutions to determine whether a candidate possesses the necessary qualifications, the Supreme Court has said. A bench of Justices MR Shah and BV Nagarathna said there can't be any deviation from the educational qualifications mentioned in an advertisement for a job.

title: 4-yr-old run over by school bus while being dropped off in Gurugram
body: A four-year-old boy died after he was allegedly run over by his school minibus while being dropped off in Gurugram, police said. "After he got off the bus, the driver drove the vehicle away...boy came under it," police added. "It appears he came under the tyres...He suffered several injuries on his stomach, arms and legs," the deceased's father said.

title: PM failed to achieve targets of economic growth in 8 yrs: Subramanian Swamy
body: Rajya Sabha MP and BJP leader Subramanian Swamy said in eight years in office, PM Narendra Modi has failed to achieve targets of economic growth. "On the contrary, the growth rate has declined annually since 2016," Swamy tweeted. "Modi inexplicably is clueless about China. There is scope to recover but does he know how?" Swamy added.

title: Gold prices jump to 1-month high amid Russia-Ukraine war, inflation concerns
body: Gold prices jumped to more than one-month high on Monday amid concerns over economic fallout from Russia-Ukraine war and surging inflation. Spot gold rose 0.9% to $1,991.51 per ounce. Among other metals, spot silver rose 1% to $25.93 per ounce, whereas Platinum climbed 1.8%. Bullion is considered a safe store of value during times of political and economic crisis.

title: He'll become unplayable bowler, play for India: Gavaskar on SRH pacer Umran
body: Seeing SRH pacer Umran Malik's bowling performance in ongoing IPL, Sunil Gavaskar said the 22-year-old is going to play for India soon. He added that Umran's accuracy has been more impressive than his speed. "If he bowls wicket-to-wicket, he's pretty much going to become an unplayable bowler," he further said. Umran has taken nine wickets from six matches so far.

title: We were 30-40 runs short, lost many wickets early: Dhawan on PBKS' loss
body: PBKS stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan said his side lost too many wickets early and were 30-40 runs short in their seven-wicket loss against SRH in IPL. "Once we lost too many wickets then we had to take the game deep," he added. PBKS were reduced to 61/4 after eight overs and lost five wickets on last seven balls of innings.

title: Live-in relationships are leading to rise in sexual offences: MP High Court
body: The "bane of live-in relationship", a "byproduct" of rights conferred under Article 21 of the Constitution, is leading to a rise in sexual offences, Madhya Pradesh High Court said. It made the observation while rejecting anticipatory bail plea of a man accused of raping a woman. The complainant got pregnant and underwent abortions under pressure from her then partner.

title: Delhi Metro to expand its existing depots for Phase 4 sections
body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has decided not to acquire additional land but to expand the capacity of the existing Mukundpur depot to meet the requirements of the upcoming stations of Phase IV. According to a DMRC official, the expansion will provide space for the extension of the Pink Line and the Magenta line.

title: Sri Lankan Prez appoints 17 ministers amid anti-govt protests
body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday appointed 17 Cabinet ministers amid the anti-government protests owing to the economic crisis in the country. The new Cabinet reportedly has eight former ministers and several fresh entrants. This is the third Cabinet reshuffle in recent weeks. Earlier this month, as many as 26 ministers had resigned from the Cabinet.

title: Pakistan startup Abhi raises funds at $90 million valuation
body: Pakistani financial platform Abhi has raised $17 million in a Series A funding round led by Speedinvest at a valuation of $90 million. Global Ventures, VentureSouq, VEF, Sturgeon Capital, Rallycap, FJ Labs, Fatima Gobi, Sarmayacar and i2i Ventures also participated in the funding round. Pakistani startups raised over $350 million last year.

title: Delhi govt should take over Rohini ashram housing women improperly: HC
body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday said the Delhi government's health department should take over the Adhyatmik Vidyalaya, an ashram in Rohini, housing women in "animal-like conditions". "We find it difficult to accept that the inmates of the institution are in their full senses and that they are [there] of their own free will," the HC said.

title: DFEH rushed to sue us for quick publicity grab: Tesla on racism suit
body: Tesla has accused the US' DFEH of abandoning its founding purpose, ignoring its statutory obligations and rushing to sue it "perhaps for a quick publicity grab". The agency had alleged Tesla ignored years of complaints about racial slurs in its California factory. Tesla also said the DFEH perhaps feared that US' EEOC would be the first to settle with Tesla.

title: Arjun, Bhumi begin shooting for 'The Ladykiller' in Himachal Pradesh
body: Arjun Kapoor and Bhumi Pednekar have started shooting for filmmaker Ajay Bahl's next movie, 'The Ladykiller', in Himachal Pradesh. Arjun, while speaking about the forthcoming project, said, "The Ladykiller is one of the most exciting scripts of my career." "I'm thrilled to be collaborating with Bhumi and my director Ajay Bahl for the first time," he added.

title: Kajal Aggarwal and Gautam Kitchlu blessed with a baby boy
body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal and her husband Gautam Kitchlu welcomed a baby boy on Tuesday morning, Kajal's sister Nisha Aggarwal told Indian Express. She also shared that both the mother and the baby are doing well and are healthy. Kajal and Gautam got married in October 2020 and Gautam had announced earlier this year that they are set to become parents.

title: Prashant Kishor meets Sonia, other top Cong leaders for 2nd time in 3 days
body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor met Congress chief Sonia Gandhi at her residence at 10 Janpath in Delhi on Monday. This is their second meeting at Sonia's residence in the last 3 days. The meeting comes amid reports of Kishor joining Congress ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Congress leaders Priyanka Gandhi Vadra and P Chidambaram were also present.

title: PM Modi shares pic after meeting Jam Saheb Shatrusalyasinh; Poland reacts
body: PM Narendra Modi met Jam Saheb Shatrusalyasinh in Gujarat's Jamnagar and wrote, "The goodwill of Jam Saheb's family is spread all over the world, especially in Europe." Responding to his tweet, Poland's envoy Adam Burakowski tweeted, "PM of India...visited Jam Saheb, son of Jam Saheb Digvijay Sinhji who during II World War hosted c.a. 800 Polish children in Balachadi."

title: South Korean band BTS' new album to release on June 10
body: South Korean boy band BTS' new album will release on June 10, the band's agency Big Hit Music said in a statement. "Details on the new album will be provided in a separate notice at a later date," the statement further read. In a teaser video posted on social media, BTS announced the album with the tagline 'We Are Bulletproof'.

title: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as HDFC drops out of the list?
body: Reliance Industries is India's most valuable company with a market value of ₹17.84 lakh crore, followed by TCS (₹12.71 lakh crore) and HDFC Bank (₹7.44 lakh crore). The list includes Infosys, ICICI Bank, Hindustan Unilever, SBI, Adani Green Energy and Bajaj Finance. Bharti Airtel is India's 10th most valuable company after HDFC Ltd dropped out of the list on Tuesday.

title: Khurshid meets men who torched his home, says 'we decided to be friends'
body: Ex-Union Minister and Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Sunday shared a picture with the men who had set the entrance of his house on fire last year. "We talked and decided to be friends in peace. They felt bad about the event but went away pleased," said Khurshid. In November, Khurshid's Nainital house was vandalised amid controversy over his book.

title: 12 states face power crisis due to coal shortage: Maha Minister
body: Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut said that 12 states are facing electricity issues due to the shortage of coal and that his department was working to mitigate the shortage. "Shortage is also due to lack of rakes (trains). We require 37 rakes per day, while we get only 26. Each rake can transport 4,000 metric tonnes of coal," Raut said.

title: US drops mask mandate on trains, airplanes after court order
body: The US government ended the mask mandate for people using public transportation such as trains and airplanes. This comes after a federal judge in Florida declared the 14-month-old directive unlawful. Following the court order, major airlines such as American Airlines, United Airlines and Delta Air Lines lifted the mask mandate. The national train line Amtrak also relaxed the restrictions.

title: Barcelona suffer 0-1 loss to relegation-threatened Cadiz in La Liga
body: Barcelona on Monday suffered a shock 0-1 defeat at home to relegation-threatened Cadiz in La Liga. Barcelona are now 15 points behind leaders Real Madrid. "It's a very bad week for us  and we need to change the dynamic as soon as possible," manager Xavi said. Barcelona exited the UEFA Europa League after losing to Eintracht Frankfurt last week.

title: Indian economy not immune to Ukraine war, inflation on the cards: RBI
body: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said as the Russia-Ukraine war continues to affect the global supply chain and inflate prices, the Indian economy is expected to not remain immune either. India's high inflation and widening trade deficit are expected to hamper growth and lead to "rocketing inflation", RBI added. Retail inflation rose to a 17-month high of 6.95% in March.

title: Tribal woman out to collect vegetables in forest attacked by bear in Tripura
body: A 45-year-old tribal woman was attacked by a wild bear in Tripura when she went into a forest area to collect tubers and vegetables. Reports said local youth spotted the woman and shifted her to a local hospital. One of her neighbours said that she was bleeding profusely. She suffered cuts on her face and other parts of her body.

title: Pune requires a total firefighter strength of 1,620 but has 380: Official
body: As per Centre's fire advisory norms, Pune requires a total firefighter strength of 1,620 but has 380 at present, an official said. "Pune city requires 74 fire stations...has 14," the official added. "This acute shortfall means one station has to cater to a much larger area...firefighters are burdened with a higher load of work," Pune's Chief Fire Officer said.

title: Delhi court asks ASI not to remove Ganesha idols from Qutub complex
body: A Delhi court has directed the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) not to remove two Lord Ganesha idols called 'Ulta Ganesh' and 'Ganesha in cage', from the Qutub Minar complex till further directions. Last month, National Monuments Authority wrote a letter to ASI stating that the Ganesha idols should either be removed or given a "respectable" place in Qutub complex.

title: Products of 30,000 small brands cater to 80% of population: Survey
body: A Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) survey showed household products of over 30,000 brands operating at small and medium scale cater to 80% of India's population. Big brands are in demand among people of higher and upper-middle classes, CAIT Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said. "It's a myth that about 3,000 big brands...are catering to the people's needs," he added.

title: Hindi film industry used to ape the West a lot in the 1990s: Raveena
body: Actress Raveena Tandon said the Hindi film industry used to "ape the West" a lot at one point in the 1990s. "They all wanted to become Hollywood with choppers and westernising. There was a loss of Indian culture in our movies," added Raveena. "I...[would] feel that we are going away from what the masses are identifying with," stated Raveena.

title: Dinesh Karthik has presented strong case for India comeback: Kohli
body: RCB batter Virat Kohli, talking about Dinesh Karthik's current form in IPL 2022, has said that the 36-year-old wicketkeeper has presented a strong case for India comeback. This comes after Karthik had said that he plans to be part of the Team India squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Karthik has scored 197 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

title: Electric chopsticks that can make food taste saltier developed in Japan
body: Researchers in Japan claim that they have developed computerised chopsticks that can make food taste saltier, in a "world first". Co-developed by Meiji University professor Homei Miyashita and beverage maker Kirin Holdings, the device uses electrical stimulation and is attached to a mini wristband computer. The chopsticks can potentially help people reduce their salt intake, the researchers said.

title: Shanti Sethi appointed US Vice-Prez Kamala Harris' defence advisor
body: US Navy veteran Shanti Sethi has joined US Vice-President Kamala Harris' office as her executive secretary and defence advisor. Sethi was reportedly the first Indian-American commander of a major US Navy combat ship and has also been the senior military advisor to Navy Secretary Carlos Del Toro. Harris' Senior Advisor Herbie Ziskend confirmed Sethi's appointment to Politico.

title: SRK to work with Rajkumar Hirani for first time, announces film 'Dunki'
body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan took to Twitter to announce his new film 'Dunki' with filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani. "Dear @RajkumarHirani sir, you turned out to be my Santa Claus...you start [film], I'll reach on time...actually I will start living on the set...Feeling humbled & excited to finally work with you...Bringing to you all #Dunki...in cinemas on 22nd December 2023," he wrote.

title: FIR filed against Jahangirpuri rally organisers for not taking permission
body: An FIR has been registered against the members of the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal for taking out a Hanuman Jayanti rally without permission in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where violence was reported. "One accused person has joined the investigation," DCP (North West) Usha Rangnani said. The other two processions in Jahangirpuri area had due permission.

title: Jack Ma's Ant to be payments platform 2C2P's largest shareholder
body: Jack Ma-owned Ant Group will become the majority investor in Singapore-based payments platform 2C2P as part of a partnership. The deal will lead to the integration of Ant's Alipay+ payment service with 2C2P's platform used by merchants in Asia, Europe, the Middle East and the Americas. "Through this...partnership...2C2P will be connected to a much larger merchant base," 2C2P CEO said.

title: Israel strikes Gaza after rocket attack amid Jerusalem tensions
body: Israel on Tuesday carried out its first airstrikes on the Gaza Strip since January in response to a rocket fired from the Palestinian enclave amid Jerusalem tensions. The Israeli military said its aircraft attacked a "Hamas weapon manufacturing site". At least 152 Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli riot police inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa Mosque compound on Friday.

title: Migrant shot dead while crossing into Greece from Turkey: Police
body: A migrant was shot dead at the border on Saturday while attempting to enter Greece from Turkey on an inflatable dinghy, the Greek Police said on Sunday. However, it wasn't immediately clear who fired the shot that killed the woman. A Greek police officer claimed that a "barrage" of shots was fired from the Turkish side.

title: Fundamentalism more dangerous when practised by majority: Kerala minister
body: Kerala minister MV Govindan said fundamentalism is more dangerous when practised by the majority than the minority. His remark came in reaction to the killings of RSS and SDPI workers in Palakkad. He added, the majority fundamentalism "is working towards formation of a Hindu Rashtra" and the hatred towards minorities is part of the attempt to create to achieve that.

title: Man caught on camera firing gun during violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri
body: An unidentified man was caught on camera firing a gun during the violence that broke out in Delhi's Jahangirpuri during a Hanuman Jayanti rally on Saturday. As per reports, Delhi Police is trying to ascertain his identity. So far, 20 people have been arrested and two juveniles have been apprehended over the incident and firearms and swords have been seized.

title: Cong members booked for unlawful assembly at K'taka CM's B'luru home
body: A case has been filed against 36 Congress members, including former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, state party chief DK Shivakumar and party General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala, in Bengaluru on charges of unlawful assembly at state CM Basavaraj Bommai's residence. The party members have been booked under IPC Sections 341, 143 and KP Act Section 103, the ANI reported.

title: Which RR bowlers have taken hat-trick in IPL history?
body: Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal on Monday became the fifth Rajasthan Royals (RR) bowler to take a hat-trick in IPL history. Ajit Chandila had become the first RR bowler to take an IPL hat-trick in 2012. Pravin Tambe and Shane Watson took hat-trick against KKR and SRH, respectively, in 2014. Shreyas Gopal took a hat-trick in 2019 against RCB.

title: No one is indispensable: Cong MP Bordoloi on Ripun Bora joining TMC
body: Congress MP Pradyut Bordoloi reacted to ex-Assam party unit chief Ripun Bora's recent switchover to Trinamool Congress (TMC), terming the move "unfortunate", adding that "nobody is indispensable". Bordoloi added that the Congress "has very strong DNA" in Assam and wasn't dependent on Bora's support. Bora has said that only the TMC is capable of fighting against BJP.

title: Fish with 'dracula-like fangs' washes up on US beach, pics surface
body: A fish that looked like a 'dracula' was recently found by a beach walker in California, US. It had two Dracula-like fangs that stuck out of its mouth, alongside a large dorsal fin, an elongated body, and huge eyes. Christopher Martin, the curator of ichthyology at the Museum of Vertebrate Zoology, identified it as a lancetfish, reported the Daily Star.

title: KTR to inaugurate Hyd's Bahadurpura flyover on Apr 19
body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao will inaugurate the Bahadurpura flyover in Hyderabad on April 19. The six-lane flyover from Bahadurpura Police Station to Nehru Zoological Park is expected to ease traffic congestion in the area. The flyover, which is a part of the Telangana government's Strategic Road Development Programme (SRDP), has been built at an estimated cost of ₹69 crore.

title: SC reconstitutes monitoring committee in Delhi-Doon corridor project
body: The expert committee to monitor the compensatory afforestation in the Delhi-Dehradun Economic corridor project was reconstituted by the Supreme Court on Tuesday. The bench directed that the chairperson of the committee will be the Director-General Forests, Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change. Notably, the project will reduce the travel time between Delhi and Dehradun to 2.5 hours.

title: Now my kids are old enough: Aishwaryaa on returning to work after 7yrs
body: Director Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth, who will be making her comeback after seven years, has said that she had taken a break to spend more time with her sons. She added that she got several offers to direct Hindi films but she wasn't in the mindset to work. "It feels great to be back. Now my children are old enough," Aishwaryaa said.

title: Jahangirpuri violence effort to tarnish image of country, PM: BJP MP
body: BJP MP from North West Delhi Hans Raj Hans said that the Jahangirpuri violence was an effort to tarnish the image of the country and PM Narendra Modi before Boris Johnson's visit. "The Prime Minister is continuously trying to make India the number one country in the world. He has become an international personality," he said.

title: Philippines' envoy to China dies aged 74 while in quarantine
body: The Philippines' Ambassador to China, Jose Santiago "Chito" Sta. Romana, has died aged 74 while he was reportedly in 21-day quarantine in Huangshan city after returning from the Philippines. The Philippine Foreign Affairs Department condoled his death and said the Philippines and China's ties "flourished despite differences" under Sta. Romana's tenure. He was appointed as envoy to China in 2016.

title: XYXX teams up with KL Rahul, says 'Tune out the noise to play your way'
body: XYXX has teamed up with KL Rahul aiming to break new boundaries with the 'Play Your Way' campaign. "In a world filled with fake news and hype, XYXX's game-changing campaign encourages everyone to listen to their inner voice, trust their instincts," KL Rahul said. XYXX designs products that seek to challenge the status quo in innerwear and comfort wear segment.

title: Auto, taxi drivers call off strike demanding hike in fares in Delhi
body: Unions representing autorickshaws and taxis have called off strike demanding a hike in fares in Delhi. "If no action is taken in 25 days, then after 25 days we will shut Delhi's total food chain including tempos and trucks," an official said. Autorickshaw and taxi drivers have been demanding a cut in CNG prices and a hike in fares.

title: 22-yr-old BTech student found dead in his house in J'khand, probe on
body: A third-year BTech student was found dead in his house in Jharkhand's Ranchi on Monday. Police believe that the deceased, Vijay Mahto, died by suicide over an affair. However, his parents have reportedly claimed the 22-year-old was dumped on the roof after being beaten to death and have also named some people they suspect. Police are investigating the allegations.

title: 15-yr-old boy pushed into Mula river from Bopodi bridge in Pune
body: A 15-year-old boy was reportedly pushed into the Mula river from Bopodi railway bridge in Pune on Saturday. The accused was known to the victim, according to police. The victim's mother claimed that the accused told her son that he would show him parrot chicks under the bridge and then pushed him down. The boy was rescued by a boat.

title: Assam's Kamrup district gets its first transgender tea stall
body: Assam's first transgender tea stall was inaugurated in the Kamrup district on Monday. All Assam Transgender Association has set up the stall in collaboration with the district administration. "This tea stall aims to empower the trans community of Assam and help them learn entrepreneurial as well as business communication skills," said Swati Bidhan Baruah, founder of the transgender association.

title: Navi Mumbai corporator holds 'chai pe charcha' with citizens
body: Navi Mumbai corporator Vikrant Patil held 'chai pe charcha' to discuss issues faced by local residents. He held discussions on various issues such as roads, nallas, parks, municipal works, jobs and admissions in schools and colleges. A large number of citizens attended the event held at Patil's office.

title: If things are wrong, they shouldn't be sold: Ajay on criticism over endorsements
body: Ajay Devgn, speaking about criticism over endorsements, said if certain things are so wrong, they shouldn't be sold. "It's a personal choice. When you do something, you also see how harmful it would be. Some things are harmful, some aren't," he added. Earlier, Akshay Kumar was criticised for joining Ajay and Shah Rukh Khan in endorsing a pan masala brand.

title: Permission needed to use loudspeakers at religious sites: Maharashtra govt
body: Maharashtra has decided to allow the use of loudspeakers at religious sites only with due permission, reported ANI. State Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil will hold a meeting with the DGP to instruct him to direct police commissioners and officers on this on Monday. It comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray gave May 3 as ultimatum to remove mosque loudspeakers.

title: Delhi sees most heatwave days in April since 2010, max temp at 41.6°C
body: Delhi on Monday recorded the seventh heatwave day so far in April 2022 and the highest for the month since 2010. Safdarjung observatory on Monday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, five degrees above normal. The national capital is likely to witness the eighth heatwave day on Tuesday, as per IMD. Notably, Delhi witnessed 11 heatwave days in April 2010.

title: Miller played shots from the top of the cover vs CSK, he'll be dangerous: Sachin
body: Talking about GT batter David Miller's unbeaten 94-run innings against CSK, Sachin Tendulkar said if the South Africa batter's "good phase" continues, then he'll be a very dangerous batter in the ongoing IPL season. "Because he played most of his game towards mid-wicket. He played shots from the top of the cover, which means he's absolutely in control," explained Tendulkar.

title: That over was the game-changer: Miller on Rashid hitting Jordan for 3 sixes
body: GT batter David Miller, who scored 94* off 51 balls against CSK, said that their stand-in captain Rashid Khan's batting in their 18th over was the game-changing moment in the match. GT needed 48 in the last three overs when Rashid smashed Chris Jordan for three sixes and a four. Overall, GT scored 25 runs in the 18th over.

title: Suspected drug peddler injured in police firing in Assam
body: A suspected drug peddler was injured in police firing in Karbi Anglong district of Assam, police said. The accused reportedly tried to escape while being taken to apprehend his associate from Dimapur, police added. "When he refused to stop to our warnings, we had to fire at him and he was injured in...leg," a police officer said.

title: Man buys ₹15.4 lakh registration number for ₹71,000 2-wheeler in Chandigarh
body: A man in Chandigarh has bought a registration number worth ₹15.44 lakh at an auction for his two-wheeler worth ₹71,000, Hindustan Times reported. The man said he intends to use the number ending 0001 for his newly-bought Activa and later for his car. Over 370 registration numbers had gone under the hammer in the recently-conducted auction by Chandigarh licensing authority.

title: Stones pelted during Hanuman Jayanti rally in Haridwar, 114 booked
body: As many as 114 people were booked after stones were pelted during a rally on Hanuman Jayanti at a village in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Saturday. The incident was reported in Bhagwanpur area. Police said the situation was brought under control in a short time and Provincial Armed Constabulary along with state policemen have been deployed in and around the village.

title: Former Congress councillor shot at in a local market in Punjab
body: A former municipal council member belonging to the Congress was shot at by unidentified assailants at a local market in Punjab's Ferozepur on Tuesday. According to the police, Congress leader Mulakh Raj was at the local market with his wife when some men arrived there in an SUV and fired at him before escaping.

title: 8-yr-old boy found dead in Pune's Chikhali, murder probe launched
body: An 8-year-old boy was found dead with a "fatal injury inflicted with a blunt hard object" at a tin shed in Pune's Chikhali on Sunday, police said. His family had lodged a missing complaint when he didn't return home for a long time following which a search was launched. We've registered a murder case and launched a probe, police added.

title: Chhattisgarh man found dead days after meeting CM, Union Minister
body: The body of a 35-year-old man was found in Chhattisgarh's Kolaiguda on Sunday, days after he met Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel and Union MoS for Tribal Affairs Renuka Singh, demanding rehabilitation as he fled his village following Salwa Judum violence. Police believe he could have been killed due to personal reasons. They also suspect Maoists' role in his death.

title: Karisma Kapoor to star in Abhinay Deo's crime drama 'Brown'
body: Karisma Kapoor is set to play the lead role in a crime drama titled 'Brown'. The project, which is based on book 'City of Death' by Abheek Barua, will be directed by Abhinay Deo, who has previously helmed films like 'Delhi Belly' and 'Force 2'. Karisma took to Instagram to share some pictures from set and wrote, "To new beginnings."

title: TN girl kills neighbour for jewellery, says 'parents didn't buy ornaments'
body: 17-year-old, class 12 girl student has been arrested for allegedly strangling her 76-year-old neighbour and stealing 21-sovereign gold from the woman's house in Tamil Nadu. The girl said she murdered the woman for jewellery because her parents are daily wagers and haven't bought gold ornaments to save for her wedding. Incident came to light when woman's daughter found her dead.

title: Haven't thought that far but T20 WC remains at back of my mind: KKR's Umesh
body: KKR pacer Umesh Yadav, who has taken 10 wickets from six matches in IPL 2022, said he hasn't been thinking far ahead but 2022 T20 World Cup remains at the back of his mind. "It'll all depend on the selectors and the team management...but as a cricketer, I set small goals and try to achieve those in phases," he added.

title: RR's Yuzvendra Chahal takes his first hat-trick in IPL
body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal on Monday took his first hat-trick in IPL against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). The 31-year-old dismissed KKR's Shreyas Iyer, Shivam Mavi and Pat Cummins in consecutive deliveries of his last over. Chahal recorded bowling figures of 4-0-40-5, his first five-wicket haul in IPL.

title: Captaincy comes naturally to Iyer, his mindset is clear: Ravi Shastri
body: Former India cricketer Ravi Shastri has said that "captaincy comes naturally" to KKR skipper Shreyas Iyer. "You don't feel like he's (Iyer) leading KKR for the first time. Looks like he's been captaining them for the last three-to-four seasons," Shastri said. "Iyer's mindset is clear about what brand of cricket he needs to play as a batter," he added.

title: Lithuania bans usage of letter 'Z' amid Russian invasion of Ukraine
body: Lithuania on Tuesday banned the public displays of the letter 'Z' and other signs that symbolise support for Russia amid Ukraine's invasion. The letter 'Z' has been used as a marking on Russian military equipment participating in the war. Lithuanian lawmakers have also reportedly approved that fines for breaching the ban should be raised to €900 for individuals (over ₹74,000).

title: Fati was born to score goals, he reminds me of Samuel Eto'o: Alves
body: Barcelona player Dani Alves has said that forward Ansu Fati reminds him of former Barcelona forward Samuel Eto'o. "Fati was born to score goals...He is a machine for destroying defences. I think he can also define an era, a special history within Barcelona," Dani added. Fati donned the number 10 jersey after Lionel Messi's departure from the club.

title: Japan invents electric chopsticks that make food seem 1.5 times saltier
body: Japanese researchers have developed electric chopsticks that enhance the taste of salt in food by 1.5 times to reduce sodium levels in the food. The device that comes with a mini-computer worn on a wristband, uses a weak electrical current to transmit sodium ions from food via chopsticks to the mouth, thus creating a sense of saltiness, a researcher said.

title: Police uses drones to patrol Jamia Nagar, Jasola after Delhi violence
body: Delhi Police uses drone cameras for patrolling in Jamia Nagar and Jasola to ensure law and order in the areas a day after violence was reported during Hanuman Jayanti procession in North West Delhi's Jahangirpuri. On Saturday, stones were pelted following an argument during the rally. Heavy police force has been deployed in the area after the incident.

title: Woman burns mother's body after killing her over money in Gr Noida
body: Greater Noida Police have arrested a woman and her husband for allegedly killing her 56-year-old mother over money. The accused reportedly suffocated her to death, later dragged her body into the kitchen and burned it using petrol. They allegedly left the gas open to pass it off as an accident. The deceased had received ₹15 lakh from her insurance policy.

title: Nothing to say: Ex-Twitter CEO on why he didn't do anything about 'dysfunctional' board
body: After former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey tweeted that their board has "consistently been the dysfunction" of the company, a US journalist argued why he hadn't done anything about it when he ran the firm. Replying to him, Dorsey tweeted, "So much to say…but nothing that can be said." Dorsey's remarks come amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter.

title: Traffic awareness week being held at Pune's Baner till April 23
body: A traffic awareness week is being observed at the Radha chowk in Pune's Baner from April 18-23. About 10-15 wardens will be deployed in the area for the initiative. "We plan to post these wardens with traffic police at Saikar chowk, Mamta chowk, Nanaware chowk and Ganpati chowk within Baner and Balewadi to smoothen the traffic clog," an official said.

title: India to use semiconductors of $80 bn to make items worth $300 bn: Govt
body: Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar has said India will consume semiconductors of about $70-80 billion to manufacture electronics products worth $300 billion by 2026. Of the target of $300 billion in electronic manufacturing, $120 billion is being aimed for export. PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first 'Semicon India 2022 Conference' in Bengaluru.

title: I always found it tough to bowl to Sehwag in IPL: KKR spinner Narine
body: Ahead of his 150th IPL match, KKR spinner Sunil Narine was asked who he thinks played him the best in IPL, to which he replied Virender Sehwag. "I always found it tough because he was a guy who always kept the game going no matter what situation the team was in, he kept batting the way he did," he added.

title: Smuggled gold worth ₹1.58 crore seized in MP's Indore, 5 arrested
body: A Directorate of Revenue Intelligence unit seized 3 kg gold worth ₹1.58 crore after intercepting a car on the Mumbai-Agra highway near MP's Indore. Three smuggled gold bars were recovered from a specially built cavity in the car and all four occupants were arrested. A jeweller, who allegedly supplied the bars, was also arrested after the four revealed his location.

title: Man arrested for giving pistol to an accused in Jahangirpuri violence
body: Delhi Police have arrested a person named 'Gulli' for allegedly giving a pistol to an accused in the Jahangirpuri violence case. The police also arrested 28-year-old Imam alias Sonu, who was seen in a video purportedly firing a gun during the violence at Jahangirpuri. Drones are being used for surveillance in Delhi's Jahangirpuri after the violence, reports said.

title: Mandakini to make a comeback after 26 years, to star in son's music video
body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini, who quit the film industry in 1996, is making a comeback with a music video, which will also feature her son Rabbil. The song is about a mother and is titled 'Maa O Maa', director Sajan Agarwal said. "[It's] a very beautiful song and I instantly fell in love with it," Mandakini said.

title: 27-yr-old woman stabbed in thigh on New York City subway; suspect at large
body: A 27-year-old woman was stabbed in the thigh on a New York City subway platform on Monday, police said. The unidentified suspect fled "topside" out of the subway system and has not been arrested yet. The attack comes six days after a 62-year-old man opened fire in a New York City subway car, injuring more than 20 people.

title: SBI hikes lending rate by 0.1%, EMIs to go up
body: India's biggest lender State Bank of India (SBI) has hiked the marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 10 basis points, or 0.1%, across all loan tenors. With the increase, EMIs will go up for those borrowers who availed loans on MCLR. After the SBI, Kotak Mahindra, Bank of Baroda and Axis Bank also announced an increase in MCLR.

title: Female TikTok star jailed for 3 years for exploiting girls for money in Egypt
body: Female Egyptian TikTok star Haneen Hossam has been sentenced to three years in prison after being accused of exploiting girls for money through video-sharing platforms. Hossam was convicted of human trafficking over an invitation to her followers to get paid for making live videos. Human rights activists said she has been prosecuted as part of a crackdown on female influencers.

title: Can't wait for the exceptional ride: Johar on trailer of Ajay's 'Runway 34'
body: Karan Johar has praised the trailer of Ajay Devgn's upcoming film 'Runway 34', writing on Twitter, "Breathtaking and thrilling." "Cannot wait for the exceptional ride...An intriguing edge of the seat story and the perfect summer film," he added. Ajay thanked Karan and wrote, "That's a really cool compliment...I would like for you to see the film, when...first copy is out."

title: K'taka woman kills 6-month-old son, hangs self after husband dies
body: A 30-year old woman in Karnataka's Mangaluru allegedly killed her six-month-old son by strangulating him with a saree before hanging herself to death. The woman, who was staying at her brother's house, reportedly took this step after learning about her husband's sudden death. According to police, her 36-year-old husband died after being hit by an SUV while crossing a road.

title: Will try and comeback again: Rohit after MI's 6th straight loss
body: After losing their 6th consecutive IPL match on Saturday, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit has said that their side "will try and comeback". "I take full responsibility. It's not the end of the world, we have come back before and we will try and comeback again," Sharma said. He added that KL Rahul, who scored a century, batted "brilliantly" against them.

title: Hyd police nab 15 over gambling on rooster fights; ₹29,280 seized
body: Hyderabad's LB Nagar Special Operations Team has nabbed 15 people who were allegedly organising gambling on rooster fights in the forest area on the outskirts of Adibatla, the police tweeted on Tuesday. The police also recovered ₹29,280 and other items from the accused. The accused tried to escape when they noticed the police team but were caught.

title: Growing stronger: Tahira shares a video lifting heavy weights after 3.5 yrs
body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana's wife, author Tahira Kashyap Khurrana shared a glimpse of her workout video. Her latest video shows her regaining her strength and lifting heavy weights after three and a half years. Sharing the video, Tahira wrote, "Growing stronger! Being able to lift this much after 3.5 years." Taking to the comments section, actress Shilpa Shetty commented, "Daaanggg."

title: Either I can’t sleep or I sleep for 10-12 hrs: Sonam on pregnancy
body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, speaking about her pregnancy, has said that it has been "very tough" for her. "Your body changes every week, every day, and there are new experiences," she stated. Sonam further said, "Sometimes I can't sleep because I am running to the loo or I'm like sleeping for 10-12 hours and nobody can wake me up."

title: Anupam Kher shares pics showing his physical transformation; fans react
body: Actor Anupam Kher on Sunday took to Instagram to share pictures of his physical transformation. He wrote, "Your desire to change must be greater than your desire to stay the same! Being fit doesn’t begin in the gym with a dumbbell; it starts with a decision in your head!" Commenting on his post, a user wrote, "What a transformation sir!"

title: Divyansh-Manuraj crowned winners of India's Got Talent Season 9, win ₹20-lakh cash prize
body: Beatboxer Divyansh and flautist Manuraj have been crowned the winners of India's Got Talent Season 9. The duo won a cash prize of ₹20 lakh and a car. First runner-up Ishita Vishwakarma and second runner-up Bomb Fire Crew took home cash prize of  ₹5 lakh each. Divyansh hails from Jaipur, while Manuraj is from Bharatpur.

title: Cyprus eases COVID-19 entry requirements for vaccinated arrivals
body: Cyprus on Monday announced that vaccinated arrivals won't have to undergo COVID-19 testing prior to boarding a flight or on arrival. Additionally, all Cyprus-bound passengers will no longer be required to fill out a travel form, also known as 'Cyprus Flight Pass'. Unvaccinated arrivals will, however, need to undergo either an RT-PCR or rapid antigen test prior to arrival.

title: Apollo Global Management interested in a Twitter deal: Report
body: Private equity firm Apollo Global Management has expressed interest in participating in a deal for Twitter, Reuters reported citing sources. Apollo is seeking ways it can provide financing to any deal and is open to working with Musk or any other bidder. Earlier, Thoma Bravo had expressed interest in a buyout after Tesla CEO Elon Musk announced his bid.

title: Jason Momoa to star in Warner Bros' 'Minecraft' film: Reports
body: Actor Jason Momoa is all set to star in Warner Bros' live-action 'Minecraft' movie, according to reports. The upcoming film will reportedly be directed by Jared Hess of 'Napoleon Dynamite' fame. Jason will also be seen in 'Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom', the sequel to the 2018 film 'Aquaman'. The sequel is slated to release in March 2023.

title: 'Kem cho? Majama?', says WHO chief as PM Modi applauds; video surfaces
body: A video has shown WHO Director-General Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus talking in Gujarati during an event in Jamnagar. The video shows Ghebreyesus saying, "Kem cho? Majama? (How are you? Fine?)", while PM Narendra Modi is seen laughing and applauding. He was speaking at the inaugural ceremony of the WHO-Global Centre for Traditional Medicine.

title: Invited Macron to see evidence of ‘genocide’ in Ukraine: Zelenskyy
body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that he has invited his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron to visit Ukraine and see the evidence of 'genocide'. "I want him (Macron) to understand that this is not war, but...[a] genocide," Zelenskyy added. His comments come days after Macron refused to call the ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine a 'genocide' in an interview.

title: Delhi sees 632 fresh COVID-19 cases, positivity rate drops to 4.42% from 7.72%
body: Delhi reported 632 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, a day after it saw 501 cases. The daily positivity rate in the national capital was 4.42% as compared to 7.72% reported on Monday. The city saw zero deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the active cases stood at 1,274.

title: Salman and me were cordial & nice but I was never really close to him: Bhumika
body: Actress Bhumika Chawla, who was seen alongside actor Salman Khan in 'Tere Naam', said that the two were cordial and nice but she was never really close to the actor. She also said that she did not have "that much" interaction with him on a personal front. "I don't think I could get influenced by him," she added.

title: Over 100 Islamist insurgents killed recently: Joint African forces
body: A joint military force of African countries, consisting of Nigeria, Niger and Cameroon, said on Sunday that they have killed over 100 Islamist insurgents in recent weeks. The killed insurgents included 10 commanders, it added. A joint task force spokesperson said that troops had entered deep into insurgent-controlled enclaves in Lake Chad area and recovered weapons, food and illicit drugs.

title: Hyd's Bahadurpura flyover opens for public; to ease traffic congestion
body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao and Mohammed Mahmood Ali inaugurated the six-lane bi-directional flyover at Bahadurpura in Hyderabad on Tuesday. The flyover from Bahadurpura Police Station to Nehru Zoological Park, which has been constructed at an estimated cost of ₹69 crore, is expected to ease traffic congestion in the area. Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi was also present during the inauguration.

title: UP government cancels leaves of police personnel till May 4
body: Uttar Pradesh government has cancelled leaves of all police personnel in the state till May 4. The orders, issued late on Monday night, have reportedly been passed in view of festivals in the coming days. CM Yogi Adityanath has also directed officials to hold dialogues with religious leaders within the next 24 hours to ensure peace during the upcoming festivals.

title: Shelling killed 18, injured 100 in Kharkiv in 4 days: Ukraine Prez
body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that Russia's shelling is "constant" in Kharkiv and 18 people were killed in the past four days due to it. He added that over 100 people were also injured due to the shelling in the same period. "This is nothing but deliberate terror: mortars, artillery against ordinary residential quarters," he further said.

title: Received ₹500 as my 1st pay for working as a hostess at a conference: Samantha
body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu during a Q&A session on Instagram revealed that her first income was ₹500 which she had received as a hostess for an eight-hour shift at a conference in a hotel. She added that she was in Class 10 or 11 at that time. Born in Chennai, Samantha attended St Stephen's Matriculation School in Pallavaram.

title: Govt revising all testing norms for EV batteries & cells: Reports
body: The government is revising all testing norms for batteries, battery management and cells after multiple EV scooters caught fire across India, CNBC-TV18 reported. The government is holding a dialogue with companies connected with the fire incidents. Okinawa, Ola, Jitendra Electric and Pure EV are being advised on steps that need to be taken to prevent such fires in future.

title: Sri Lankan protesters demand justice for victims of 2019 attacks
body: A group of protesters in Sri Lanka on Sunday demanded justice for the victims of the suicide bombings on Easter Sunday in 2019. The protesters lit candles and displayed banners and placards during a silent protest in the capital, Colombo. The protesters demanded the government uncover what they called the real conspirators behind the attacks.

title: Allu Arjun rejects a large amount deal to endorse tobacco product: Report
body: Actor Allu Arjun has declined to become the face of a tobacco company despite being offered "a hefty sum", according to a report. "He rejected it without a second thought as he personally doesn't consume it. [He] doesn't want his fans to watch the ad and start consuming the product, which can lead to addiction," Pinkvilla said quoting a source.

title: BJP mentally divided India, worst is yet to come: Cong spokesperson
body: Congress Chief Spokesperson Atul Londhe said BJP has already "mentally divided" India and Hindus will be further segregated as "upper castes-lower castes". Centre's plans to impose Hindi has also sowed a north-south division, Londhe added. Speaking on the claims that BJP is using central agencies to retain power, Londhe said, "No [Maharashtra government] leaders get any kind of relief."

title: Campus Activewear IPO expected to be launched in May: Reports
body: Campus Activewear's IPO is expected to be launched in May 2022, according to reports. The company plans to sell 5.1 crore shares that'll be offered for sale by promoters and investors. The money raised will go to shareholders and Campus won't receive any of the funds. It had received market regulator SEBI's nod for the IPO launch in March.

title: Your pain is our pain: Manchester United to Ronaldo after his newborn son passes away
body: After Cristiano Ronaldo announced the death of his newborn son, Manchester United tweeted, "Your pain is our pain." The club further said in a statement, "Family is more important than everything and Ronaldo is supporting his loved ones at this immensely difficult time...We can confirm he will not feature in the match against Liverpool at Anfield on Tuesday evening."

title: I hate Shang-Chi comics, character is not fleshed out: Simu Liu
body: Actor Simu Liu has revealed that he hates certain Shang-Chi comics due to the way the stories involving the Chinese-American superhero were written. Simu added that the comics were written by white men who didn't understand an authentic Asian-American experience. "[Shang-Chi in the comics] was very serious, spoke mostly in mystical proverbs and didn't feel fleshed out," the actor said.

title: Ready to review executive powers, says Sri Lanka's Prez amid crisis
body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday said that he's open to changes in the nation's constitution, potentially setting the stage for curbing the executive powers of his office. Rajapaksa's comment is an attempt to appease protesters calling for his ouster amid a severe economic crisis in the country, a report said. He appointed 17 new Cabinet ministers today.

title: Tribals will continue to fight for their heritage, tradition: CPI(M) leader
body: CPI(M) West Bengal Secretary Mohammed Salim has criticised the ruling TMC government's Deucha Pachami coal block mining project in the Birbhum district. "This is the (tribals') heritage and tradition...They will fight and we will continue our support to them," Salim said. He also claimed that the Trinamool's land acquisition supporters were shown black flags by the tribals on Monday.

title: Sri Lanka may overcome economic crisis if govt, people cooperate: Ex-PM
body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Monday that the country's ongoing economic crisis can be solved if both the government and citizens accept a uniform solution. He added that the anti-government protesters have created a situation of political instability in the country. Notably, Sri Lanka announced 17 new ministerial appointments today, weeks after 26 ministers resigned from Cabinet.

title: Insurance scheme for healthcare workers on COVID-19 duty extended
body: The insurance scheme for healthcare workers who are engaged in COVID-19-related duties has been extended by 180 days from today, the government said in a press release. The scheme, which is under the Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Package (PMGKP), has been extended to "provide the safety net to the dependents of health workers". The PMGKP was launched in March 2020.

title: Leaked pictures of Prabhas from 'Salaar' sets surface online
body: Two pictures of actor Prabhas from the sets of his upcoming film 'Salaar' have been leaked online. The film is directed and written by Prashanth Neel, who has directed the 'KGF' franchise. Actress Shruti Haasan is the female lead in the film and actor Prithviraj will also feature in the film. The film's release date is yet to be announced.

title: Putin discusses Ukraine crisis with Palestinian President Abbas
body: Russian President Vladimir Putin held a phone call with his Palestinian counterpart Mahmoud Abbas and discussed the ongoing conflict in Ukraine, Kremlin said on Monday. The two leaders also discussed escalating tensions in West Bank and East Jerusalem, Kremlin added. At least 152 Palestinians were injured in clashes with Israeli riot police inside Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound on Friday.

title: No chance of communal clashes post-Ramzan in Maharashtra: Minister
body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil on Tuesday said there is no possibility of communal clashes erupting in the state after the ongoing month of Ramzan. "Some parties are attempting to create a communal divide in the state...There is no information on such (riots) in the state. However, the police are monitoring the situation closely," Patil said.

title: Training aircraft of pvt flying school topples on runway, 1 injured
body: A training aircraft of a private flying school toppled during landing at the Jakkur Aerodrome in Bengaluru on Sunday evening. An international skydiving champion, who was on the aircraft, received minor injuries as she was rescued by the pilot. The pilot reportedly spotted dogs and birds on the runway after landing and acted immediately.

title: Leopard that killed an 8-yr-old boy shot dead in U'khand's Tehri
