body: A leopard, which killed an eight-year-old boy in Uttarakhand's Tehri district, was shot dead after it "returned to its kill site to devour the remaining body on Monday", a forest officer said. The boy was attacked while walking to a village to attend a wedding ceremony. Officials believe the leopard attacked humans as its damaged nails prevented it from hunting.

title: Torture chambers built by Russian troops in southern Ukraine: Zelenskyy
body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said Russian troops in southern Ukraine have been carrying out torture and kidnappings. "Torture chambers are built there. They abduct representatives of local governments and anyone deemed visible to local communities," he said in an address to the nation. Zelenskyy said that humanitarian aid has been stolen, creating famine.

title: I don't remember seeing Dhoni losing too many games like this: Vaughan
body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan questioned Ravindra Jadeja's captaincy after CSK's fifth loss in six games in the ongoing IPL season and said that he doesn't remember ex-captain MS Dhoni losing too many games like this. "Honestly, it wasn't a tight game [against GT] and they lost it. They should've easily won that game by 10 or 15 runs," he added.

title: Captain of large Russian landing ship killed in Ukraine: Reports
body: The captain of a large Russian landing ship has reportedly been killed in Ukraine. Governor of Sevastopol Mikhail Razvozhayev said Captain Alexander Chirva died from wounds he sustained during a battle with Ukrainian defenders. Captain Chirva was the commander of the Russian landing ship Caesar Kunikov which is a part of Russia's Black Sea fleet.

title: Bitcoin falls to lowest in a month, global crypto market's value falls to $1.9 trillion
body: The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as much as 4.2% to $38,580 and the second-largest cryptocurrency, Ether, dropped 4.7% to as low as $2,902 on Monday. The global crypto market’s value dropped about 4% in the past 24 hours to $1.9 trillion, according to the pricing from CoinGecko. Bitcoin has been struggling along with risk assets in recent months.

title: Delhi's COVID-19 positivity rate jumped 3-fold between April 11-18
body: The COVID-19 positivity rate in Delhi registered a nearly three-fold rise between April 11 and 18, according to data released by Delhi's health department. While the positivity rate stood at 2.7% on April 11, it jumped to 7.72% on April 18. Last week, Delhi recorded 2,606 COVID-19 positive cases against 67,360 tests with an average positivity rate of 4.79%.

title: It is clear that BJP itself is behind Jahangirpuri violence: AAP
body: AAP on Sunday alleged that considering the recent events, it is "clear" that BJP is behind the violence that broke out in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta had honoured "goons" who were arrested for vandalising the national capital's CM's residence, it said. "When you...honour such goons you send a message...that you're on the side of violence," it added.

title: Which cricketers have bowled 20th over of an innings as maiden in IPL history?
body: SRH pacer Umran Malik became the fourth bowler to record the 20th over of an innings as maiden in IPL after conceding no runs and taking three wickets in PBKS' 20th over. Irfan Pathan bowled the 20th over as maiden, while representing KXIP against MI in 2008. Other bowlers to do so are Lasith Malinga (2009) and Jaydev Unadkat (2017).

title: Will target Israel's heart if it acts against Iran: Prez Raisi
body: Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi has warned Israel of a military response if it acts against the Islamic nation. "If you [Israel] take the slightest move against our nation, our armed forces will target the heart of the Zionist regime," said Raisi. This comes after Israel said it will not accept Iran as "a nuclear threshold state".

title: I used to be insomniac, now I'm early morning person: Shahid Kapoor
body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his sleeping habits, said that he wakes up early. Shahid further stated that if he has a shoot at 8-9 am, he wakes up 3.5 hours before it. "I used to be an insomniac. Now I'm a very early morning person...I love morning energy and by 6-6.30 in the evening I am out," Shahid added.

title: Will Ram Navami processions be taken out in Pak if not in India: Giriraj
body: Union Minister and BJP leader Giriraj Singh asked if Ram Navami processions should be taken out in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan if not in India. "Had processions of any other faith...been attacked, leaders like Rahul Gandhi and ailing (RJD President) Lalu Prasad...would have hit the streets for their political tourism," he added.

title: I am doing my own biopic: Lalit Modi on reports of film being made on him
body: Former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi responded to reports of a film being made about him. In two separate posts, he wrote, "Surprised to see my name associated with some book soon to be a movie. I've NOTHING...to do with this film or book...Just to be clear- I'm doing my own." He added that he'll announce it in a few weeks.

title: Biggest risk of cryptocurrency will be money laundering, terror financing: Sitharaman
body: The biggest risk of cryptocurrency would be money laundering and its use for financing terror, said Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. "I think regulation using technology is the only answer. Regulation using technology will have to be so adept, that it has to be not behind the curve, but be sure that it is on the top of it," she added.

title: Russia's new offensive will fail, they don't have enough strength: Ukraine
body: Russia's new offensive in eastern Ukraine is going "very cautiously" but "the battle will not go in Russia's favour", Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych said. "Their offensive will fail, I give you a 99% guarantee, they simply do not have enough strength," he added. Arestovych also said that Russian forces were trying to find "sensitive spots" in Ukraine's defences.

title: Grammy-winning singer Jon Batiste to make acting debut with The Color Purple
body: Multiple Grammy-winning singer Jon Batiste is set to make his feature acting debut with 'The Color Purple'. Blitz Bazawule, the filmmaker behind Beyoncé's 'Black Is King', will direct the upcoming project. In addition to Batiste, 'The Color Purple' will also feature Taraji P. Henson, Fantasia Barrino, Danielle Brooks, Colman Domingo, Corey Hawkins and others.

title: Maharashtra reports 137 new COVID-19 cases, three deaths
body: Maharashtra, on Tuesday, logged 137 new COVID-19 cases taking its tally to 78,76,041, the latest health department bulletin showed. There were three casualties reported as well, pushing the overall death tally to 1,47,830, according to the bulletin. Out of three new deaths in Maharashtra, Pune accounted for two deaths while Parbhani saw a single fatality.

title: Teen falls to death from waterfall while clicking selfie in Pune
body: Police and rescue teams on Sunday recovered the body of an 18-year-old boy, a day after he fell into Kund Mala waterfall in Pune while clicking a selfie. The body was found stuck in the water hyacinth and was retrieved, officials said. According to police, six students of Indira College, including the deceased, had gone to visit the waterfall.

title: Don't want to play friend who drives hero to girlfriend’s house: Anant Vidhaat
body: Actor Anant Vidhaat said that he does not want to play the role of a friend who drives the hero to his girlfriend's house. "I better engage myself doing theatre than doing those roles," he said, adding, "After Sultan, I was mostly getting roles of hero's friend." Anant said that Yash Raj Films gave him a good platform.

title: Real Madrid's Benzema is exceptional: Man City manager Pep Guardiola
body: Ahead of the Champions League semifinal fixture against Real Madrid, Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema is exceptional. "Benzema is not only a scorer but is a fantastic all-round player. His career is phenomenal," Guardiola added. In the ongoing Champions League season, Benzema has scored 12 goals in nine games played so far.

title: Du Plessis' failure so far one of the big stories of IPL 2022: Manjrekar
body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said RCB captain Faf Du Plessis' "failure" so far in IPL 2022 is one of the big stories of the ongoing edition. Du Plessis has scored 154 runs in six IPL 2022 matches so far at a strike rate of 123.20. The South African was the second-highest run-scorer in IPL 2021 with 633 runs for CSK.

title: Ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS: CEO
body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) CEO Rajesh Gopinathan called the current scramble for employees "transitory" and argued that, ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS, Bloomberg reported. He said that TCS enjoys the highest structural margins. "We enjoy the benefit of occupying the high point on the profitability side...everybody else is benchmarked below us," he added.

title: 5 arrested for hoisting saffron flag on dargah in Gujarat
body: Five persons were arrested and a juvenile was detained for allegedly hoisting a saffron flag on a dargah during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Gujarat's Veraval. According to police, when the procession was passing by Magrebisha Bapu's dargah, some men "entered the dargah premises and hoisted a 'bhagva' (saffron) flag on the roof of the toilet block".

title: Jet fuel price up 0.2%, touches all-time high after 2022's 8th hike
body: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, was hiked by 0.2% on Saturday to an all-time high on the back of rising global oil prices. ATF now costs ₹1,13,202.33/kl in Delhi, ₹1,11,981.99/kl in Mumbai and ₹1,17,753.6/kl in Kolkata. In eight hikes beginning January 1, ATF prices have been increased by ₹39,180.42, or almost 50%.

title: What happened after slap was disturbing: Jay Leno on Will slapping Chris
body: Speaking about actor Will Smith slapping comedian-actor Chris Rock at the 2022 Oscars, comedian Jay Leno said that the slap wasn't the most disturbing thing. "Because he was kind of smirking after he slapped Rock. It was the yelling of the obscenities. Then you go, 'Whoa. What's going on here? This is real anger'," Jay added.

title: He touched our hearts: PM Modi after WHO chief greets public in Gujarati
body: PM Narendra Modi has thanked WHO chief Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus for speaking in Gujarati, Hindi and English during an inaugural ceremony of the WHO-Global Centre for Traditional Medicine in Jamnagar. PM Modi said, "[Tedros] made us feel 'Triveni'...and touched our hearts by speaking in Gujarati, Hindi and English." Tedros had greeted public asking, "Kem cho? Majama? (How're you? Fine?)"

title: Not guaranteed that Macron will win French presidential polls: PM
body: France PM Jean Castex said on Tuesday that Emmanuel Macron wasn't guaranteed to win the runoff in the presidential election on April 24 against his political opponent Marine Le Pen. Macron and Le Pen secured the most votes in the first round of elections. Notably, Castex has also said that he'll tender his resignation if Macron is re-elected as President.

title: PBKS are playing an entertaining brand of cricket in IPL 2022: Jaffer
body: Wasim Jaffer said PBKS are playing the most aggressive and entertaining cricket in IPL 2022, adding they end up scoring 190 even if they keep losing wickets. "But, if they don't lose wickets...play their brand of cricket, then you might see...totals of 220-225 posted by them," he added. PBKS were bowled out for 151 in 20 overs against SRH today.

title: Kendrick Lamar announces new album after 5 years, Twitter users react
body: After a gap of five years, rapper Kendrick Lamar announced on Twitter that his new album 'Mr Morale & the Big Steppers' will release on May 13. He added the link oklama.com containing details of the album to an old tweet that read, "Lamar is officially retired." "IT'S HAPPENING," a Twitter user wrote. His last album 'DAMN' released in 2017.

title: Singapore & New Zealand to jointly tackle climate change: Leaders
body: Singapore and New Zealand will jointly tackle climate change by cooperating on green technologies, Prime Ministers from both countries, Lee Hsien Loong and Jacinda Ardern, said on Tuesday. The countries will adopt initiatives around energy transition technology, sustainable transport and waste management, Lee added. "We cannot...simply return to a high carbon emissions...approach," Ardern stated.

title: Russia expels 15 Dutch envoys in retaliatory move amid Ukraine war
body: Russia on Tuesday expelled 15 Dutch diplomats from the country, its Foreign Ministry said. Among those expelled, 14 persons were employees at the Dutch embassy in Moscow and one was a staffer at the Dutch Consulate General in St. Petersburg. The move comes in response to the expulsion of 17 Russian envoys in the Netherlands last month amid Ukraine invasion.

title: Despite poor start he showed intent: Ajay Jadeja on Chahal's 5-wicket haul
body: Reacting to RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal's five-wicket haul against KKR which included a hat-trick, ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said Chahal showed intent to pick wickets despite a "poor" start to his spell. "I am trying to convince people that Chahal's cricketing brain is probably three or four times than who we think has the best brain," added Ajay.

title: Ukraine denies attacking Russian border village amid ongoing war
body: Ukraine on Tuesday denied accusations by a Russian provincial governor that it had attacked a border village amid countries' ongoing conflict. Vyacheslav Gladkov, Governor of Russian province of Belgorod had accused Ukrainian forces of wounding three people and damaging as many as 30 houses in alleged attack. "Ukraine is conducting a defence operation on its territory," Ukrainian military said.

title: Kejriwal to visit Bengaluru on April 21, attend farmers' convention
body:
Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will visit Bengaluru on April 21 and attend a convention of farmers on the invitation of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha chief and farmer leader Kodihalli Chandrashekhar. 
AAP's Karnataka Convener Prithvi Reddy said the party is the platform for people who fight for farmers' cause. He said AAP wants to get such people elected to Vidhana Soudha.

title: Kerala temple displays board banning entry of Muslims during festival; protest erupts
body: Protests broke out after a board outside the Malliyottu Palottu Kavu temple in Kunhimangalam of Kerala's Kannur said that Muslims were not allowed inside the premises during a festival. The board was put up during the Vishu-related festival in the temple, held between April 14 and 19. Last year, a similar message was displayed outside the temple, as per reports.

title: 5 held in Himachal after WhatsApp chat indicates paper leak in police exam
body: Five youngsters from Solan's Arki area were arrested a week after their WhatsApp chat was shared on social media, allegedly indicating that the paper of the Himachal Pradesh Police constable recruitment exam had been leaked. All five had scored marks above 60 out of 80. "Their cell phones have been seized and are being analysed," Solan SP, Virender Sharma, said.

title: J&K's Tulip Garden to shut a week early due to high temperature
body: The Tulip Garden in J&K's Srinagar which is one of its major tourist attractions will be closing on Monday, a week ahead of the usual time. "We are closing early this season as the bloom has reduced due to high temperatures," the garden's in-charge Sofi Inam-ur-Rehman said. The flowers require temperatures between 15 and 25 degrees Celsius to bloom.

title: 'Beta apne ghar par dhyan do': Suniel to troll over his remark after KL Rahul's hundred
body: Actor Suniel Shetty responded to a troll's remark after LSG captain KL Rahul smashed a hundred in his 100th IPL match against MI on Saturday. Suniel had shared an appreciation post, on which the troll commented how in the absence of Suniel and his family, KL Rahul was able to score a century. "Focus on your own home," Suniel replied.

title: Greece impounds oil tanker as part of EU sanctions against Russia
body: Greece on Tuesday said that it has impounded a Russian oil tanker off the island of Evia. The move is part of efforts by Greece to enforce European Union (EU) sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. Earlier this month, the EU had banned Russian-flagged vessels from its ports with some exemptions.

title: Seemed wasteful: Musk on Tesla removing mobile connectors with cars
body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk defended the firm's decision to stop including its mobile connector with new car purchases, saying, "Usage statistics were super low, so seemed wasteful." Tesla will instead sell its charging kit separately for a lower $200 price. Musk added Tesla will "make it easy" to order the mobile connector when purchasing a car.

title: Would've been fun: Josh on almost playing Batman in Snyder's film
body: Actor Josh Brolin, talking about almost playing DC superhero Batman in Zack Snyder's 'Batman v Superman', said wanted to do the role, however, Snyder didn't see him fit for the role. "That was his decision...Honestly, that would have been a fun deal, and maybe I'll do it when I'm 80," he stated. Josh played Thanos in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

title: More would be injured had we not intervened: Policeman on Delhi violence
body: Sub-inspector of Police Meda Lal Meena, who sustained a bullet injury during the Jahangirpuri violence, said that more people would've been injured had police not intervened. He said that the rally were shouting 'Jai Shri Ram' when they reached the C block mosque. Meena added that the officers had to intervene to stop the fighting groups.

title: Never ever get a tattoo: Samantha to fan despite having 3 tattoos
body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu held an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram Stories during which a fan asked for tattoo suggestions. The actress responded, "You know the one thing I'd tell my younger self is never ever get a tattoo. Never. Never ever. Ever, get a tattoo."  Samantha reportedly has three tattoos connected to her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya.

title: 'Feeling good,' says McCoy after bowling a match-winning final over vs KKR
body: Rajasthan Royals pacer Obed McCoy said that he "felt good" after the match against KKR in which the West Indian defended 11 runs in the final over and led RR to a victory. "This is my first game since last year...had come under pressure, feeling good, it was just about getting over the nerves and going hard," McCoy said.

title: KRK announces 'Deshdrohi 2', says it'll be bigger than 'Baahubali'
body: Actor-critic Kamaal R Khan on Monday announced his next film 'Deshdrohi 2' and shared its poster on Twitter which reads "bigger than 'Baahubali'". Kamaal tweeted that shooting for the film will begin soon. A social media user replied to the poster, "The movie nobody asked for and nobody needs," while another wrote, "India is not ready for another pandemic."

title: Before 'Gangubai...' I'd be replaced at the last minute: Shantanu
body: Actor Shantanu Maheshwari, who made his Bollywood debut in Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', recalled his struggling days and said he would get rejected or replaced at the last minute in films. "I am glad those projects didn't happen because then 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' wouldn't have happened, I wouldn't have gotten a chance to work with Sanjay sir," he further stated.

title: Told Nike this was not on: Rai on women cricketers' jerseys being made from men's kits
body: Ex-CoA Chairman Vinod Rai, in a recent interview, said that women cricketers had not been taken seriously in India till around 2006. He added, "I was aghast to know...men's uniforms were being cut up and re-stitched for women's players. I had to ring up Nike and tell them that this wasn't on and that their design would be different."

title: Death toll from flooding in South Africa rises to 443
body: The death toll from flooding in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province rose to 443, the provincial Premier said on Sunday. At least 63 people are missing, Sihle Zikalala added. The floods have left thousands homeless, knocked out power and water services and disrupted operations at the port of Durban, one of Africa's busiest ports.

title: Corruption and Congress are synonyms: BJP chief JP Nadda
body: BJP President Jagat Prakash Nadda on Sunday said corruption and Congress are synonyms. "Where there is BJP, there is a mission; where there is Congress, there is a commission," Nadda said while speaking at the Karyakarta Samavesh in Karnataka. "Even under adverse conditions, India is ready to make economic leaps under Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership," he added.

title: People have not seen me in this kind of part: Sharad on 'Operation Romeo'
body: Sharad Kelkar, speaking about his upcoming project 'Operation Romeo', said that it's an important movie in his career as it'll give fans an opportunity to see him in a "gritty" role. "People haven't seen me in this kind of part so it's like reinvention," he added. Directed by Shashant Shah, the film is the remake of 2019 Malayalam film 'Ishq'.

title: Flipkart acquires D2C SaaS platform ANS Commerce
body: Flipkart has acquired D2C SaaS platform ANS Commerce for an undisclosed amount. The deal is expected to close in the second half of 2022, subject to customary closing conditions. ANS Commerce will continue to operate as an independent business. ANS provides various services to companies and brands looking to sell online, including services that help brands set up digital storefronts.

title: Afghanistan gets 30 tonnes of food and relief supplies from UAE
body: Afghanistan received 30 tonnes of food and relief supplies from the UAE amid the humanitarian situation in the country. An aircraft carrying the supplies reached Kabul on Monday. A Taliban spokesperson reportedly said that the supplies will be distributed among the vulnerable people by the government. He further called for unconditional aid, devoid of any political motive.

title: Rescued tiger jumps into water during release in Sundarbans, old video resurfaces
body: IFS Officer Parveen Kaswan on Sunday shared an old video that captured the release of a rescued tiger that jumped and swam away from a boat in Sundarbans. Sharing the video, he wrote, "That tiger sized jump though." A user commented on the video, "Reminds me of Life of Pi!" Another tweeted, "It's swimming like an expert fish."

title: Vital that friends stick together amid threats to peace: UK PM ahead of India visit
body: Ahead of his visit to India on April 21, UK PM Boris Johnson tweeted, "As we face threats to our peace and prosperity from autocratic states, it is vital that democracies and friends stick together." The visit is aimed at deepening "the long-term partnership between our countries", Johnson said, adding, "India...is a highly valued strategic partner for the UK."

title: I needed to step up, take responsibility: Rashid on scoring 40(21) vs CSK
body: GT stand-in captain Rashid Khan said he wanted two batters to score big in their chase of CSK's 170-run target and he needed to step up and take the responsibility after they were reduced to 87/5 after 13 overs. Rashid scored 40 off 21 balls while David Miller smashed 94*(51) to help GT win the game by three wickets.

title: Best hospitality in the world: Pietersen in Hindi before joining IPL commentary team
body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen on Monday praised India in a tweet in Hindi ahead of joining the IPL commentary team and said, "Very excited to be back in India." He added, "Experiencing the best hospitality in the world is something I will never take lightly! See you in a few hours, India!"

title: Shocking and saddening: PM Modi on the demise of 18-year-old TT player Vishwa
body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday tweeted, "The demise of TT champion Vishwa Deenadayalan is shocking and saddening." The 18-year-old table tennis player from Tamil Nadu died in a road accident on Sunday while travelling from Guwahati to Shillong for the 83rd Senior National and Inter-State Table Tennis Championship. PM Modi said Vishwa had distinguished himself in several competitions.

title: Dhawan is in form of his life, he's 'Mr IPL' for me: Swann
body: Calling Shikhar Dhawan "Mr IPL", Graeme Swann said the PBKS opener is in the form of his life. "I love watching every minute of him bat like that," he added. "He's been playing a pink suit gear dog in...[ongoing] IPL," he further said. Shikhar is PBKS' second-highest run-scorer, having scored 205 runs thus far this season in six matches.

title: If I don't use a plane, I have less hours to work: World's richest man Musk
body: World's richest man Elon Musk has said that he does not spend "billions of dollars a year" in personal consumption. Stating that his personal consumption is not high, Musk said in a TED interview, "The one exception is a plane, but if I don't use the plane, then I have less hours to work." He added, "I don't...really take vacations."

title: UK PM apologises for attending surprise b'day party amid lockdown after being fined
body: British PM Boris Johnson has offered an apology for attending illegal party during lockdown, but said he didn't knowingly break rules or mislead Parliament. Johnson told lawmakers that "it did not occur to me" that the gathering was a party. Last week, Johnson was fined £50 for attending his own surprise birthday party at his official residence in June 2020.

title: Mahesh Babu buys electric car Audi e-tron worth ₹1.19 crore, shares pic
body: Actor Mahesh Babu has bought electric car Audio e-tron which is worth around ₹1.19 crore. "Bringing a clean, green and sustainable future home," he wrote on Instagram while sharing a picture. The car is Audi's first all-electric model to be launched in India. The car is equipped with a 95 kWh battery pack and a dual motor setup.

title: Cong seeks disqualification of its two Rajkot corporators for joining AAP
body: The Congress has written to the Commissioner of the Rajkot Municipal Corporation requesting him to disqualify two Congress corporators who joined AAP last week. Congress' Rajkot city unit President Pradeep Trivedi alleged that the duo, Vashram Sagathiya and Komal Bharai, were elected as corporators on Congress tickets and therefore, they should be disqualified for joining another party.

title: TRS leader's son held for kidnaping, raping 20-yr-old after drugging her in T'gana
body: TRS ward councillor Mohammed Khaja's son Sheik Ghouse Pasha and his friend have been arrested for allegedly kidnapping and gang-raping a 20-year-old woman for two days after drugging her in Telangana's Kodad. The woman alleged when she regained consciousness, she escaped and informed her family about the incident. She added she was beaten up so badly that she was unconscious.

title: 3 masked men try to rob Ludhiana finance company’s office, manage to escape
body: Three masked men attempted to rob the office of a finance company in Ludhiana’s Raikot on Saturday. The manager of the firm said the robbers asked him to hand over almirah's keys to them. On resisting, the accused opened fire in the air. However, after the manager raised the alarm, the accused persons managed to escape.

title: Formula One is in a good place commercially: Haas team boss Steiner
body: Haas team boss Gunther Steiner said Formula One is "in a good place commercially" following the addition of Las Vegas as a race venue from 2023 onwards. "In general, Formula One is in a good place commercially. There are a lot of places that want a race, we can almost choose where we want to go," Steiner said.

title: Investors lose ₹2.5 lakh crore wealth in a day as Sensex crashes 1,170 points
body: Nearly ₹2.5 lakh crore was wiped off investors' wealth on Monday as Sensex plunged 1,172 points to settle at 57,166 amid weak global cues. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies dropped to ₹269.48 lakh crore from ₹ 272.12 lakh crore in the previous session. Infosys, HDFC, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra, Wipro and TCS were among the top losers on Monday.

title: Pic shows bags full of cats & dogs in China as police kill pets of COVID +ve owners
body: Pictures and videos of bags full of cats and dogs on a pavement in China's Shanghai amid COVID-19 lockdown are being widely circulated online. Police in the city are allegedly torturing and killing the pets of owners who have tested positive for COVID-19. Earlier, a video showing a health worker beating a pet dog to death also surfaced online.

title: We've had 2 attempts at getting married, COVID knocked us out of park: Cyrus
body: Cyrus Sahukar said that he and his wife Vaishali Malahara have been together for eight years and have had two attempts at getting married. "But both times Corona has knocked us out of the park...In February, cases were like 23,000 a day...and we were like how can we possibly get married when there's so much stress...in everyone's life," he added.

title: We weren't good enough, table isn't lying: Bumrah on MI being in last spot
body: Following MI's sixth straight loss in IPL 2022, pacer Jasprit Bumrah said his side were not good enough in the past matches and points table isn't lying. "With a lot of games and a little luck here and there, but yeah, it's the way it is. I'm not shying away from that," he added. MI are currently last in standings.

title: Video of KKR captain Shreyas Iyer arguing with head coach Brendon McCullum goes viral
body: A video of Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) captain Shreyas Iyer arguing with head coach Brendon McCullum after his dismissal against Rajasthan Royals (RR) has gone viral on social media. Iyer reportedly got angry over KKR's batting order during their run chase. RR won the match by seven runs. Iyer top-scored for KKR with 85(51).

title: MHA designates LeT commander Sheikh Sajad as terrorist under UAPA
body: The Ministry of Home Affairs designated Sheikh Sajad, a commander of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT), as a terrorist under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act. The ministry stated in a notification that Sajad has been absconding in a case related to the recovery of arms and ammunition in Jammu and Kashmir. He has also been recruiting the youth of J&K into LeT.

title: Zilingo board considering replacing Indian-origin CEO amid probe: Report
body: Singapore's fashion startup Zilingo's board is discussing replacing Indian-origin CEO Ankiti Bose after suspending her earlier this month amid an investigation into the startup's accounting practices, Bloomberg reported. Bose, whose current suspension runs through May 5, has reportedly asked the board to clarify her status. The board has not yet decided who will replace Bose.

title: Maha farmer killed by tiger while watering crops in his farm
body: A 67-year-old farmer in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district was mauled to death by a tiger after he went to his farm to water his crops. The incident took place in the Brahmapuri forest division on Saturday. The farmer was dragged over a distance of 200 metres by the tiger and his body was found near the Wainganga river, an official said.

title: Rashid captaining GT vs CSK as Hardik misses out due to groin stiffness, playing XIs out
body: Gujarat Titans (GT) won the toss and elected to bowl first against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday. GT are being led by Rashid Khan in the match as Hardik Pandya misses out due to stiffness in his groin. GT have included Alzarri Joseph and Wriddhiman Saha in their playing XI.

title: Mumbai man gets ₹7.5 lakh prize money letter, ends up losing ₹16 lakh
body: A 32-year-old Mumbai-based man had received a postal letter, which mentioned a lucky draw from a known online shopping portal with a scratch card in it. On scratching the card, it showed that he had become a lucky winner of ₹7.50 lakh cash prize. The accused induced the victim to pay ₹16 lakh in order to claim the prize.

title: Centre procures 69 lakh metric tonnes of wheat in current season
body: The Centre has procured 69.24 lakh metric tonnes (LMT) of wheat, with an MSP value of ₹13,951 crore, till April 17 during the rabi marketing season (RMS) 2022-23, Union Ministry's officials said. According to them, the wheat procurement has benefitted nearly 5.86 lakh farmers this season. The MSP of wheat for the RMS 2022-23 is ₹2,015 per quintal.

title: Mariupol doesn't exist anymore: Ukraine's Foreign Minister after Russian siege
body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said the port city of Mariupol "doesn't exist anymore". "The situation in Mariupol is both dire militarily and heartbreaking. The city doesn't exist anymore," Kuleba told CBS News. "It seems from the way the Russian army behaves in Mariupol, they decided to raze the city to the ground at any cost,"  he added.

title: 8 injured as 2 TMC groups clash near MP's house in Kolkata; 6 arrested
body: A clash broke out between two groups of the Trinamool Congress (TMC), who had been trying to take control of the construction business in a locality in Kolkata's Lake Gardens area. Six persons have been arrested in connection with the incident, which left at least eight injured. The incident took place near TMC MP Sougata Roy's residence.

title: Previous govts left Punjab with a debt of ₹3 lakh crore: CM Mann
body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday blamed state's previous governments for its debt. "Previous governments...left a debt of ₹3 lakh crore on Punjab. But where has this loan been used? We'll investigate and recover [the amount],” AAP's Punjab unit tweeted quoting Mann. Notably, Mann sought financial package of ₹1 lakh crore for state from PM Narendra Modi after assuming charge.

title: FM Nirmala Sitharaman to travel to US on official visit tonight
body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will embark on an official visit to the United States late tonight, the Ministry of Finance said on Sunday. During her visit, Sitharaman will attend the spring meetings of the IMF and the World Bank and the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governor meeting. She will also hold one-on-one meetings with CEOs of various companies.

title: Hopefully, I start & finish here: Narine ahead of 150th match for KKR
body: Sunil Narine, who will play his 150th match for KKR against Rajasthan Royals today, has said, "I've always told Venky [Mysore, CEO]...hopefully, I don't play for any other franchise." "I've loved my stay at KKR, so hopefully I start and finish here," he added. Narine, who was bought by KKR in 2012, has taken 147 wickets in 140 IPL matches.

title: Chris Jordan gives away most runs by a CSK bowler in a match in IPL 2022
body: CSK's bowling all-rounder Chris Jordan gave away most runs by a CSK bowler in an IPL 2022 match after conceding 58 runs against GT. Jordan registered figures of 3.5-0-58-0. He conceded four sixes and five fours in his spell. Before Jordan, pacer Mukesh Choudhary had conceded the most runs (4-0-52-1) by a CSK bowler in an IPL 2022 match.

title: Fresh stone-pelting in Jahangirpuri, police attacked by relatives of accused
body: Stones were pelted at a police team on Monday near the site of Saturday's communal violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. As per police, family members of an accused pelted two stones at the team when they went to question them and one person has been detained. As many as 23 people have so far been arrested in connection to Saturday's incident.

title: Railway police officer killed, another injured in terror attack in J&K
body: A Railway Protection Force Head Constable was killed and an Assistant Sub-Inspector injured after terrorists opened fire at them in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Monday, officials said. The incident took place near a tea stall in Kakapora area. After the attack, Head Constable Surinder Singh and ASI Devraj were taken to a hospital where Singh was declared dead.

title: Govt to continue 15-day fare limit on air travel: Civil Aviation Minister Scindia
body: The Ministry of Civil Aviation imposed a fare cap for 15 days on air travel due to the pandemic. Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday said, "If we talk about the fare caps, then it is my responsibility to the passengers as well as to the airlines...The decision to remove it will be taken at an appropriate time."

title: Duo talks about bid to loot 3rd temple near Pune bus stop; caught
body: Pune police arrested two people, aged 25 and 19, on Monday for alleged jewellery thefts at two temples in the city. The duo was caught while they were discussing their bid to loot a third temple near a bus stop in Warje Malwadi. Following the arrest, police recovered stolen jewellery and funds, worth a total of ₹18,234 from the duo.

title: Drunk policeman slaps 2 blind men, breaks walking stick in Chennai
body: A drunk police constable in Chennai allegedly slapped two blind men and broke their walking stick after they asked him for directions. The constable was not in uniform and was wearing plain clothes when the alleged incident took place, reports said. The victims raised an alarm after which a case was registered against him by the Triplicane Police Station.

title: SRH become first team to win four matches in a row in IPL 2022, defeat PBKS
body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) have become the first team to win four matches in a row in IPL 2022. SRH defeated PBKS by seven wickets to move to the fourth position on the points table. Aiden Markram and Nicholas Pooran registered an unbeaten 75-run partnership to help SRH chase down the 152-run target in 18.5 overs.

title: I said, 'If I perform, everything will fall into place': Suryakumar on IPL 2020 match vs RCB
body: Recalling his unbeaten 79-run innings against RCB in IPL 2020, MI batter Suryakumar Yadav said he was disappointed prior to the match as he wasn't picked in India squad. "When I went in to bat, the target was in front of me. I said to myself, 'If I perform here, everything else will fall into place'," he added.

title: I didn't see a screenplay in 'Beast': Vijay's father SA Chandrasekhar
body: Talking about his son and actor Vijay's film 'Beast', director SA Chandrasekhar said he couldn't see a screenplay in the movie, adding that the film was made "solely" on Vijay's stardom. "The magic is there in the screenplay. You can't lightly handle a very heavy subject which is about international terrorist organisations. The director has to...study it," added Chandrasekhar.

title: SRK & Shehnaaz hug each other at Baba Siddique's Iftar party, video surfaces
body: Indian politician Baba Siddique hosted an annual Iftaar party at Hotel Taj Lands End in Mumbai's Bandra which was attended by several celebrities. Recently a video has surfaced online where Shehnaaz was all smiles as she hugged actor Shah Rukh Khan. For the party, Shehnaaz opted to wear a light grey Patiala suit along with matching jhumkas.

title: Which are the world's most affordable and least affordable cities to buy home?
body: The US city of Pittsburgh is the most affordable city for buying a house, according to the Demographia International Housing Affordability's study on housing prices for 92 major markets (metropolitan areas). It's followed by Oklahoma City and Rochester in the US, Edmonton in Canada and St. Louis in the US. Hong Kong emerged as the least affordable city for housing.

title: Anguished by the tragic accident in Jhunjhunu: PM Narendra Modi
body: PM Narendra Modi expressed anguish and offered condolences over the road accident in Jhunjhunu, Rajasthan, where 11 members of a family were killed and several others injured after a jeep rammed into a tractor trolley. PM Modi tweeted, "₹2 lakh each from PMNRF would be given to the next of family of the deceased. The injured would be given ₹50,000."

title: Talks with Putin stalled over mass killings in Ukraine: Macron
body: French President Emmanuel Macron said that his talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the Ukraine war have stalled. "Since the massacres we have discovered in Bucha and in other towns, the war has taken a different turn, so I did not speak to him again directly since, but I don't rule out doing so in the future", Macron said.

title: I haven't replied to Congress' show-cause notice: Sunil Jakhar
body: Ex-Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar on Monday said he hasn't replied to the show-cause notice issued to him by the Congress disciplinary committee. The notice was issued on April 11 for going against "party line" and using "objectionable words" for the Dalit community. Jakhar has denied making any statement against the community saying his remarks were put "out of context".

title: Video shows thieves hitting woman with their car as she flees robbery in US
body: The US police have released a video that captured the moment when a woman, who was escaping from a robbery attempt, was hit by a car driven by thieves. It showed the accused jumping out of the car to snatch her watch after hitting her with their car. She was being followed after she left a jewellery store, police added.

title: 18-yr-old boxer Ali Tazeem, dubbed 'next Amir Khan', passes away in car accident in UK
body: UK's 18-year-old boxer Ali Tazeem, dubbed the 'next Amir Khan', passed away in a car accident. Tazeem had signed his professional contract with Probellum three weeks ago. Tazeem won 15 gold medals from 51 bouts as an amateur. "The skill-set he has...the movement...everything...reminds me of myself when I was younger," boxer Amir Khan had said about Ali.

title: European Commission Prez to arrive on 2-day visit to India from Apr 24
body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will arrive on a two-day visit to India from April 24, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) said. She is scheduled to meet President Ram Nath Kovind and PM Narendra Modi during her first official visit.  She has been invited as the Chief Guest for this year's Raisina Dialogue, the MEA added.

title: Malaika returns to work after car accident, says 'feels good to be back'
body: Malaika Arora, who met with an accident on Mumbai-Pune highway earlier this month, shared on Monday that she has returned to work. Malaika, taking to Instagram Stories, shared a picture from a set, writing, "Feels good to be back on set." Malaika got into a car accident on April 2, following which she was taken to Apollo Hospital for treatment.

title: TV actor Vivian to marry ex-journalist from Egypt, 5 years after his split with Vahbiz
body: TV actor Vivian Dsena has revealed that he is planning to tie the knot with Nouran Aly, a former journalist from Egypt. "We first interacted around four-and-a-half years ago, when she contacted me for an interview," Vivian said. Vivian was earlier married to TV actress Vahbiz Dorabjee. They split five years ago and finalised their divorce in December 2021.

title: While keeping, he once said 'Do you want chai, samosa?': Suryakumar on Pant's antics
body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's antics behind the stumps, Suryakumar Yadav revealed that once he was fielding in place of Cheteshwar Pujara during a Test against England last year. "I was thinking, 'It's my first time on the field wearing whites.'...The match situation was incredibly tight. Pant suddenly said, 'Do you want some chai, samosas? Do you want anything?'" Suryakumar said.

title: Yemen's Houthi rebels agree to stop using child soldiers: UN
body: Yemen's Houthi rebels have agreed to stop using child soldiers in armed conflicts, the United Nations has said. A UN official said that the rebels agreed to identify and release children from their ranks within six months. The action plan, which the UN said Houthis signed, also calls for preventing violence against children and attacks on hospitals and schools.

title: Met Salman as kid; he was eating from tandoor, mom made us stand with him: Neha
body: Singer Neha Bhasin said that she first met actor Salman Khan when she was a child. In an interview with Bollywood Hungama, she said that she has picture of the meeting and that Salman was standing near a tandoor and eating something from it. "My mom made us stand with him. Me and my sister were looking silly," she added.

title: Stunning partnership: Raina on Ruturaj, Rayudu adding 92 runs vs GT
body: Ex-CSK batter Suresh Raina took to Twitter to praise CSK batters Ruturaj Gaikwad and Ambati Rayudu for adding 92 runs for the third wicket against GT. Raina also congratulated Rayudu for crossing the 4000-run mark in the IPL. "It was so great to see such a stunning partnership," he tweeted. Ruturaj smashed 73(48) while Rayudu scored 46(31) in the game.

title: Temple shut to prevent groom's entry in MP: Scheduled Caste body
body: A Scheduled Caste organisation on Monday claimed that "influential people" had closed a temple in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain to prevent the entry of a groom, who's a police constable. However, a police officer said that the Rajput community submitted documents claiming they had built the temple and it was closed due to the priest's family member's death.

title: LV Vaidyanathan, who joined P&G as an intern, appointed India CEO
body: Consumer goods company Procter & Gamble (P&G) on Tuesday announced that it has appointed LV Vaidyanathan as the CEO for its operations in India. Vaidyanathan is an alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad and had joined P&G as an intern in 1995. The 49-year-old is currently leading the P&G business in Indonesia. Vaidyanathan succeeds Madhusudan Gopalan, who'll move to a global role.

title: Akash Singh wins 'Hunarbaaz...' trophy, ₹15 lakh prize; says 'it feels surreal'
body: Akash Singh has become the first winner of 'Hunarbaaz Desh Ki Shaan' and bagged a trophy and cash prize of ₹15 lakh. Speaking about winning the show, Akash said, "I can't find the words to express the emotions...I'm going through, and it...feels so surreal!" "I want to thank my family and friends for...supporting me in this life-changing journey," he added.

title: Amazon, Reliance, Dream11 & Sony may compete for IPL broadcast rights: Report
body: Amazon, The Walt Disney Company and Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries are among the companies that have signalled an intention to bid for the rights to telecast IPL matches to be held between 2023 and 2027, Bloomberg reported. Sony, Zee and Dream11 also purchased the bid-related documents from BCCI, it added. BCCI will be conducting the online auction starting June 12.

title: Wore loose clothes to hide baby bump; now I'm open about it: Sonam on pregnancy
body: Actress Sonam Kapoor revealed that she tried to hide her baby bump at the beginning of her pregnancy. "I was trying to hide it because it was like a situation where I am still." "Now I am...being more open about it, but first I was trying to hide it, so I was wearing all these loose clothes," she added.

title: Kiara Advani visits the Golden Temple as she shoots for her film RC 15
body: Kiara Advani, who's currently shooting for her upcoming film 'RC 15', in Amritsar recently shared a post from her visit to the Golden Temple. Taking to Instagram, Kiara shared two pictures of herself standing with her hands folded in front of the shrine. The actress donned a white kurta paired with a yellow dupatta. Alongside the post, she wrote, "Gratitude."

title: Video shows swords raised amid Hanuman Jayanti rally in Delhi's Jahangirpuri
body: Amid a probe into the Jahangirpuri violence, a video has shown people brandishing swords, pistols and shotguns amid the Hanuman Jayanti rally. The video was reportedly taken while the rally was in C-D Block Market in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where several people were injured following stone-pelting.  Police had earlier confirmed the presence of illegal weapons during the rally.

title: Boy addicted to games kills self as father fails to recharge internet in MP
body: A 14-year-old boy allegedly hanged himself from the ceiling fan of his home after his father, who works as a labourer, was unable to recharge his mobile internet in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. Police said the man was facing financial problems. The boy was addicted to playing games on the mobile phone, City Superintendent of Police (CSP) Alok Sharma said.

title: People throw coins in theatre during 'KGF: Chapter 2' screening, Raveena shares video
body: Actress Raveena Tandon on Tuesday took to social media to share a clip of people throwing coins in a theatre screening 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "After a long time seeing coins flying on to the screen! #flashingsilver!" she wrote in the caption. "It's a rage...Thank you for the love," Raveena's post further read.

title: Delhi Capitals' Mitchell Marsh admitted to hospital after testing COVID-19 positive
body: Delhi Capitals all-rounder Mitchell Marsh has been admitted to hospital after testing COVID-19 positive, the IPL franchise said in a statement. "A few more members from the Delhi Capitals bio-bubble, including support staff members, have returned positive tests as well. Though they are all asymptomatic, their condition is being monitored closely by the franchise," the statement further read.

title: Waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers: SC tells banks
body: The Supreme Court has directed banks to waive penalties against Amrapali homebuyers with outstanding loans and standardise their accounts. "No penalty will be charged from the homebuyers by banks since the default was on part of the builder and not by the buyers," the bench said. In 2019, the court cancelled the registration of Amrapali Group for defrauding homebuyers.

title: MI's Rohit has failed to use India captaincy to up his game: Vaughan
body: Ex-England skipper Michael Vaughan has opined that Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma has "failed" to use his confidence from India captaincy to help "his game to go really up into the sky." This comes after Rohit's Mumbai suffered six consecutive defeats in the ongoing IPL 2022. Rohit has scored 114 runs in six games so far, averaging 19.

title: 1984 a dark chapter in Indian history: Vivek Agnihotri on 'The Delhi Files'
body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'The Delhi Files', filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri stated that the year 1984 is a dark chapter in Indian history. He further said the way the Punjab terrorism situation was handled was inhuman, adding that it was purely for vote bank politics. "To date there has been no justice, what can be worse than that," Vivek said.

title: Brain-dead patient's kidneys, lungs and liver donated to save 4 lives in Mumbai
body: The kidneys, lungs and liver of a critical patient of CritiCare Asia Multi-Specialty Hospital in Mumbai were donated, which saved the lives of four other persons. The patient's organs were transplanted to other hospitals in the city. The family members of the donor, who was declared brain-dead on March 26, were counselled to opt for organ donation.

title: PM inaugurates new dairy complex, potato processing plant in Gujarat
body: PM Narendra Modi today inaugurated a new dairy complex and a potato processing plant, which is built at a cost of over ₹600 crore, at Banas Dairy in Gujarat's Banaskantha district. "Initiatives at Banas Dairy will empower farmers and boost...rural economy," PM tweeted. The dairy complex will enable the processing of about 30 lakh litres of milk daily, PMO stated.

title: Gang of car thieves busted in Ferozepur, 2 members arrested
body: A gang of car thieves was busted in Ferozepur with the arrest of two of its members and the recovery of two stolen cars and a firearm. "Following a tip-off, the police team intercepted the accused in a car and recovered a .32-bore weapon along with two of its magazines and 10 cartridges," Ferozepur SSP, Charanjit Singh, said.

title: Raghav gets legal notice for calling BJP 'Gundon-Lafangon ki party'
body: Punjab Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha leader Ashok Sareen sent a legal notice to AAP leader Raghav Chadha on Sunday for calling BJP "Gundon ki, Lafangon ki party" and "Bharat ki Zahil Party". The notice demanded that Chadha issue a written apology to Sareen and BJP within three days, failing which a civil and criminal complaint would be filed against him.

title: Robbers throw chilli powder, loot ₹1 crore from cash van at gunpoint in Gurugram
body: Around four-five armed robbers looted ₹1 crore from a van of a cash-collection company in Gurugram's Subhash Chowk area in broad daylight, said police. The accused allegedly threw chilli powder on the eyes of the guard and the van's driver and held them hostage at gunpoint. The guard told police that they had collected the money from 10 business establishments.

title: 'Coolie No. 1' actor Rajat Rawail hospitalised over varicose vein rupture
body: Varun Dhawan-starrer 2020 film 'Coolie No. 1' actor Rajat Rawail has been hospitalised following excessive loss of blood due to a rupture of a varicose vein in his right leg. Rajat was admitted to a hospital in Mumbai over the weekend, reported ETimes. The actor said that he has been advised total bed rest with no visitors.

title: Ravindra Jadeja gets angry at Shivam Dube over fielding, video goes viral
body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja got angry at Shivam Dube after he didn't attempt GT batter David Miller's catch in their IPL 2022 encounter on Sunday. Dube was fielding at deep mid-wicket in the 17th over bowled by Dwayne Bravo when Miller lofted the ball towards him. Jadeja almost threw his cap in anger as Dube didn't go for the catch.

title: HDFC no longer among India's top 10 most valuable companies
body: India's largest housing finance company HDFC Ltd is no longer among the top 10 most valuable companies of India in terms of market capitalisation. The shares of HDFC have plunged nearly 19% after the announcement of its merger with HDFC Bank earlier this month. Meanwhile, HDFC Bank is the third most valuable company of India after Reliance Industries and TCS.

title: Cong's 3-day 'Chintan Shivir' likely to be held in Raj from May 14
body: Congress' three-day 'Chintan Shivir' is likely to be held in Rajasthan's Jaipur from May 14 onwards, sources said on Monday. Around 400 party leaders are expected to gather at meeting, which will focus on party's poll results in recently-held Assembly elections in five states. Notably, Rahul Gandhi was made party's Vice-President at Congress' last 'Chintan Shivir' in Jaipur in 2013.

title: 10 dead, 8 injured in road crash in Rajasthan, CM expresses grief
body: Ten members of a family were killed after the jeep they were travelling in crashed with a parked tractor trolley in Rajasthan's Jhunjhunu district on Tuesday. Eight others were also injured in the crash which took place on the Jhunjhunu-Gudha Godji highway in the afternoon, police said. CM Ashok Gehlot has expressed his deepest condolences over the incident.

title: Hubballi rioters will be tried as per existing law: Karnataka CM
body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai has said that those involved in the Hubballi riots will be tried as per the existing laws in the state. "When riots took place in Uttar Pradesh, certain action was taken according to the situation prevailing over there. We are reviewing the situation in Karnataka. We will go by our law," Bommai said.

title: MP govt allots ₹1 cr aid for those affected during Khargone violence
body: Madhya Pradesh government has allotted ₹1 crore for providing relief to the people affected by the communal violence in Khargone. The financial assistance will be provided as per a survey conducted by the district administration, an official said. Stones were hurled during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone, which led to incidents of arson and communal clashes.

title: Hyderabad police arrest 7 people, seize 190 kg of ganja
body: Hyderabad's Meerpet police have arrested seven people for allegedly smuggling drugs and seized 190 kg of ganja from their possession, the police said on Monday. The prime accused had also been previously jailed for transporting drugs, the police added. The arrest was made after police intercepted a car, carrying 64 packets of ganja, during checking, the police further said.

title: Ukraine shifting stance, inconsistent during peace talks: Russia
body: Russia said that Ukraine is "changing its position" on issues previously agreed upon at talks between the two sides and "the trend of the negotiating process leaves much to be desired". "The Ukrainian side isn't consistent in terms of the points that have been agreed," Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said. However, Peskov said that "contacts continue at an expert level".

title: Ranveer stands on table, raps 'Apna Time Aayega' at Delhi wedding
body: Actor Ranveer Singh attended a wedding in Delhi and stood on a table while rapping his song 'Apna Time Aayega' from 2019 film 'Gully Boy'. In another video, Ranveer wore a red coat while rapping as wedding guests danced around him. The pictures and videos were shared on Instagram Stories by fashion designer and influencer Tarini Manchanda.

title: No need to panic for now: Sisodia amid rising COVID-19 cases in Delhi
body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said that there is no need to panic for now, adding that "we'll have to learn to live with COVID-19 as it'll stay in some capacity". Sisodia added the Delhi government will take strict action if COVID-19 cases increase more. DDMA will hold a meeting tomorrow over the same.

title: Brainless trolls, stop digging out old matters: Himanshi Khurana
body: Actress Himanshi Khurana on Tuesday shared a statement on social media asking the media to "stop digging out old matters" and letting "bygones be bygones". She added that doing so instigates conversations among "brainless trolls" who then "rip through someone's reputation". This comes after a media portal shared an article on an old controversy between Himanshi and actress Shehnaaz Gill.

title: I back my yorkers, bowl with 100% effort even in practice sessions: Avesh
body: Disclosing reason behind his successful yorkers during death overs in IPL 2022, LSG pacer Avesh Khan said he backs his yorkers in practice sessions and bowls with 100% effort even there. "If you miss the yorker, then...batter has a good chance to hit the ball for a boundary," he added. Avesh has taken 11 wickets from six matches so far.

title: Power crisis in Maharashtra due to mismanagement of MVA govt: BJP leader
body: BJP leader Girish Mahajan alleged that power crisis in Maharashtra was caused due to "mismanagement" of the MVA government and the previous Devendra Fadnavis-led government ensured the state did not face load-shedding even for a day. "An artificial power shortage is being created, then electricity is bought at higher rates to earn commission, cuts," the BJP leader added.

title: VHP’s Surendra Jain seeks NIA probe into Jahangirpuri violence
body: VHP’s Surendra Jain has demanded a probe by the NIA into the Jahangirpuri violence that took place in Delhi on Hanuman Jayanti. "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has become the sleeper cell of terrorists today. My demand is from the Central government that an investigation should be done by the NIA because it involves the issue of national security," Jain added.

title: NCP MP Amol Kolhe dances at staffer's wedding in Pune, video surfaces
body: A video has surfaced that shows Nationalist Congress Party MP Amol Kolhe dancing on dhol beats at a wedding ceremony in Pune district of Maharashtra. Kolhe was reportedly dancing at the wedding of his staffer Tejas Zodage in Narayangaon. The Member of Parliament was wearing a white ethnic attire on the occasion.

title: PPCB to penalise Ludhiana civic body for 'failing' to manage solid waste
body: The Punjab Pollution Control Board (PPCB) on Monday said it will penalise the Ludhiana civic body for its "failure" to manage the city’s solid waste. This comes after fire incidents were reported at the municipal corporation’s primary dumping ground on Tajpur Road for four consecutive days. The PPCB officials observed that the issue was resulting in air and water pollution.

title: I thought he is possibly at the end of his career, he surprised us all: ABD on Karthik
body: Talking about RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, who has scored 197 runs in IPL 2022 at an average of 197 and a strike rate of 209.57, AB de Villiers said, "The last time I saw him before IPL he was commentating in the UK." He added, "I thought he is possibly at the end of his career...but he surprised us all."

title: Was never influenced by Salman Khan: 'Tere Naam' co-star Bhumika
body: Actress Bhumika Chawla, speaking about her 'Tere Naam' co-star Salman Khan, has said that she was never influenced by him "in any such manner". Bhumika added, "Salman has changed a lot, I see so much difference." "From what I hear...[Salman has] seen a kind of good growth in him as a person and even as an artist," she further stated.

title: Destroyed foreign weapons stored near Ukraine's Lviv city: Russia
body: Russia carried out airstrikes at a logistics centre of the Ukrainian Army near Lviv city and destroyed large quantities of foreign weapons stored there, Russia's Defence Ministry said. The weapons had entered Ukraine in the last six days from America and European nations, it added. In total, 16 Ukrainian military sites were destroyed by Russia on Monday, it further said.

title: Which cricketers from inaugural IPL match 14 years ago are still playing in IPL?
body: The first-ever IPL match took place on April 18, 2008 between KKR and RCB. KKR were led by Sourav Ganguly, while RCB were captained by Rahul Dravid. Virat Kohli and Wriddhiman Saha, who are playing in IPL 2022, also featured in the first-ever IPL match. Saha, who made his GT debut on Sunday, represented KKR in the inaugural match.

title: MI is a team of comebacks, expect them to finish strong: Malinga
body: After Mumbai Indians registered its sixth straight loss in the IPL 2022 on Saturday, former MI pacer Lasith Malinga has said that the franchise has "always been a team of comebacks". "Whether or not they get through to the playoffs...expect them to have a strong finish to the season," said Malinga, who is now the fast-bowling coach of Rajasthan Royals.

title: 90 rounds fired at party at US Airbnb rental; 2 dead, 8 injured
body: Two teenagers were killed and at least eight people were wounded after gunfire erupted on Sunday at a party in Pittsburgh at an Airbnb rental with as many as 200 people in attendance. As many as 90 rounds were fired inside and outside of the property. Several people jumped out of the windows, sustaining injuries such as broken bones.

title: War-disabled soldiers must be treated with respect: Ex-VC of Army
body: Lieutenant General Vijay Oberoi (retd), former Vice-Chief of Army Staff, has demanded better treatment of war-disabled soldiers. He stated that they must be treated "with great respect and should be adequately compensated", otherwise as soldiers take a "conscious decision" to go to war, the future generation will think twice before risking their lives in service of the nation.

title: Who is India's new Army chief Lieutenant General Manoj Pande?
body: Lieutenant General Manoj Pande will take charge as the 29th chief of the Army Staff in India. An alumnus of the National Defence Academy, Khadakwasla and the Indian Military Academy, Dehradun, Pande has a military career spanning nearly 40 years. He has commanded an engineer brigade along the LoC in J&K during Operation Parakram (during the 2001-2002 India-Pakistan standoff).

title: Fan's 'marriage proposal' poster for KKR captain Shreyas Iyer goes viral
body: A picture of a fan carrying a 'marriage proposal' poster for KKR captain Shreyas Iyer ahead of KKR-RR match has gone viral. "My mom has asked me to find a guy. So, will you marry me, Shreyas Iyer?" the poster read. Sharing the picture, KKR wrote, "That's one way of shooting your shot!"

title: Man asks Hyd Police to allow guests in wedding, says 'food will be wasted'
body: A Twitter user shared a picture from his wedding and said that the Hyderabad Police were stopping guests "for some reason". "We have invited 700 people for our wedding happening now in Vedika convention centre, Jal Vihar...Kindly allow us to perform our wedding and [let] the guests enter and bless the couple else the food will be wasted," tweet read.

title: I knew in my mind I had to take wickets to change game: Chahal on hat-trick
body: RR spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said he knew he had to take wickets in the 17th over against KKR to change the momentum of the game. Chasing RR's 218-run target, KKR were 178/4 after 16 overs when Chahal came and picked four wickets, including a hat-trick. "Would've been happy with a dot ball as well on my hat-trick ball," added Chahal.

title: Bhushan Kumar's attempts show his thirst to get rid of rape case: Mumbai court
body: A Mumbai magistrate's court said producer Bhushan Kumar, who was accused in a rape case, has "no locus standi to address...court but he has attempted to contest the matter which is...unethical". "His attempts show his...thirst to get rid of the matter," the court said. It rejected police's closure report and directed them to probe the matter as per law.

title: What is the state-wise active COVID-19 case tally as daily cases jump nearly 90%?
body: India recorded 2,183 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, an 89.8% jump from 1,150 cases reported a day before. In terms of active COVID-19 cases, Kerala has 2,466 cases, Delhi has 1,518, Karnataka has 1,506 and Assam has 1,349. While Haryana has 911 active cases, it is followed by Maharashtra with 646 cases and Uttar Pradesh with 610 cases.

title: Prince Narula to enter Kangana Ranaut's show 'Lock Upp'
body: Prince Narula is all set to enter Kangana Ranaut-hosted show 'Lock Upp'. The actor, who had earlier won 'Bigg Boss 9' and 'Roadies 12', said, "I am entering the show as a troublemaker and not a contestant." "I am very excited. Lock Upp is a different show...My main reason to enter this show is that it is judgment-free," Prince added.

title: Like all parents, we feel very nervous: Madhavan as son wins silver in Danish Open
body: Actor R Madhavan tweeted, "We feel proud, overwhelmed, very grateful and like all parents, very nervous," after his 16-year-old son Vedaant Madhavan bagged the silver medal in the men's 1500m freestyle swimming event at Danish Open in Copenhagen. The actor was responding to filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's tweet, who congratulated Vedaant and asked R Madhavan, "How does it feel?"

title: ₹5,500 got over in 10 days, survived due to shoot for ₹2000-3000 per day: Sonu
body: Actor Sonu Sood recalled that he came to Mumbai with ₹5,500, using which, he thought he would survive a month. He said that the money got over in 10 days and that he thought he would have to ask for money from home. "I got a shoot for ₹2000-3000 per day so I could survive that journey," he added.

title: Set an example so incidents like Jahangirpuri aren't repeated: Shah to Police
body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday directed Delhi Police officials to take strict action against perpetrators of the Jahangirpuri violence. The action should be such that it sets a precedent so that such incidents are not repeated, Shah told the police officials. Over 20 people have been arrested in connection to the incident that took place on Saturday.

title: Sensex crashes 1,000 points in early trade, Nifty below 17,200
body: The Sensex tanked over 1,000 points in early trade on Monday while the NSE Nifty 50 dipped below 17,200 amid weak global cues. The indices reopened on April 18 after a gap of four straight days on account of public holidays. Infosys and HDFC Bank tanked 6% and 2.4% respectively, on account of their Q4 earnings.

title: Restored hope in justice system: SKM as SC cancels Ashish Mishra's bail
body: Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) on Monday said that Supreme Court has "restored hope in the justice system" by cancelling Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra's bail in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. SMK added that now Teni should be "sacked from the post of minister", failing which it'll hold a national meeting and announce a nationwide protest programme.

title: Sonu Sood pens note for his father on his birth anniversary
body: Actor Sonu Sood on Sunday took to Instagram to pen a note for his late father on his birth anniversary. The actor wrote, "Like I always used to say there is no life without you and this I realise every second of my life. Wish you were around to guide us...Be with us till I see you again."

title: Instagram influencer trolls Katrina's cooking skills, she replies
body: Days after actress Katrina Kaif posted a picture of breakfast she prepared for her husband Vicky Kaushal, Instagram influencer Freddy Birdy took to Instagram Stories to troll her. He posted a series of 'easy recipes' for her to create including chilly cheese toast, boiled eggs and mango pickle. Katrina replied to one of the stories, writing, "This is not easy."

title: Vande Bharat Express trains to run between Khajuraho and Delhi
body: The Vande Bharat Express train will operate between Khajuraho and Delhi soon, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has announced. He said, "Two rake points have been approved at Chhatarpur and Khajuraho. Rail tickets can now be obtained from 45,000 post offices". Vaishnaw, who was on a visit to Khajuraho, further said that after redevelopment, Khajuraho will become a world-class station.

title: B'luru teen gets 36 stitches as 2 men stab him after failed robbery attempt
body: A 16-year-old boy received 36 stitches after two bike-borne men stabbed him after a failed robbery attempt in Bengaluru. The  robbers were following the victim when he was returning home from an eatery. They stopped boy to ask for his valuables. When he denied having anything, robbers forcefully stripped him. When the boy resisted, they stabbed him and ran away.

title: Scientists name new millipede species Nannaria swiftae after Taylor Swift
body: Scientists have discovered 17 new species of millipedes living in Appalachian Mountains of the US and named one of them Nannaria swiftae after singer-songwriter Taylor Swift. As per the scientists, the species is named after Taylor "in recognition of her talent as a songwriter and performer and in appreciation of the enjoyment her music has brought [scientist Derek Hennen]".

title: Massive fire breaks out at plastic factory in Ludhiana, 2 severely injured
body: A massive fire broke out at a plastic factory in Ludhiana on Monday evening and two labourers, aged 18 and 40, were severely injured, officials said. The victims had suffered third-degree burns on their face, chest and legs, a hospital's deputy medical superintendent said. "It took around half an hour to bring the flames under control," an official added.

title: Losing 'iconic' Monaco Grand Prix would be a 'shocker': Pierre Gasly
body: AlphaTauri's Pierre Gasly said losing the "iconic" Monaco Grand Prix would be a "shocker". "I think, and I really hope, we get to experience it as drivers because it's probably the toughest track of the season, the most challenging, and is my favourite one," Gasly said. The Monaco circuit has been a permanent fixture of the F1 calendar since 1955.

title: Japan fast food chain fires MD for saying 'get virgins' addicted to their food
body: Japan's fast-food chain Yoshinoya, known for its inexpensive bowls of beef on rice, has fired its managing director over his alleged derogatory remarks toward women. Masaki Ito during a university lecture apparently said that the company should try to "get virgins addicted" to Yoshinoya’s food because "once men treat them to expensive meals they won't eat beef bowls anymore".

title: Police share picture of oldest Mumbai police station, say it's 162 yrs old
body: Mumbai Police took to Twitter to share the picture of Pydhonie, the oldest police station in Mumbai. "With its stone facade and iron railing arch balconies on every floor, this 162-year-old police station has indeed bore witness to history," police wrote on Twitter. Pictures of other police stations along with their establishment details were also shared.

title: That feels very proud too: Madhavan on being called Vedaant's father
body: Actor R Madhavan on Tuesday responded to writer Anand Ranganathan's tweet about his upcoming film 'Rocketry' referring to him as Vedaant Madhavan's father. The actor wrote, "Somehow that felt very proud too. Thank you chief." Vedaant won gold medal in the men's 800m freestyle event and silver medal in the 1500m freestyle swimming event at the Danish Open in Copenhagen.

title: We didn't capitalise on what was a very good base while batting: Fleming
body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said they couldn't capitalise in the last five overs while batting against GT on Sunday. Fleming added, "Two contributing factors [towards our defeat] were outstanding innings from David Miller and a very good cameo from Rashid Khan." He further said, "It's a hard one...we were in control...so, losing from there is very hard."

title: FIR not an encyclopedia of events: SC on HC granting bail to Ashish Mishra
body: The Supreme Court has cancelled the bail granted to Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra in the Lakhimpur case. Referring to Allahabad High Court's earlier order which granted bail to Ashish, it said, "FIR cannot be treated as an encyclopedia of events. Judicial precedents were ignored." It also said victims were denied the chance of an effective hearing.

title: 3 explosions hit school in Afghanistan
body: Three explosions hit a school in Afghanistan's Kabul on Tuesday, killing several people, according to Afghan security and health officials. There was no immediate claim of responsibility for the attack. Many residents in the neighbourhood belong to the Shia Hazara community, an ethnic and religious minority frequently targeted by Sunni militant groups, including Islamic State.

title: Ukraine shoots down $15 mn Russian helicopter with $100 missile system
body: Ukrainian troops shot down a $15 million Russian Ka-52 helicopter by using an air defence missile system worth $100. As per a post shared by the Ukrainian military unit Operational Command 'East', the military unit used an 'Igla', a portable surface-to-air missile (SAM) system that was developed by the Soviet Union. They also shared pictures of the crash site.

title: 6 killed, several injured as bus crashes into SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria
body: Six people died and several others were left injured after a collision between an SUV and a bus in Uttar Pradesh's Deoria on Monday late night. The incident took place when the SUV carrying passengers was returning from a Tilak ceremony. "The bus came from the opposite direction and rammed into the vehicle," Deoria Superintendent of Police Shripati Mishra said.

title: 13,964 posts removed due to increasing communal tension: Mumbai Police
body: Around 13,964 social media posts have been deleted in the last four months due to an increase in communal tension and violence in the country, the Mumbai Police said. The special branch of Mumbai Police deleted 5,754 posts in January, 4,252 posts in February and 3,958 social media posts in March.

title: 5 accused in Jahangirpuri violence charged under National Security Act: Reports
body: Five accused in Jahangirpuri violence have been reportedly charged under the stringent National Security Act, which allows detention for up to one year without any charge. Clashes broke out during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in North West Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Saturday. Police had said that stones were pelted and several vehicles were set ablaze during the clashes.

title: 20 injured after bus overturns in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar
body: A bus returning from a marriage party overturned on the Khuria Rahatgarh road in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Monday. According to the police, at least 20 passengers got injured after the bus skidded off the road. The bus, which was returning to Kesli, overturned after its driver, who later fled the spot, dozed off while driving, police said.

title: I actually wanted to quit tennis: 2019 US Open champion Andreescu
body: 2019 US Open champion Bianca Andreescu has revealed she "wanted to quit" tennis before taking a break from tennis earlier this year due to mental health concerns. "It was really bad. I'm privileged in a way for having this opportunity...doing all of this," she added. This week's Porsche Tennis Grand Prix is the 21-year-old's first tournament of the 2022 season.

title: Ex-Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora joins TMC after quitting Congress
body: Former Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora on Sunday quit the party and joined TMC in presence of MP Abhishek Banerjee. While tendering his resignation, Bora said, "Instead of fighting against BJP, a section of senior...leaders of Assam Congress have been maintaining secret understanding with BJP government especially the CM." He added, "I shall continue my fight more vigorously against BJP."

title: It started in my 30s: Jennifer Aniston on battling insomnia
body: Actress Jennifer Aniston has revealed that she battles with insomnia and said that it started in her 30s. "I dread spending another night counting cracks in the walls...And the more I worry about it [sleeping]...harder it is to fall asleep," she told the People magazine. Jennifer further said she used to sleepwalk, however, added she doesn't do it anymore.

title: If RR can get it, we can get it as well, that's how I was thinking: Shreyas
body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said they were going well when they started chasing RR's 218-run target. "Once Finch [got] out, we slowed down a bit...I wanted to set an example, doesn't matter whatever score they get. If they can get it, I can get it as well. That's how I was thinking," he added. KKR lost by seven runs.

title: Go First flight to Delhi stopped at Srinagar airport after bomb call
body: A Go First flight was halted at the Srinagar airport on Monday after a manager of another airline received a call about a bomb on board, PTI reported. The flight was headed for New Delhi. Inspector General of Police Vijay Kumar said the plane was searched but no explosives were found, adding that the incident was being investigated.

title: Bengaluru records 51 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 2.91%
body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 51 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). With 39 new recoveries, the active cases in the city now stand at 1,403. According to official data, the daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Bengaluru increased to 2.91% as compared to 1.48% reported on Sunday.

title: Twitter's edit feature may retain copy of original tweet
body: Twitter's edit button feature may preserve the previous versions of a tweet. According to security researcher Jane Manchun Wong, Twitter's approach to the edit button is "immutable” as it will preserve a copy of the original tweet, along with a list of prior conversations and tag the new tweet as "amended content". However, Twitter is yet to confirm this.

title: India records 1,247 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death; active cases at 11,860
body: India has reported 1,247 new COVID-19 cases and one death in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country saw 2,183 cases and 214 deaths. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,860, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,966.
