title: Punjab women's college management suspended over ₹11 cr funds misuse
body: The management of Punjab's Akal Degree College for Women has been placed under suspension by the state government over the alleged misuse of funds amounting to ₹11.86 crore. A probe by the state higher education department reportedly found that the managing committee of the Sangrur college had transferred the amount to another college and used it to start self-finance courses.

title: Security stepped up post incidents of violence in Haridwar
body: Heavy security was deployed across Haridwar following the incident of violence and stone-pelting in the Bhagwanpur area of the city on Saturday. "Stones were pelted by unknown persons and the search operations have begun to arrest the miscreants. Yes, injuries have been reported but no police personnel was injured in the incident," Senior Superintendent of Police (Haridwar) Yogendra Singh Rawat.

title: US President Joe Biden should come to Ukraine: President Zelenskyy
body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said US President Joe Biden "should come" to visit Ukraine. "It's his decision of course and they must consider the safety situation. But I think he's the leader of the United States and that's why he should come here to see," Zelenskyy said. The White House has since stated Biden has "no plans" to visit Ukraine.

title: Netherlands head coach Ryan Campbell in induced coma following heart attack
body: Netherlands head coach and ex-Australia wicketkeeper Ryan Campbell is in induced coma in ICU in UK after suffering a heart attack. The 50-year-old was at a playground with his children when he collapsed. "[We're] in shock to hear of Ryan's medical emergency after suffering a major heart attack over the long weekend," Western Australian Cricket Association CEO Christina Matthews said.

title: Russia, Vietnam plan joint military drills
body: Russia's Eastern Military District has said that the country will hold joint military drills with Vietnam. A meeting was held between the representatives of both countries in this regard. "In the course of the talks, the two parties agreed on the agenda for the upcoming military drills, specifying deadlines and a venue for holding the drills," said Eastern Military District.

title: Main accused in Jahangirpuri violence a BJP leader: AAP MLA Atishi
body: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Atishi on Tuesday alleged that the main accused in Jahangirpuri violence, Ansar, is a BJP leader. "It is clear that the BJP is behind the Jahangirpuri riots and it should apologise to the people of Delhi. BJP is a party of hooligans," AAP's Atishi said in a tweet.

title: Did well in 1st 6 overs, but failed to execute plans in last 5 vs GT: Jadeja
body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said they failed to execute their plans in the last five overs while defending their 169-run total against GT on Sunday. "We started brilliantly...we did well in the first 6 overs...I thought Chris Jordan could execute his yorkers [in the final over]...but he couldn't do so," stated Jadeja. CSK lost the match by three wickets.

title: Action to be taken without bias: Delhi Police Commissioner on Jahangirpuri violence
body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Monday said that action will be taken without bias against all those found to be involved in the communal clashes in Jahangirpuri. "We will take action against whomever evidence of involvement is found during the investigation, irrespective of religion, creed, caste and community," Asthana said.

title: Thief dances after robbing hardware store in UP, CCTV footage goes viral
body: A person robbing a hardware store in UP's Chandauli was caught dancing after committing the crime. CCTV footage of the incident that took place on Friday night has gone viral online. It shows the thief's face covered with a white cloth and he's seen dancing while facing the CCTV camera before escaping through the store's shutter.

title: Facing Umran Malik in nets is a nightmare: SRH batter Glenn Phillips
body: SRH batter Glenn Phillips said facing his teammate Umran Malik in the nets is a nightmare for him. "I've got my chest guard on (during net sessions) to not get hurt. Imagine what those balls (in the game) will be feeling out there," Glenn added. The pacer has scalped nine wickets in six games in IPL 2022 so far.

title: Police shoot 3 after riots break out over Quran burning in Sweden
body: Three people were shot and injured by police in Sweden's Norrkoping city after riots broke out following reports of burning of the Quran by a politician. "Three people seem to have been hit by ricochets and are now being cared for in hospital. All three injured are arrested on suspicion of crime," said police, adding, the injuries were not life-threatening.

title: I'm married: Prince Narula after Azma comments on his past equation with Nora Fatehi
body: In a new promo, 'Lock Upp' contestant Azma Fallah was seen making a comment about Prince Narula's equation with Nora Fatehi from the time they appeared together on 'Bigg Boss 9'. She said, "Prince Narula didn't get...attention from Nora Fatehi." Reacting to Azma's comment, Prince said, "It'll be...bad if you get personal again. I'm a married man. Shut up."

title: Cell to be formed to resolve issues of U'khand's migrant residents: CM
body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami met with the migrant residents of the state and said that a cell would be formed in Dehradun to solve their problems. "Through this cell, along with resolving the problems of the migrants, efforts will be made to implement their suggestions related to the interest of the state," he said.

title: Ready to take in at least 10,000 injured Ukrainian soldiers: Poland
body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki said Poland is ready to take in and treat at least 10,000 injured Ukrainian soldiers. Poland is already treating "several dozen" soldiers, Morawiecki said during a visit to Ukraine's Lviv city. Last week, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said up to 3,000 Ukrainian troops have died and 10,000 soldiers have been injured in the war so far.

title: Maha govt must ban leaders' rallies who create communal tensions: Patole
body: Congress' Nana Patole said on Monday that the Maharashtra government must ban public rallies of political leaders who try to create communal tensions. Patole's remark comes a day after Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray announced that he'll conduct a rally in Aurangabad on May 1. Thackeray had earlier demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

title: Massive fire at Haryana chemical plant, firefighters from Delhi called in
body:
A massive fire broke out at a chemical factory in the Kundli area in Haryana's Sonipat on Sunday.
The Delhi Fire Service has also sent its firefighters to the spot for the operation on a special request from the Haryana government. The cause of the fire is not yet known, the Delhi Fire Service said.

title: Ola CEO dances to 'Bijlee Bijlee' while testing e-scooter's music feature
body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal took to social media to share a video of him dancing to 'Bijlee Bijlee' song while testing a feature to play music on Ola's electric scooters. "Doing some final 'expert testing' for the MoveOS 2 music feature," he tweeted. Earlier, he had said that MoveOS 2.0 operating system for scooters will roll out by April end.

title: 5 of family from Rajasthan killed, 2 missing as car falls into canal in Punjab
body: Five members of a family from Rajasthan were killed as the car they were travelling in was hit by a speeding bus and fell into a canal on Ropar-Chandigarh Highway in Punjab, police said. The search to recover the bodies of two others is on, police added. "After collision...driver lost control...ended up hitting the railing of the bridge," police stated.

title: China to send next new space station crew for 6 months in June
body: China will launch three more astronauts to its newest space station in June for a period of six months. The crew will add two modules to the station, Director of the China Manned Space Engineering Office said. The core module of the Tiangong was launched in April 2021. China plans to complete the station by end of this year.

title: Man who set self on fire at Punjab police station dies; 11 booked
body: Eleven people, including a municipal councillor, have been booked after a 35-year-old man who set himself on fire at a police station in Punjab's Kapurthala died at a hospital on Sunday, police said. The deceased had claimed that the officials aren't acting on his complaint about his wife not being allowed to leave prostitution. The incident had occurred last week.

title: BBMP offers 5% rebate on property tax if people pay it before Apr 30
body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta has announced that people can get a 5% rebate if they pay their property tax for the 2022-23 financial year before April 30. According to BBMP, property owners would've to pay the full amount in one instalment in order to avail the rebate. The amount can be paid using BBMP's website.

title: Amway India's assets worth ₹758 crore attached by ED over pyramid fraud
body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹757.77 crore belonging to Amway India Enterprises Private Limited. According to ED, the firm was running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing networks. Amway India said, "The action is with regards to the investigation dating back to 2011 and since then we've been cooperating with the department."

title: Suspended principal of Mohali institute held for demanding ₹50,000 bribe
body: The vigilance bureau on Monday arrested a suspended principal of the Industrial Training Institute (Women), Phase 5, Mohali, for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹50,000 from a Ludhiana resident for helping him land an instructor’s job in the institute. The accused man, Shamsher Singh Purkhalvi, was suspended two weeks ago following a slew of complaints against him.

title: Gang of 4 rob driver, run away with his taxi in Bengaluru; arrested
body: Four people have been arrested for robbing a taxi driver in Sampigehalli area of Bengaluru on Saturday, police said. The accused persons also ran away with the car and a gold chain. They had booked the taxi at Shivaram Karanth Layout and snatched the car keys when the driver reached the pickup spot.

title: He only plays 5 or 10 balls every match: Malinga on Riyan Parag's form
body: Talking about RR batter Riyan Parag, their fast-bowling coach Lasith Malinga said there's no concern over the 20-year-old's form. "He hasn't got much chance...he just plays five or 10 balls every match," stated Malinga. Parag was dismissed for 5 off 3 balls against KKR on Monday and has scored a total of 48 runs in six games so far.

title: Restoration work of Pune's Shivaji Market likely to begin in May
body: The restoration work of the Chhatrapati Shivaji Market in Pune is likely to begin in the third week of May. The renovation of the market, which comes under the Pune Cantonment Board, was delayed due to a lack of funds at the board. Notably, the reconstruction was necessitated due to the fire breaking out in the market in March 2021.

title: Hindu outfit demands arrest of BJP's Eshwarappa
body: A Hindu outfit named the Akhila Bharath Hindu Mahasabha (ABHM) has demanded the arrest of former Karnataka Minister and BJP leader KS Eshwarappa. "The BJP is using Hindus for the sake of power but is not protecting them. The government should have sacked Eshwarappa, instead he submitted his resignation owing to pressure," said ABHM state President Rajesh Pavithran.

title: Umran's pace means I'm a target, batters think I'm slower: Bhuvneshwar
body: On being asked how his SRH teammate Umran Malik's pace has helped him in the ongoing IPL, veteran pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar jokingly said, "More than helping me...I'm a target as batters think I'm slower." Bhuvneshwar also praised Umran, stating that watching the 22-year-old in action is "joy". "Hope the [batters] going after me leads to wickets...not boundaries," he added.

title: 22-yr-old woman slashes fiancé's throat after calling him for 'surprise date' in Andhra
body: A 22-year-old woman in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam allegedly slashed her fiancé's throat a month ahead of their marriage after calling him for a 'surprise date'. The man, who is a scientist with the Council of Scientific & Industrial Research, has been hospitalised. Police said the woman confessed to the crime, adding that she was being forced to marry him.

title: 'Sanaa' changed me as person & actor: Radhika after wrapping shoot
body: After wrapping the shoot for her upcoming film 'Sanaa', Radhika Madan said that the film changed her as a person and as an actor. "Sanaa is...the toughest character to let go off. She slowly seeps into your veins and before you know it she has already captured you," Radhika added. "Sanaa will always be closest to my heart," she stated.

title: No bhajan on loudspeakers near mosques around azaan call in Nashik
body: Nashik Police Commissioner Deepak Pandey on Monday issued a directive stating that no one will be allowed to play bhajan or other songs on loudspeaker 15 minutes before and after the call of azaan. This is applicable for areas within a 100-metre radius of any mosque. Pandey issued another directive instructing religious places to take prior permission for loudspeaker usage.

title: BSF recovers 2.1 kg of suspected heroin near border in Punjab
body: The Border Security Force (BSF) in Punjab's Amritsar sector on Tuesday recovered four packets containing 2.1 kg of suspected heroin along with a pistol, a magazine and 37 Rds. Sharing a picture of the items on Twitter, Punjab Frontier BSF wrote that the recovery was made by the troops while "monitoring harvesting activities of farmers ahead of border fence".

title: 76 Ukrainan prisoners of war freed in swap with Russia: Deputy PM
body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Tuesday said that Russia handed over 60 soldiers, including 10 officers, and 16 civilians to Ukraine in an exchange for prisoners of war. "This was the fifth exchange of prisoners of war," she added. Separately, Russia began its offensive in eastern Ukraine after pulling its forces from the country's north.

title: Wish you all the success, happiness: Suryakumar on Rahul's 30th birthday
body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav took to Twitter to wish teammate KL Rahul on his 30th birthday on Monday. "Happy Birthday to one of the kindest...wish you all the success and happiness brother. Looking forward to many more partnerships with you," he wrote. Cheteshwar Pujara tweeted, "[Rahul] have a year as swashbuckling as your game."

title: WHO Centre is starting of traditional medicine era in world: PM Modi
body: Speaking at the inaugural ceremony of the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine in Gujarat's Jamnagar, PM Narendra Modi said the centre has opened the door of age of traditional medicine in the world. PM Modi said, "It's not just an institution's inauguration, it is the beginning of the traditional medicine era in the world for the next 25 years."

title: Man beats partner's 3-year-old daughter to death in Pune; arrested
body: A man has been arrested for allegedly beating his partner's three-year-old daughter to death in Pune. "Our preliminary probe suggests that the accused resented the child since she was born out of a previous relationship," an officer said. According to the FIR, the man banged the child's head against the wall. The girl's mother filed a complaint last week.

title: Karnataka govt takes 30% commission on grants reserved for mutts: Seer
body: A Lingayat seer, Dingaleshwara Swami of Balehosur Mutt, claimed that the Basavaraj Bommai-led Karnataka government takes a 30% commission on grants reserved for the welfare of mutts. "The corruption has reached this level...officials say they cannot be released until commission is paid," the seer added. "For cities like Delhi...funds are like ice creams...we get only ice cream sticks," he stated.

title: Why is PM silent on incidents of riots and violence? : Congress' Surjewala
body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala said BJP and its government are at war with its own people. "While parts of India are ravaged by riots and violence, why is the Prime Minister so conspicuously silent? Why does he not denounce hatred no matter where it comes from?" Surjewala added. "Why do perpetrators of hate get political patronage?" Surjewala stated.

title: Was saving people when I was hit with stones: Officer on Delhi violence
body: Assistant Sub-Inspector of Police (Delhi) Arun Kumar, while narrating the sequence of events of Jahangirpuri violence, said that he was trying to save people when he was being hit with stones. "People started running, leaving their vehicles behind. I was trying to remove everyone from the violence-hit area," he added. Police have arrested 14 people in connection with the violence.

title: 4 civilians shot dead in Ukraine's Luhansk region: Governor
body: Four civilians were reportedly shot dead during a Russian attack in Ukraine's eastern Luhansk region. The victims were trying to flee the Kreminna city by car when the incident occurred, said regional Governor Serhiy Gaidai in a Telegram post, according to a report. Meanwhile, multiple blasts were reported in Ukraine's Kyiv, Lviv and Dnipro regions.

title: Should see 'KGF: Chapter 2' 4-5 times, won't understand it first time: Sanjay
body: Actor Sanjay Dutt said that everyone should watch first day first show of 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "I think everybody should see it about 4-5 times because you will not understand the film in the first go," Sanjay said. The actor was replying to a fan who said that there has been no film of Dutt he hasn't watched in theatres.

title: Lost teeth on stage, it's going to be lifetime memory for me: Hunarbaaz winner
body: Akash Singh, who won the reality show 'Hunarbaaz: Desh Ki Shaan' on Sunday, has revealed that he fell off a pole and broke three teeth while preparing for his act on stage. "It's going to be...lifetime memory for me that I lost my teeth on...'Hunarbaaz' stage," Akash said, adding, "All my...hard work bore fruits and I could win the trophy."

title: Gorilla addicted to smartphones has his screen time cut down in US zoo
body: A 16-year-old gorilla, who developed a smartphone addiction after being shown pictures and videos by visitors at a US zoo, is having his screen time cut down. Amare, due to his addiction, had reportedly failed to notice as another gorilla had charged at him. Zoo authorities have now put up a rope to keep visitors away from his enclosure.

title: Calm character for someone who hasn't played a lot: Hesson on RCB's Shahbaz
body: RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said all-rounder Shahbaz Ahamad is a calming influence in the team. "We know he's got power, so at...back end, he chooses the right time to do it. He's a...calm character for someone who hasn't played too many games," he added. Shahbaz has scored 145 runs in four innings in IPL 2022 so far.

title: Youth must learn spirit of sacrifice, commitment from freedom fighters: VP Naidu
body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Tuesday said India's youth must learn the spirit of sacrifice and unwavering commitment from our freedom fighters. "They must imbibe...values of...honesty, dedication and selfless service," he said. "Remember that these heroes fought not merely for an abstract geographical entity but to free millions of people from oppressive and unjust British rule," he added.

title: My 94*(51) vs CSK reminds me of my 2013 century for KXIP: Miller
body: After playing a match-winning knock of 94 runs against CSK, the Gujarat Titans batter David Miller said that this knock reminded him of his century which he scored for the Kings XI Punjab in 2013. "It does take me back to memory lane (referring to the 2013 knock)...with the rate quite high, I wanted to express myself (yesterday)," Miller said.

title: UP govt mandates prior permission for taking out religious processions
body: Following incidents of communal violence across the country during Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanti, the Uttar Pradesh government has mandated prior permission for taking out religious processions across the state. CM Yogi Adityanath said organisers have to produce an affidavit ensuring peace and harmony before seeking permission. "Permission shouldn't be given to any new processions," he added.

title: Probe ordered against Assam CM Sarma ahead of Guwahati civic polls
body: Assam State Election Commission has instructed to initiate a probe against Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma for alleged model code violations during campaigns for Guwahati civic polls. A complaint was filed by Asom Jatiya Parishad (AJP) president Sanjeev Bora against Sarma, accusing him of promising 'land patta' to landless residents. The complaint further alleged that Sarma sought to bribe wards.

title: New Zealand imposes new sanctions on Russian financial institutions
body: New Zealand Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta on Tuesday said the country is imposing new sanctions on Russian financial institutions such as eight of its largest banks over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Mahuta said New Zealand is imposing sanctions on "18 financial entities, including Russia's central bank, sovereign wealth fund and the largest financial institutions in the country".

title: 5 killed, 5 injured as vehicle overturns in Assam; PM expresses condolences
body: At least five persons, who were returning home from a Bihu function, were killed and five others sustained injuries when a vehicle carrying them overturned in Assam's Biswanath. "Prima facie, over-speeding seems to be the cause of the accident," a police officer said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and CM Himanta Biswa Sarma expressed their condolences over the loss of lives.

title: PBKS skipper Mayank is better, he should be ready to be back: Dhawan
body: Punjab Kings batter Shikhar Dhawan, speaking about skipper Mayank Agarwal's injury, has said, "Mayank is better and he should be ready to be back." Mayank did not feature in the match against SunRisers Hyderabad due to a toe injury and Dhawan was named the stand-in captain. SRH defeated Punjab in the match by seven wickets.

title: Ranbir Kapoor returns to work 2 days after wedding with Alia Bhatt
body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor was spotted going into the T-Series office in Mumbai's Andheri on Sunday. The actor got married to actress Alia Bhatt on April 14 followed by a post-wedding party on Saturday. In a video shared by a journalist account, Ranbir can be seen giving a thumbs up to the media persons who congratulated him for the wedding.

title: 4 firearms seized in West Bengal's Malda, Bihar man arrested
body: Police arrested a resident of Bihar's Munger and seized four firearms from his possession in West Bengal's Malda district. The accused was nabbed at Khaltipur Railway Station on Monday while he was travelling aboard the Katihar-Howrah Express, an official said. He was scheduled to deliver the guns to a person in Kaliachak in the Malda district, the official added.

title: California teen with autism who went missing 3 years ago found alive
body: A California teenager who went missing nearly three years ago was found alive on April 9, sleeping in a convenience store in Utah's Summit County. Connerjack Oswalt was reported missing in September 2019, when he was 16 years old. Oswalt has now been reunited with his family, "who was losing hope", Summit County Sheriff said in a Facebook post.

title: He's the punisher: Irfan after Buttler's 2nd ton in IPL 2022
body: After opener Jos Buttler hit his second century for RR against KKR at Brabourne Stadium on Monday in IPL 2022, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Twitter and wrote, "He [Buttler] is the punisher." Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Different league Buttler boss." Praising Buttler, Michael Vaughan said, "Best T20 player in the world." Buttler scored 103 runs in 61 balls.

title: Hong Kong bans Air India flights till April 24 after 3 found COVID positive
body: Hong Kong has banned Air India services till April 24 after three passengers on one of its flights tested positive for COVID-19 post arrival on Saturday, an official said. "Due to restrictions imposed by Hong Kong authorities and limited demand on the sector, our flights to Hong Kong & back of 19th and 23rd April stand cancelled," Air India tweeted.

title: Speculative in nature: Mindtree on report of $22 bn merger with L&T Infotech
body: Mindtree on Monday clarified that news reports of its merger with Larsen & Toubro Infotech are "speculative in nature". Mindtree said, "We would like to state that there is no information available with the company as of today." Bloomberg earlier reported that Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between the two software firms to create a $22 billion firm.

title: Trying to convince EU to restrict Russian oil supplies: France
body: France has said that it is trying to convince the members of the European Union (EU) to restrict oil supplies from Russia in view of the Ukraine war. "In light of what is happening now in Donbas, the stoppage of oil supplies from Russia is necessary more than ever," said French minister Bruno Le Maire.

title: Attacking police station is serious crime: Bommai on Hubbali stone-pelting incident
body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the investigation into the stone-pelting incident at Old Hubbali Police Station, in which 12 policemen were injured, is being carried out thoroughly. "Attacking the police station is a serious crime, action will be initiated against the guilty," he added. According to Hubbali Police commissioner, 88 persons have been arrested in the matter so far.

title: Big B shares fan artwork day after defending another fan's work
body: Amitabh Bachchan on Monday shared fan-made artwork on Instagram showing him and his son Abhishek Bachchan's faces over cartoon bodies. This comes a day after one of his fan pages criticised artwork done by another fan account saying the creator shouldn't use the actor's face over someone else's body. Amitabh had tweeted, "I like it...Please do...more...Don't pay attention to others."

title: Didn't do rom-coms for 20 yrs, scripts weren't good: Julia Roberts
body: Actress Julia Roberts has revealed that she has not done romantic-comedy films in the last 20 years because there wasn't a single good script. "If I'd read something that...was that 'Notting Hill'...or 'My Best Friend's Wedding' level...I would do it," she added. Julia further said that she has three children and has to work with her husband and children's schedules.

title: Munawar reveals mother died by suicide in 2007, says 'Saw her being beaten up all my life'
body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui, in an episode of 'Lock Upp', revealed his mother died by suicide in 2007.  "I always think things may have been different had I slept with my mom that night...had I reached the hospital earlier," he said. "For 22 years of her married life...my mom wasn't happy. All my life...I saw her being beaten up," he added.

title: KGF is a horror film for Bollywood, they will have nightmares for years: RGV
body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to talk about KGF's success and said that it is a "horror film" for the Bollywood industry and they will have nightmares about its success for years to come. "@TheNameIsYash is literally machine gunning all...Bollywood stars opening collections and its final collections will be...nuclear bomb thrown on Bollywood from Sandalwood," he tweeted.

title: Ukraine has completed questionnaire for EU membership: Official
body: Ukraine has completed a questionnaire that will form the starting point for the European Union (EU) to consider the country's membership in the bloc, Ihor Zhovkva, Deputy Head of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's Office, said. Ukraine expects to acquire candidate country status for accession to the EU in June, Zhovkva added. Ukraine signed an application to join the EU in February.

title: IMF cuts India's GDP growth forecast sharply from 9% to 8.2% for FY23
body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has sharply cut India's GDP growth forecast for FY23 to 8.2% from 9%, citing Russia-Ukraine war. "Economic damage from the conflict will contribute to a significant slowdown in global growth in 2022 and add to inflation," the IMF said in its World Economic Outlook report. IMF cut its global growth outlook for 2022 to 3.6%.

title: Kindergartener brings tequila to school, gets classmates drunk in US
body: A kindergartener aged between three and six allegedly brought a tequila-based drink to school in US' Michigan and shared it with friends, who thought it was juice. Several students reported feeling "dizzy" and "woozy" after consuming the alcoholic drink. "I had a small conversation with my daughter...and she told me the girl knew it was liquor," a parent said.

title: Man arrested for allegedly raping his 14-year-old daughter in Delhi
body: A 45-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping his 14-year-old daughter in Delhi, police said on Tuesday. According to Superintendent of Police Hemraj Meena, the man allegedly raped his daughter at their house. The girl's brother filed a complaint against the accused, following which the police arrested the man, the police officer added.

title: Ranbir holds note saying 'I pledge ₹12 lakh to all bridesmaids' during wedding; pic viral
body: A picture of Ranbir Kapoor holding a note saying 'I, Ranbir, husband of Alia, pledge ₹12 lakh to all the bridesmaids' during his wedding has gone viral. Alia Bhatt's friend Tanya Saha Gupta shared pictures from the wedding, writing, "It's sappy days like these that I live for." Alia and Ranbir got married on April 14.

title: He was the cement that build RCB innings: Jaffer on Du Plessis' 96 vs LSG
body: After RCB captain Faf du Plessis' 64-ball 96 helped his side post 181/6 in 20 overs against LSG in IPL 2022, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "From 21*(20) to 50*(40) to 96(64). Faf was the cement that build RCB innings." He added, "Masterclass in how to rebuild after an early collapse." RCB were reduced to 7/2 after the first over.

title: India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030: FM
body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said India will be one of the fastest growing economies by 2030. Describing the Indian economy's recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic as "distinct" and "pronounced", Sitharaman said India undertook various structural reforms both before and after the pandemic. India converted the pandemic into an opportunity to further push these reforms, she added.

title: 16 wagons of goods train derail in Punjab's Rupnagar
body: A train with 16 wagons, that was coming from Ropar Thermal Plant, derailed in Punjab's Rupnagar. The incident took place after driver applied brakes suddenly after a herd of cattle came on the railway tracks. DRM Ambala said that few express and passenger trains have been cancelled after the incident.

title: Auto, taxi drivers in Delhi to go on strike tomorrow demanding hike in fares
body: Various unions of auto, taxi and minibus drivers in Delhi will go on strike on Monday demanding a cut in CNG prices and a hike in fares. Sarvodaya Driver Association Delhi, whose members also drive for cab aggregators, said it'll go on an indefinite strike. The Delhi government has said it's setting up a committee to consider revising the fares.

title: Kim Jong-un observes N Korea's missile test, gives 'important instructions'
body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un observed the test-firing of a new type of tactical guided weapon, state news agency KCNA said. "It's of great significance in improving the firepower of the frontline long-range artillery units and enhancing the efficiency in the operation of tactical nukes," KCNA added. It also said that Kim "gave important instructions" on strengthening the defence capabilities.

title: ₹48,000 cr wiped off Infosys' m-cap in a day as shares plunge the most in 2 years
body: The shares of Infosys plunged over 9% on Monday during the intra-day trade, wiping out ₹48,000 crore from the company's market capital. At 9%, Infosys stock had the biggest fall in the market since March 23, 2020. This comes after several analysts cut Infosys margin estimates over its weaker-than-expected earnings for the March quarter.

title: It's been a joy ride: Jaideep Ahlawat as he wraps 'An Action Hero' shoot
body: Actor Jaideep Ahlawat has completed shooting for his upcoming film 'An Action Hero', which also stars Ayushmann Khurrana. In a statement, Jaideep said that working on 'An Action Hero' has been a joy ride and a learning experience. It is directed by Anirudh Iyer, who previously served as an assistant director on 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' and 'Zero'.

title: Yami Gautam was the first and only choice for 'Dasvi': Director
body: 'Dasvi' director Tushar Jalota in an interview has revealed that actress Yami Gautam was the first and only choice for policewoman Jyoti Daiswal. Tushar said that Jyoti is razor-focused, cutting sharp and has a steely authority. "When we were casting for this role in 'Dasvi', I couldn't imagine anyone else other than Yami Gautam playing Jyoti Daiswal," he added.

title: Virat Kohli gets out for a golden duck, IPL share video of his reaction
body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) batter Virat Kohli got out for a golden duck against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in their IPL 2022 match on Tuesday. IPL shared a video of his dismissal. In the video, Kohli can be seen reacting to his dismissal with a dejected smile. It is Kohli's fourth golden duck in IPL.

title: WPI inflation rises to record 14.55% in Mar, Govt cites Russia-Ukraine war as reason
body: India's Wholesale Price-based Inflation (WPI) has surged to a record high of 14.55% in March. The Centre has said that the high rate of inflation in March is due to "the rise in prices of crude petroleum and natural gas, mineral oils, basic metals" caused by the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Notably, In March 2021, the WPI was 7.89%.

title: SC stays UP govt decision to take back land from Jauhar University
body: The Supreme Court stayed a decision by UP government to take back land allotted to Rampur’s Mohammad Ali Jauhar University. The university, which is run by a Trust headed by Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan, was allotted 400 acres of land in 2005. The construction of a mosque on the premises violated government's conditions, Allahabad High Court had noted.

title: Aamir dances to Dhol Jageero Da with influencer Ruhee Dosani, she shares video
body: Social media influencer Ruhee Dosani took to Instagram to share a video of herself dancing with Aamir Khan to the song 'Dhol Jageero Da'. Aamir had invited Ruhee and her family to his house. "Still don't know how to...process the fact that Aamir sir was so kind to agree to spend time with my family to celebrate Vaisakhi," Ruhee wrote.

title: CM Kejriwal is an irresponsible leader: Delhi Congress chief
body: Delhi Congress President Anil Chaudhary has called CM Arvind Kejriwal an "irresponsible leader" after violence took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday. "Kejriwal is just playing the blame game. This is a statement from an irresponsible leader. When Congress was in power, Shiela (Dixit) ji stood for the people and maintained peace and harmony," Chaudhary said.

title: Maoists kill 30-yr-old man who had come to meet relatives in Chhattisgarh
body: A 30-year-old man was allegedly killed by Maoists at Kolaiguda in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district in the early hours of Monday. The deceased has been identified as Dudhi Ganga. Ganga was a resident of Telangana and had run away from his village in Chhattisgarh years ago. He had come back to meet relatives at some function, police said.

title: Had suggestions in Thar, he rejected it; did it his way: Anil on Harsh Varrdhan
body: Actor Anil Kapoor said that while he was shooting for 'Thar' with son Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor, he had some suggestions. "But he rejected it. He did it in his own way, and he was right and I was wrong. I really enjoyed working with him," Anil said, adding that Harsh Varrdhan is fearless and he is proud of him.

title: China signs security pact with Solomon Islands amid US' concerns
body: China said on Tuesday that it has signed a security pact with the Solomon Islands. The pact entails China's assistance in maintaining social order and national security in the Solomon Islands, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin said. The announcement comes amid concerns by US, Australia and New Zealand about a potential increase in China's military presence in Indo-Pacific region.

title: 14-yr-old Hyderabad boy dies while playing, parents suspect murder
body: A 14-year-old boy died after he allegedly collapsed while playing volleyball at Moghalpura ground in Hyderabad on Saturday. According to police, preliminary reports suggest that Mohammed Nawaz died due to dehydration. However, his parents suspect it to be a murder. "A few boys playing with Nawaz claimed that others beat him up," Nawaz's father Riaz Ahmed said.

title: Maha minister meets Baghel seeking clearances for coal block
body: Maharashtra minister Nitin Raut has sought clearances for a coal block allocated to a state-run power company in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh. He met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday to urge early completion of the formalities and reportedly sought forest diversion. The Chhattisgarh government said that the CM assured full support in the matter to Raut.

title: Every IPL season, Samson starts with a bang & then just tapers off: Aakash
body: Aakash Chopra has opined that Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson needs to play a captain's knock in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Every season, Samson starts with a bang and then just tapers off," Aakash stated. "Time has come for him to lift himself and the team as well," he added. Samson has scored 117 runs in five matches so far.

title: Cong isn't dead, will play role of constructive opp'n in Punjab: Sidhu
body: Former Punjab Congress chief Navjot Singh Sidhu, while speaking about the party's loss in the state Assembly elections this year, said that the "Congress party has lost but isn't dead". He added that Congress will be playing the role of a constructive opposition in Punjab and that they will "work to provide the solution to the problems of people".

title: Neetu shares pic with Ranbir & son-in-law Bharat; calls them her 'pillars'
body: Actress Neetu Kapoor took to Instagram to share a picture with her son, actor Ranbir Kapoor and her son-in-law Bharat Sahni. The picture was from Ranbir-Alia Bhatt's wedding ceremony. While sharing the post, she wrote, "My pillars." As soon as she posted the photo, fans took to the comments section, and wrote, "Congratulations Neetu ji." Another user wrote, "Two sons."

title: Manish Sisodia shares Guj govt schools' pics 'without desks', 'broken toilets'
body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi’s visit to Gujarat, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia tweeted pictures of government schools in Gujarat "without desks" and "broken toilets". "Dear PM, you may not see the pictures of these schools from the modern centre of Vidya Samiksha Kendra, where there is no desk to sit, there are spider webs...Toilets are broken," Sisodia tweeted.

title: Pressure is at its highest: Zaheer on MI's 6-match losing streak
body: MI Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said that the pressure level is "at its highest" for the team as they've lost six consecutive matches in ongoing IPL. "This is a team sport so we have to stick together, have to find ways of coming together and then become a force," he stated. It's MI's worst start in IPL history.

title: Once heard an actress' mom say 'Be nice, he's big producer': Poonam
body: Actress Poonam Dhillon has revealed she once heard the mother of an actress tell her to be nice to a man because he is a big producer. "You have to be nice to everyone, your driver, make-up artist, producer, director...If a parent pressures the daughter to be 'nice' to a producer, obviously you're asking her to compromise," Poonam added.

title: Japan to send masks, hazmat suits to Ukraine amid chemical weapon threat
body: Japan will send gas masks, hazmat suits and drones to Ukraine amid growing concern about the use of chemical weapons by the Russian military. Japan is sending the anti-chemical-warfare equipment at the request of the Ukrainian government, the country's Defence Minister Nobuo Kishi said. Last month, Japan had provided bulletproof vests, helmets and other non-lethal arms equipment to Ukraine.

title: Javed Miandad was the first batsman to win an ODI with last-ball six
body: Former Pakistani captain Javed Miandad was the first-ever batsman to help his team win an ODI by hitting a six off the match's last ball. Miandad achieved the feat against India on April 18, 1986 by hitting a maximum on the bowling of then 20-year-old fast bowler Chetan Sharma. Pakistan won that match by one wicket.

title: 19-year-old killed in hit-and-run case in Pune, 1 arrested
body: A 19-year-old youth was killed in a hit-and-run case in Pune's Katraj and a truck driver has been arrested, police said. "There is parking at the back of the police station. But that space was booked for some party so he was taking the truck to the substitute location when he hit this person...ran over his head," police added.

title: Party will decide on plan to expand, rejig Cabinet: K'taka CM
body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said BJP President JP Nadda will hold a meeting regarding the state and thereafter decide on Karnataka Cabinet's expansion or reshuffle. This comes as BJP gears up for Karnataka Assembly polls which are scheduled to be held next year. There are currently 29 ministers in the state Cabinet against the sanctioned strength of 34.

title: Denial of sex not 'exceptional hardship' to end marriage before 1-yr period: HC
body: Denial of sex is tantamount to "cruelty" but not "exceptional hardship", the Delhi High Court has said. It, hence, cannot be grounds for dissolution of marriage before the mandated cooling-off period of one year in a divorce case, it added. It said this while refusing to set aside a trial court order dismissing a mutual divorce petition of a couple.

title: 27-year-old history-sheeter arrested in Mumbai; pistol, knives seized
body: A history-sheeter (27), accused in an October 2020 murder case, was arrested by the Mumbai Crime Branch's Unit-7 in Ghatkopar. The police seized a country-made pistol and two knives from the accused, who is identified as Amol Avate. He was allegedly involved in the murder of Ambadas Salve, a resident of Vikhroli (east), along with five other people, police said.

title: Wear masks in crowded places: Chandigarh govt amid COVID-19 rise
body: The Chandigarh Health Department on Monday issued an advisory asking people to wear face masks in crowded places in the wake of rising COVID-19 cases in some states and Union Territories. It said wearing of face masks is need to be especially ensured in closed environments like public transport. Masks should be used in classrooms and indoor gatherings, it added.

title: Burning of Sri Lankan man's body by Pak mob anti-Islam: Court
body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan on Tuesday said that the lynching of a Sri Lankan man and the burning of his body by a mob was an act against Islam. "The Holy Prophet...forbade Muslims to disgrace the dead body of even a non-Muslim," it added. The court on Monday convicted 89 people in a mass trial over the crime.

title: Okinawa outlet in Tamil Nadu goes up in flames after electric scooter catches fire
body: An Okinawa dealership in Tamil Nadu went up in flames after an e-scooter parked in the outlet reportedly caught fire. While the entire showroom was gutted, no casualties were reported and the fire was put out with the help of locals. Before this incident, Okinawa announced a recall of 3,215 units of its 'Praise Pro' scooters to fix battery-related issues.

title: Sayani Gupta, Tamannaah wear same saree at Iftaar party, share pics
body: Actresses Sayani Gupta and Tamannaah Bhatia on Sunday turned up in the same saree designed by Monica Shah and Karishma Swali's brand Jade at Baba Siddiqui's Iftaar party. Sayani took to Instagram Stories to share pictures with Tamannaah, writing, "Tamannaah and I were twinning. Thanks @jady_bymk for giving us the same outfits. Had to take photos."

title: 11 held after stone-pelting incident on Hanuman Jayanti in Uttarakhand's Haridwar
body: Police on Monday booked 13 people and arrested 11 in connection with an alleged stone-pelting incident in Bhagwanpur area of Uttarakhand's Haridwar during a Hanuman Jayanti procession. The incident allegedly occurred when the procession was crossing a Muslim-dominated stretch in Danda Jalalpur village, police said. "Sufficient force is present in the village...situation is peaceful," police added.

title: Auditioned for 'X-Factor' as I wanted to marry Harry Styles: Camila
body: Singer Camila Cabello has revealed she auditioned for reality show 'X-Factor' because she wanted to marry singer Harry Styles. "This is really embarrassing and I can only say this because it's like 10 years ago...I really believed that at the time," she added. Camila further said she thought they'll meet, she'll become a singer and they'll probably fall in love.

title: Lucky to have my kids know what we do: Warner on pics of daughters' reaction to dismissal
body: DC opener David Warner took to Instagram to share the viral pictures of his daughters 'heartbroken' reaction to his dismissal against RCB. He wrote, "So lucky to have my kids know what we do, but more importantly, it teaches them that you can't always win. We all give 100% every time we walk onto that field, no matter what."

title: Exercise restraint in reporting communal tensions: EGI to media houses
body: The Editors Guild of India (EGI) on Tuesday urged media houses to exercise restraint while reporting incidents of communal disturbances in different parts of the country. The Guild said that while the desire to be first with the news is understandable, many editors and reporters are reportedly rushing to conclusions without a full appreciation of the facts and context.

title: Anil forced Boney to give me hike in 'Woh 7 Din': Satish Kaushik
body: Actor Satish Kaushik has revealed that actor Anil Kapoor forced his brother producer Boney Kapoor to give him ₹501 from his earlier decided fee of ₹201 in 1983 film 'Woh 7 Din'. "The first day of shoot I had to wear a shirt. Anil brought one and said...Rishi Kapoor had worn it in 'Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan'," he added.

title: Adi Chopra said before debut 'You're not Hrithik, do acting': Ranveer
body: Actor Ranveer Singh has revealed that filmmaker Aditya Chopra told him before his debut, "You're not Hrithik Roshan, toh tu acting kar lena (so you do acting)." The actor added that he once saw two people standing in front of his debut film 'Band Baaja Baaraat' poster. "They said, 'Who is this? He doesn't look like a hero!'" Ranveer said.

title: US to train Ukrainians to use Howitzers in coming days: Official
body: The US military plans to start training Ukrainian trainers on using the Howitzer artillery system in the coming days, a senior US official said on Monday. The training would take place outside Ukraine, the official added. The US and its allies have provided military aid to the Ukrainian military to help it fight Russian forces invading the country.

title: Govt registered highest-ever 1.67 lakh companies in FY22, up 8% YoY
body: Corporate Affairs Ministry registered over 1.67 lakh companies incorporations in FY22, an 8% YoY increase from 1.55 lakh companies incorporations registered in FY21. This is the highest number of company incorporations in a financial year till date. The Ministry said it has taken many initiatives for reducing the number of procedures, time and cost for starting a business in India.

title: Naxals set fire to 7 vehicles engaged in mining in Chhattisgarh
body: Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur allegedly burned down seven vehicles involved in sand mining. "There was sand mining going on in the Mingachal river, where six to seven vehicles were set on fire by several Naxals," P Sundarraj, IG Bastar, said. Four Hyva trucks, two JCBs were amongst the seven vehicles engaged in sand mining activities in the area.

title: 5 grenades, 10 pistols among the arms recovered from J&K's Kupwara
body: A huge cache of arms and ammunition was reportedly recovered from Kupwara district during a search operation conducted by the police along with the Indian Army. Ten pistols, 17 pistol magazines, 54 pistol rounds and five grenades were seized, the police said. On Sunday, the J&K police along with the Army arrested a suspected terrorist and seized ammunition from him.

title: BJP gave money to woo voters during Kolhapur by-polls: Maha MoS
body: Maharashtra Minister of State for Home (Urban) Satej Patil said BJP ran a vicious campaign and distributed money to woo voters during the recently concluded Kolhapur North by-polls. Adding that BJP also gave free tickets of 'The Kashmir Files', Patil said, "Voters didn't succumb to such tactics as they voted for Maha Vikas Aghadi. This victory...belongs to people of Kolhapur."

title: I ran away from home to pursue acting: 'Arjun Reddy' actress Shalini
body: Actress Shalini Pandey, who made her acting debut with Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy' said she ran away from home to pursue acting. "Dad wasn't convinced to let me [become an actress]. I was trying to convince him for four years but he wasn't letting me pursue it," added Shalini. Shalini will be seen in the upcoming Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'.

title: Man rapes, blackmails woman by using obscene videos in Gurugram
body: A man was arrested for allegedly raping and blackmailing a 30-year-old woman by using her objectionable videos in Gurugram, police said on Tuesday. The accused made a video of the woman bathing some time back and used it to threaten and rape her on different occasions, police said. The survivor informed her sister after which a case was registered.

title: 2 killed, 17 injured in separate shootings in US
body: Two people were killed and at least 17 injured in two separate incidents of mass shooting in US over the Easter weekend. A shooting at a nightclub in South Carolina left nine people injured, while another in Pittsburgh left two dead and eight wounded. These happened a day after 14 people were injured in a shooting incident in South Carolina.

title: CoBRA commando injured in encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh
body: A commando of CRPF's CoBRA unit was injured in an encounter with Naxals in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Tuesday. The gunfight took place in the forest between Kottaguda and Pegdapalli villages, where joint teams of security forces were on a search operation, IGP Sundarraj P said. The injured commando, identified as Sanjeev Kumar, is currently being treated.

title: RR record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far
body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) put up a total of 217/5 against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) on Monday to record the highest total of IPL 2022 so far. This is Royals' second 200-plus total in IPL 2022. The previous highest total in IPL 2022 was 216/4, registered by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) against Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) on April 12.

title: Delhi violence accused does Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa' gesture while being taken to court
body: A video has shown one of the accused in the Jahangirpuri Delhi violence case doing Allu Arjun's popular hand gesture from the movie 'Pushpa' while being taken to court on Sunday. In the video that is being widely shared online, one of the key accused Ansar was seen doing the signature move while smiling at the camera recording him.

title: 3 killed in Arunachal Pradesh after heavy rains trigger landslide
body: Three persons, including a nine-year-old child, were killed in Arunachal Pradesh's Kurung Kumey district after heavy rains caused a massive landslide. The victims were buried alive in Monday's incident which also damaged at least 15 houses, an official said. The state has been receiving continuous rainfall for over a week causing road connectivity to be disrupted in several areas.

title: Wasn't expecting Umesh Yadav to smash Boult for 19 runs: Buttler
body: RR's Jos Buttler said he wasn't expecting KKR pacer Umesh Yadav to smash Trent Boult around in the 18th over of their match on Monday. Umesh came in when KKR needed 38 runs to win in the final three overs and smashed two sixes and a four as KKR scored 20 runs in that over. KKR lost by seven runs.

title: Conor McGregor shares pics of his physical transformation over the years
body: Former UFC featherweight and lightweight champion Conor McGregor took to Instagram to share pictures of his physical transformation over the years. "Climb the ladder," he captioned the post. "That’s actually insane the way he was able to dominate different weight classes like that," a fan commented on the post. "2014-2016 was the golden age," another fan wrote.

title: 'Jayeshbhai...' will change definition of heroism on-screen: Ranveer
body: Actor Ranveer Singh has said that his upcoming film 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' will change the definition of heroism on-screen. "Hopefully, [it will] leave an important message to people in the most entertaining and hilarious fashion," he stated. Speaking about his character in the film, Ranveer said, "He is quick-witted and he has his heart in the right place."

title: Anywhere with you: Athiya Shetty wishes boyfriend KL Rahul on b'day
body: Actress Athiya Shetty wished her boyfriend, cricketer KL Rahul on his 30th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Athiya posted several monochrome photos of them. In the first picture, Athiya is seen holding KL Rahul as they posed for the camera. Alongside the post, she wrote, "Anywhere with you, happy birthday." Reacting to the post, KL Rahul commented, "Love you."

title: Leopard climbing tree with prey langur falls to death in MP
body: A leopard reportedly lost her balance and fell to death while climbing a 25-foot tree with her prey, a langur, in the Pench Tiger Reserve in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. The carcasses of both the animals were found on Monday morning. An official said that the leopard, aged around eight to 10 years, had her ribs and backbone broken.

title: Can't ignore work: Bharti to trolls who criticised her for working post-pregnancy
body: Comedian-host Bharti Singh reacted to trolls who criticised her for working post-pregnancy. She reportedly said that she's not an angel who can rest forever. She added there are a lot of working women who leave their one-week-old kids at home to resume work. Bharti further said there are work commitments that one cannot ignore, hence work has to be resumed.

title: Pakistan President refuses to administer oath to new cabinet: Reports
body: The oath-taking ceremony of the new Pakistan federal cabinet has been postponed after President Arif Alvi reportedly refused to administer the oath to them. A notification revealed the names of 30 federal ministers who were to take oath in PM Shehbaz Sharif-led federal cabinet. Imran Khan was removed as Pakistan PM after he lost the no-trust vote against him.

title: Woman takes front seat to let Uber driver offer namaz in the back seat; pic viral
body:
A Mumbai woman's post about taking the front seat to let her Uber driver offer namaz in the back seat during Ramadan has gone viral. 
"Azaan started playing on the driver's mobile...I asked him, 'Do you want to pay namaz?' and he asked, 'Can I?',” wrote Priya Singh. She added, "We parked the car on the roadside for his prayers."

title: Police lathi-charge PHE daily wage workers during protest in J&K
body: Jammu and Kashmir police on Monday lathi-charged some Public Health Engineering (PHE) daily wage workers during their protest for regularisation and release of pending wages in Jammu. The protesters were intercepted by police while they were marching towards Raj Bhawan. "BJP government has betrayed us and if they fail to fulfil our demands...then we'll stop supplying water," a protester said.

title: I was completely terrified, my heart was racing: Suryakumar on Kohli sledging him
body: Talking about Virat Kohli sledging him in an IPL 2020 match, Suryakumar Yadav said, "His sledging was on another level." "I was chewing gum and looked composed...but on the inside I was completely terrified. My heart was racing," he added. "The voice inside me was screaming [to myself], 'Bro I beg you, please don't say anything'," Suryakumar further stated.

title: Zepto starts 10-min snacks delivery in Mumbai, CEO clarifies 'Not delivering food'
body: Zepto has started a 10-minute delivery of snacks in Mumbai. It has collaborated with restaurants such as Blue Tokai Coffee and Chaayos for the delivery of items like tea, coffee, and croissants, among others. Meanwhile, Aadit Palicha, CEO of Zepto clarified that they are not delivering food but only ready-to-drink coffee, tea, and packaged snacks.
